Inexpensive LED bulbs use approximately 80% to 95% less electricity than standard bulbs. But they do have limitations...LED bulbs are much more sensitive to voltage. You must check your power supply with a voltmeter to make sure it is outputting between 10.5 and 13.5 volts. Many halogen power supplies produce much more voltage (I have measured 20 volts on some "12 volt" supplies). Too much voltage will cause a drastically shorter bulb life.LED bulbs don't always have the same physical dimensions as their regular bulb counterparts. Always measure the fixture to make sure the bulb fits. With this bulb the measurements are listed in one of the pictures, and also in the "product details" section.Many LEDs produce a brighter whiter harsher colored light. This one is color corrected to a warmer color, but at the expense of slightly less brightness.LED bulbs are more sensitive to lack of ventilation. They shouldn't be used in small enclosed fixtures (such as fixtures with glass lenses) or they will sometimes overheat and fail. (A quick fix is to remove the fixture's glass lens).If your environment is outside these limitations, then you may have to go with the much more expensive brand names that are more tolerant.But if you follow these guidelines, these are good LED lights that pay for themselves in no time with substantial electric bill savings.

Coconut oil imparts a very pleasant almost buttery flavor onto foods cooked with it.For frying it makes egg dishes noticeably better tasting, more flavorful in my opinion than cooking them in butter!As a popcorn flavoring it is very tasty (most theaters use a coconut based oil to cook their popcorn). Just cook your popcorn any way you like, then spray it with this and then sprinkle with salt. It will taste similar to theater popcorn.It is expensive, but a can goes a long way.As a side note, Coconut oil starts solidifying at approximately 76 degrees or below. If the nozzle clogs, just run it under warm/hot water and it will spray again.
Good price, kills random grass and weed growth perfectly.Just spray on, and in a day or two the weed/grass is dead, root and all.It will not grow back.Does not hurt most other plants.

I received this item from Pomarks for an unbiased review, and I must say - When I first opened it, I was wondering when in the world I would ever use such a device. You might be asking yourself the same thing, but I've discovered the practical uses for this thing will be endless, especially when it gets nicer here in Michigan and I can get back to my outdoor sports. I'd have to say, if you're frequently taking photos with your phone, this will be the best 20$ you've ever spent on phone accessories.CONNECTINGIt has bluetooth connectivity so that you don't have to worry about connecting cables, and the bluetooth connectivity is instant and easy. No need for pairing codes, simply switch the device to 'on' and look for it in your phone. It showed up as a keyboard device in android, because of the way it sends input to your phone similarly to a keyboard. Pairing was excellent, and I did mess around a bit with the range - You can still take pictures from over 30 feet away (not that you'd ever really need to do this, but it's an option if you're considering it for a remote). I'd imagine you will have no problem connecting to and using this camera with any bluetooth-enabled smartphone or smart camera.CONTROLSThere aren't many controls on this - on/off, and shutter. The shutter button is well-built and rubberized. It feels as if it's likely also water/sweat proof (in case you plan on taking this kayaking/cycling, like myself). The button is still clicky and responsive. When I snap a shot, it works just as fast as if I had just pressed the shutter button on my Galaxy S5. I really like the on/off switch vs a button that has to be held down to turn off/on. Also, the charging port is easily accessible on the bottom, rather than on a side. The port is always open and very easy to plug into. I have yet to charge it though, and have used the device on many occasions.BUILD QUALITYFor 20.00 retail price, I was extremely impressed with the build quality of this device, although, I didn't expect any less from Pomarks. I've always been happy with their engineering in the past. The telescoping rod works very well - it holds securely as you extend it, yet, it's not too difficult to sheath back to compact size. I really appreciated the clamping style for the phone, and it's very nice that they include an extra clip. I've tried products that 'clamp' onto my phone in the past, and have been very displeased. This device does not disappoint - it holds my rather big Galaxy S5 just fine with, or without its massive protective case. I have for it yet to even allow the phone to slip in the slightest. I put the device up to 10 feet above the ground, without fear of my phone falling and I think you will too. The rubberized and textured handle aids in making your phone feel secure - no real risk of dropping or the rod slipping out of your hand. While I don't think the arms are big enough to hold a Phablet (phone/tablet) or an iPad, it should fit all but the biggest of smartphones. It does have pads on the side that actually makes contact with the smartphone, and it's soft yet secure. Very well thought out design.Overall, I love this device. I can't wait to use it for taking kayaking pictures of my fiance and I. These were very hard photos to take ourselves before, but should be easily doable now. I also plan to make some clips so that I can mount it to my road bike for easy photos while we're on the move. To say that someone like me, who is overcautious about all of his expensive toys, smartphone included, will take this and hold it over cement on a moving bike or over the water, says a lot about the way it holds the phone. Highly recommended, I've looked around and I don't see anything better on the market for taking group pictures or activity selfies. I would include some pictures I've taken with it, but almost all of them are with family (it's so great for group pictures) that might not appreciate my doing so. Some of the other reviews do have great sample pictures, though. I may upload some of activities in the summer once it gets a bit nicer out, but this will be a hit for holiday photos!!

I'd like to state up front that I did receive this item for review from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for providing a 5-star or even a positive review. RAVPower was releasing this new gadget and wanted critical, honest feedback for their customers. This review is written without bias as if I had purchased this item for myself at full retail price.That being said, this wireless 'all in one' deserves a definite 5-stars. I have used and reviewed many of these types of units in the past, and while the opportunities and features for which you can use this item for are overwhelming, they all work exceptionally well.BUILD QUALITYThe build quality of the WD03 is as good as any of the other RAVPower units - Built very well and with the user in mind. This is one of my favorite form factors as it can easily fit in my back pocket or in many different pockets of my backpack. Built with high quality materials to last a long time.FILE BACKUPThe main intended use for this device (although there are many others) is for backing up files and photos from mobile or wireless-only devices that you want to free up space on. The reason this is wireless is for convenience - It's not like you can just plug a standard external hard drive or SD card into your phone, but the WD03 can provide the medium to do so! Just connect to it over the wireless network that it provides and transfer away! After you've moved all of your files to the SD or drive plugged into the RAVPower, you can delete them from your phone if you wish as they are already stored on the other unit. This is a convenient way to transfer, store, and save file space.SHARINGThis unit is also great for sharing files. Say you are having a company meeting where most users are using mobile tablets. These don't make file sharing very easily done if you just want to keep things local and private (without putting the files on the Internet). So you can send all of the files to the WD03 (think of it like a local NAS), and others can view and collaborate with the files on the WD03 after connecting.CHARGE OTHER UNITSLastly, on top of all of its networking features, this unit can also charge a phone or mobile USB device in a pinch! It's not meant for charging other units as a primary function, but if you're on a plane and your battery is running low, you can always use the WD03 to charge it up in a pinch. The 6000 MAH battery is actually enough to charge my S5 from empty to full twice! I'd imagine it will charge most smartphones from empty to full at least once, and probably twice under normal conditions. Quite the added benefit of carrying along this little guy!Excellent product overall - Many features - You just have to know what you want it for! RAVpower makes quality items and I know you won't be disappointed!

I received this sleeping bag for review during the last month or so (November) and boy was I glad I did. I was planning a bikepacking trip on my new fat bike, but only had one sleeping bag (was going with the wife). It was only a 50 mile round-trip expedition with one night of tent/hammock sleeping, but we don't do this sort of thing so it was a big deal to us.We rode the 25 miles to where we planned to setup camp. My bike was very difficult to pack because my sleeping bag was HUGE, meanwhile, my wife's EGOZ Easy to Carry Blue Sleeping bag was easily strapped to her handlebars with some lashing straps, while it was inside its carrying case. It is somewhat bulky, but takes up less than half the space of my old sleeping bag.We were quite cold when we were setting up camp, as the sun had set. Immediately after we got the tent up, we took cover and got into our sleeping bags. I noticed how much softer and warmer her bag was right away.I woke up with the sniffles and a cold. She woke up sweating. I'd imagine this sleeping bag could keep you cozy on down to 0 degrees based on that. The EGOZ bag was very warm, easy to pack and carry, and while not a minimalistic/hiking design, worked very great for this trip. I'd highly recommend it for how low the cost is, how well-made it is, and how toasty it can keep you.

I already have several cases for my S5, but I mostly bought this case because it was cheap and looked much different than my current case - I wanted to mix it up some.With no other reviews on the case, I took the leap, but it wasn't that expensive so I wasn't too concerned. The other reviewer stated that it didn't fit, but I'm convinced that he must have purchased the wrong case for his model phone, because this case works great on my Stock Galaxy S5.It's very similar to a few other 'brand name' cases - It's thin, protective, and made up of two pieces. The buttons and controls work flawlessly - I actually prefer the feedback feeling of the case to my much more expensive Otterbox and Ballistic cases. They're 'clicky' and very easy to press, yet they also don't activate all the time in my pocket.Another great feature is that the case is semi-slick, so it slides into and out of my pocket with ease. The rubbery cases tend to be a major inconvenience when trying to pocket/unpocket my phone as they stick to the sides and attract all kinds of lint and debris.I have yet to drop the phone with this case on it, but I'm quite sure it will fare a lot of falls very well with this case along with a tempered glass screen protector, as it covers all sides and angles of the phone that it could fall onto a flat surface on.This case looks, fits, and feels great. I'd recommend it to anyone who is considering the cases that are very similar, yet double to quadruple the cost. Excellent value.

I'm a big fan of having electronics with batteries that I can just swap out as they die or get close to doing so. Having to stop what I'm doing to recharge for a period of time is a real nuisance. First-world problems, right?I have tried many other battery sets for my GoPro, but this Sabrent two-pack is the best. The batteries have a capacity at least as good as the original OEM batteries, and they charge up quite quickly. I have not had any issues with charging or discharging these batteries in the 10-20 cycles I have put them through so far.The base/charger stand is also very intuitive, stable, and easy to use. The batteries charge up quick and are always ready when I need to swap to a spare. Highly recommended for heavy users of the GoPro. Make sure you grab the right model.

This battery lasts at least twice as long as the stock in my GoPro Hero 4, and is incredibly easy to use and charge.I find that it's built well, like all Sabrent products, and is seemingly quite lightweight for its capacity.I love that I can charge it with my standard USB cables, as I have them in nearly every place that I sit down, so I can even keep this charged at work.Highly recommended if battery life ever has become an issue (surely it has) with your GoPro Hero 4.

I'm very happy with this mount. I plan to use it to clip to my desk, or computer monitor, or other edges alongside my product review area to make more videos in the future. It's stable, very adjustable, and built very well, like all of Sabrent's products.It has a standard mounting screw so that you can attach nearly any digital camera with the standard mounting screw mechanism. Even without, you could quite easily rig something up.It's stable even when bent at extreme angles, so this will be great for doing repair videos as well. I can't wait to try it out more and would highly recommend it for recording videos where you need odd angles, or need to attach the camera to something stationary but not ideal for setting a camera on.

Ever wonder what life in the day of a dog was?With this mount and your GoPro, the possibilities are pretty endless. I have even thought about taking my dog for a walk next to me on my mountain bike, so that he could get some sweet footage of me (while I also have a helmet-mounted camera going) and the environment as a side-by-side video.I haven't gotten around to this, but I will post a video here if it's relevant enough.As for the fit and construction, I am very happy. It fits my ~20 lb beagle very well, but is adjustable to fit a dog quite a bit larger or smaller.Very happy with this for the price!

This case fits my Raspberry Pi perfectly - installation was easy and it is well-vented, well-constructed, and will add a lot of options for me.I plan to use it to mount to the back of one of my older LEDTV's to create a 'Smart TV' (Likely based on Plex) from my 'Dumb Tv'.I have not yet gotten around to this, but will update on my mounting strategy. So far it looks like it will be very simple.

I'd like to state up front that I did receive these headphones for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for writing a 5-star or even a positive review. QCY was releasing a new pair of headphones and wanted my honest, critical feedback to be provided to other customers on the market deciding if these are the headphones for them. This review is written as if I have paid full price for this item and is not bias.That being said, these are some great headphones and you won't notice much difference in quality with these being wireless, and especially not for the very low price. Like other reviewers have stated, these have some great volume, are easy to connect to, and have some decent sound output for the price. There are many other builds on the market that you'll see that are very similar to these, but QCYmakes a quality product and I've been very happy with it.These have become my 'daily drivers' for exercising: Trips to the gym for lifting, running, and cycling outdoors have been made much more pleasant with these. They get plenty loud enough even in a noisy gym or with lots of wind on the bike. They have plenty enough battery life to last me even the longest of bike rides.Fit has also been excellent. A problem for me with many pairs of earbuds is that they just can't seem to fit properly. If you have any fit issues with these out of the box, I'd advise trying bigger ear tips. Most people try to use tips that are too small since they're easier to insert, but you generally get a better 'seal' if you use the bigger size.While on topic of 'seal', these do provide an excellent seal for me once I found the combination that works best for my ear shape & size. With the included tips, most external sound is isolated even when playing music through the ear buds on very low volume. It also gives incredibly deep, powerful bass - So I can't advise enough to make sure you that you have the optimal fit before coming to a conclusion on the sound quality of these buds!Overall these are a great unit. You can't go wrong for the value and functionality at this price.

I bought this phone holster because I wanted an easy, secure way to hold my Galaxy S5 in my car. I had tried a few universal sets from local department stores, but they use a different clamp style, and they simply do not hold the phone securely. Not only did the other brands fail to hold the phone properly vertically, but the wheels on the back of the holster allowed it to tip around too easily. It was just too hard to use.I must say I'm very happy that I bought the Etekcity model. It takes care of all of those problems and makes mounting my phone much easier. I have this mounted to the dash in my Toyota Corolla, as the dash material is smooth enough for this to work. I prefer it there to the windshield, but it should work just fine on the windshield of any vehicle.The great thing is that this doesn't block the airflow like the air vent models, and stays nice and secure regardless of the cars motion (in my case). The form factor is excellent and it can clip in my Galaxy S5 (5.5" phone) even WITH my slim UAG case on it. It's really nice not to have to take the case off to get a good fit in the holster, as I can just grab my phone and go once I'm done in the car.Overall I'm very happy with the build quality and functionality of this phone holster. It holds my phone securely and reliable, is very easy to position, and it has made it much easier to use hands-free functionality of my phone while driving.

I bought this digital scale after having some issues with the built-in scale on my luggage that ended up causing me to get an overweight fee, when the indicator on the bag itself clearly said that the load was less than 50 lbs.I have used Etekcity scales and kitchen appliances in the past and have always had great luck with their accuracy and reliability, so I decided to go that route again and I'm glad that I did!This unit is very portable, lightweight, and easy to use. I can trust it to accurately state the weight of any piece of luggage I take to the airport, and it doubles as a scale for weighing packages that I mail out. I don't mail a whole lot of products - there may be more ideal scales for this - but it does the trick for me! I have mailed a few packages with it now, and none have been marked up for weight inaccuracy!I'm very happy with the build quality, portability, and accuracy of this unit. I'd recommend it to anyone who needs to measure luggage primarily, or packages. It has saved me at least one luggage overweight fee so far!

I decided to get this screen protector after breaking the screen on my Edge already. After having it replaced, I knew I needed to get some better protection for it. Most of the cases on the market do well for protecting the bezzels and back of the phone, but do not protect the face/screen from impact nor scratches.The LaoHe Premium Tempered Glass screen protector is the perfect solution. I have tried several other screen protectors that are made of film or other plastic/adhesive... And let me tell you - They are all junk. They make the phone's display feel awkward, get smudged up, and make the display appear to be lower resolution/clarity. It's not worth the minimal protection that these protectors offer.The LaoHe tempered glass screen protectors are completely different.EASY INSTALLATIONGlass screen protectors are even easier to install than the film ones. They don't bubble up, and they appear crystal clear once applied. To install, I simply cleaned the glass off (insure that there is no dust or other particles on the display), and lay the protector down flat - pressing in the middle and working my way to the edges. I have heard that if you mess up the installation and get some grit between the protector and the display that you can lift it up, remove the dust, and try again - However I never had that issue.SCRATCH PROOFBeing that this item was only a few dollars, I wasn't that concerned about ruining it. I attempted to scratch the screen protector with the edge of my car keys - No luck! It's at LEAST harder than steel (or whatever composite a car key may be made from). Highly impressed with its ability to protect against scratches. I've had it a few months now and the surface is still flawless.LOOK & FEELNot only does this glass keep the factory display quality of my Edge, but I feel that it actually *improves* the 'feel' of the phone's surface. That is, I prefer the way that the LaoHe makes my finger glide across the phone's touchscreen. Much better than stock, and far from that of the adhesive plastic screen protectors. No worries about this hindering the ability to see or use your phone as it was intended to be used - It will only improve it!SHOCK RESISTANCEThe main reason I bought this was to protect the glass of my display from shattering again if I drop it on its face. Of course, I use a slim protective case, but this wasn't enough last time. I have already dropped my phone once on its face (clumsy me - getting out of the car and it was in my lap) where it landed on concrete - Not even a scratch! I can't guarantee that the screen would have shattered, but it definitely would have scratched, and now, not even the screen protector is damaged!LIFETIME WARRANTYIf you have any issues with installation or if the glass is damaged, LaoHe will replace it for you. I have used LaoHe products in the past and I know for fact that they stand by their word. It is my respect for their customer service and quality product that has lead me to go out of my way to leave this positive review.You really can't go wrong with this protector. Great protection from a reliable company at a remarkably low price. I'm not even sure how they can afford to do this!

They don't bubble up, and they appear crystal clear once applied. To install, I simply cleaned the glass off (insure that there is no dust or other particles on the display), and lay the protector down flat - pressing in the middle and working my way to the edges. I have heard that if you mess up the installation and get some grit between the protector and the display that you can lift it up, remove the dust, and try again - However I never had that issue.SCRATCH PROOFBeing that this item was only a few dollars, I wasn't that concerned about ruining it. I attempted to scratch the screen protector with the edge of my car keys - No luck! It's at LEAST harder than steel (or whatever composite a car key may be made from). Highly impressed with its ability to protect against scratches. I've had it a few months now and the surface is still flawless.LOOK & FEELNot only does this glass keep the factory display quality of my iPhone, but I feel that it actually *improves* the 'feel' of the phone's surface. That is, I prefer the way that the LaoHe makes my finger glide across the phone's touchscreen. Much better than stock, and far from that of the adhesive plastic screen protectors. No worries about this hindering the ability to see or use your phone as it was intended to be used - It will only improve it!SHOCK RESISTANCEThe main reason I bought this was to protect the glass of my display from shattering again if I drop it on its face. Of course, I use a slim protective case, but this wasn't enough last time. I have already dropped my phone once on its face (clumsy me - getting out of the car and it was in my lap) where it landed on concrete - Not even a scratch! I can't guarantee that the screen would have shattered, but it definitely would have scratched, and now, not even the screen protector is damaged!LIFETIME WARRANTYIf you have any issues with installation or if the glass is damaged, LaoHe will replace it for you. I have used LaoHe products in the past and I know for fact that they stand by their word. It is my respect for their customer service and quality product that has lead me to go out of my way to leave this positive review.You really can't go wrong with this protector. Great protection from a reliable company at a remarkably low price. I'm not even sure how they can afford to do this!

I bought this bag to carry camping supplies with the occasional need to move around or pack up camp. I've also found it to be very handy for my fishing trips down to the local lake, where I can pack up everything into the bag and be quite mobile while not limiting myself to only part of my supplies, as it has quite a massive capacity while maintaining a convenient form factor that distributes the weight over your back, shoulders, and chest in a comfortable manner.Upon receiving I was very impressed with the quality of the backpack for the price. The materials appear to be very strong and well-built. The zippers do not snag, and the pockets hold tight. The bag has some 'structure' to it, so that it doesn't wilt even if you don't fill it in its entire massive capacity.I must say, that for being so spacious and so capable of carrying a lot of weight, it still remains comfortable. I think part of this is due to the rather slender design that helps to distribute the load weight across your entire back rather than creating hot spots like many other packs do. I think the slimmer, longer form factor also covers less of a portion of my back and therefore helps more airflow to circulate and makes the pack feel a little more comfortable to carry.I'm able to carry several tackle boxes, 2 collapsible fishing poles, several extra reels, live bait, a blanket, a collapsible tripod chair, and 2 water bottles into this backpack without much struggle. I could probably fit even more if I needed to. This is perfect as I can pack this up, drive down to within half a mile of the lake, and hike to the lake with the pack on. No more multiple trips and no more struggling to carry all of the gear in both hands. It also makes it a breeze to pick up and move to another section of the lake when I'm not having much luck.All in all I couldn't ask for a better backpack, especially for the price. I personally made this into a fishing backpack, but it would be great for day backpacking/hiking trips, camping, and various other uses. Built with quality, I figure this bag will last me several years if not indefinitely.

I bought this bag to carry camping supplies with the occasional need to move around or pack up camp. I've also found it to be very handy for my fishing trips down to the local lake, where I can pack up everything into the bag and be quite mobile while not limiting myself to only part of my supplies, as 70L is a massive capacity!Upon receiving I was very impressed with the quality of the backpack for the price. The materials appear to be very strong and well-built. The zippers do not snag, and the pockets hold tight. The bag has some 'structure' to it, so that it doesn't wilt even if you don't fill it in its entire massive 70L capacity.I must say, that for being so spacious and so capable of carrying a lot of weight, it still remains comfortable. I think part of this is due to the rather slender design that helps to distribute the load weight across your entire back rather than creating hot spots like many other packs do. I think the slimmer, longer form factor also covers less of a portion of my back and therefore helps more airflow to circulate and makes the pack feel a little more comfortable to carry.I'm able to carry several tackle boxes, 2 collapsible fishing poles, several extra reels, live bait, a blanket, a collapsible tripod chair, and 2 water bottles into this backpack without much struggle. I could probably fit even more if I needed to. This is perfect as I can pack this up, drive down to within half a mile of the lake, and hike to the lake with the pack on. No more multiple trips and no more struggling to carry all of the gear in both hands. It also makes it a breeze to pick up and move to another section of the lake when I'm not having much luck.Being that I'm not a backpacker, I'm not sure that I'll ever fill this bag to its maximum capacity! I do enjoy using it for fishing, cycling, and walks, but I will plan to keep it around in the event I ever plan to do bikepacking (backpacking long distances by fat bike or mountain bike), as that has been a long time dream of mine and the G4Free bag may make it possible to carry more gear than I'd ever thought possible. The other nice thing about having a massive 70L capacity bag on your back is that you don't necessarily have to have expensive, ultra lightweight, ultra compact backpacking-specific gear, as not everyone can afford stuff like that. Excellent thinking on G4Free's end.All in all I couldn't ask for a better backpack, especially for the price. I personally made this into a fishing backpack, but it would be great for day backpacking/hiking trips, camping, and various other uses. Built with quality, I figure this bag will last me several years if not indefinitely.

I purchased this bag because I have a big love for my G4Free 40L bag for taking items fishing, camping or hiking, but it just doesn't make sense to take my huge backpack when all I want to carry are a few gadgets or devices. I bought this with the intention of carrying essentials on long walks/hikes.Some items that I have began to carry regularly in this handy little pack: Smart phone, spare batteries, flash light, wallet, keys, first aid items, bug spray, sunblock, and a few other odds and ends. While maintaining a small form factor, it can still hold quite a few of these smaller items with ease.Because of the form factor and the way the strap is setup, the bag is nearly weightless (seemingly) even when packed tight. This may be due to being used to much larger G4Free backpacks for carrying massive quantities of gear, but they did this bag right, too!What's also nice is that you can easily carry this leg pack whilst carrying a much heavier, larger backpack, and keep the additional weight off your back. You can carry small, heavy items in the leg pouch and help save your back from carrying the weight.Best of all is that the material is quality and durable. I'd imagine this bag will outlast my enthusiasm for the nature sports - even if it takes decades! I'm very happy with the build quality of this bag just like I have been with all of the G4Free bags that I have either purchased or received for review purposes.Many other reviewers are using this for carrying camera equipment, food, fishing tackle, emergency supplies, and more... What will YOU use it for?

I'd like to state up front that I did, in fact, receive this item from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest, critical review. I was not required nor given incentive for providing a 5-star review - The manufacturer was releasing this new item and wanted to get quality consumer feedback for potential shoppers on Amazon. This review is written as if I have purchased the item for full retail price myself, and is not bias.That being said, this case is worth a definite 5-stars. I love the build quality and design of the product, and was quite surprised how low the retail price of the item is despite how great of quality it's made with.Being that you're probably on the market looking for several other cases for your iPad or tablet otherwise and are reading several reviews for several different cases, I will shorten this up and let you know what I liked best about the K&F Concept case.LIGHTWEIGHTThis case is very minimal and lightweight but still gets the job done. No excessive bulk or weight to carry around like many other cases may offer.ATTRACTIVE DESIGNLooks great, stays clean, and isn't going to attract attention to your device.SNUG FITI'm personally using this for my iPad Air and it fits it quite well, but I'd imagine it will fit most tablets up to 10 inches without any issues.EXCELLENT BUILD QUALITYThe stitching and zipper, as well as overall thickness of this product are good indicators that this item was made with care and will not only protect your iPad/tablet well, but will also likely last a lifetime.Overall this is a great case that I'd recommend to anyone who would like a soft, universal tablet case that protects without adding excessive bulk.

I bought these primarily to replace an older pair of cloth gloves that we use for removing pans from the oven when they're obviously much too hot to grab. In the few weeks we have owned these, we've found many more uses for them than just grabbing hot pans and cookie sheets!They've also been great for grabbing eggs from boiling water (as pictured - no need to dump out the water and hope you don't break the shells), and the included tools have made grilling far easier. When the grill gets really full of meat or whatever else you're cooking, it can get hard to maneuver and handle the food using just tongs or a spatula. The addition of these gloves not only makes it far easier, but allows for more control!These are built very well and I have not had any issues with them melting or breaking down, despite subjecting to some pretty extreme direct and indirect heat. I feel like they will hold up for a very long time. I wish they came in other colors, but for now we'll still with these ones! We'll definitely buy a second or third pair if they come out with variations :)

I'd like to state up front that I did in fact receive this item from iClever for review purposes. I was not instructed nor given incentive to provide a 5-star or even a positive review. iClever was launching this new product and wanted my critical feedback so that it could be given to other potential consumers. I am writing this review as if I had purchased this unit at the full retail price, and is my honest opinion.That being said, this is a definite 5-star item. It's excellent for all of the functions that I wanted it for. I wanted this unit because all of the other bluetooth receivers I had tried in my car either wouldn't stay in the jack, had an abnormally large form factor, didn't have great controls, or just plain sounded terrible! For that reason, I'm going to lay out for you plain and simple all of the best features and functions of this device and why it is my new favorite (the one that stays in the Aux jack in my car!)AUDIO QUALITYAudio quality is not sacrificed when switching to bluetooth receiving in this device. It still sounds as if I have a wired connection to my vehicle's aux port! The impedence is also very low, so the volume gets just as high as if I had connected my phone via a wired connection.EASE OF INSTALLATIONSome bluetooth devices out there really make it a pain to connect and stay connected. With the iClever, the first time I plugged it in and started my car up, it entered pairing mode. I saw it and paired to it with my phone in just about 10 seconds. From there, every time I turn on my car (so long as my phone is in range and in bluetooth) it automatically pairs and is ready to stream audio or phone calls.BUILD QUALITY / FORM FACTORThis is my absolute favorite thing about this item. Many other receivers are bulky and don't like to stay plugged in, or otherwise get in the way all the time. Not with the iClever unit! I just plug it in, automatically connect (Bluetooth will find it after you pair once) and drive away! Once the unit is already plugged in, all I have to do is turn my car on and my phone will automatically connect and begin streaming any sound to my vehicle (granted, my phone's Bluetooth radio is on). Awesome!HANDS FREE CALLSMost bluetooth receivers on the market today do have microphones in them so that you can make and take calls as well, but the iClever unit really does it right. It seems to really eliminate road noise and background sounds in the car and still pick up my voice, even when I'm only talking at a tone like I'm speaking to the person next to me (not intentionally speaking louder right at the receiver). This makes taking calls easy and preferred to picking up the phone or using a bluetooth receiver. Take note also, that the on-board controls also work for picking up / hanging up and muting the call!Overall this is a great little bluetooth receiver that I'd recommend to anyone who is trying to add bluetooth functionality to a vehicle WITH AUX! If you do not have aux in your car, this little guy won't work and you'll probably want to get a bluetooth>FM transmitter so that you can tune in with your radio.Please 'helpful' this review if it has assisted you!

YOPO, the manufacturer, was just looking for critical, honest feedback for this new item they were releasing to inform potential shoppers on Amazon. This review is written as if I have paid full retail price for the item and is not bias.That being said, I feel that for the price and quality of this item, it deserves a definite 5-stars. I didn't have a whole lot of space to place this chalkboard in my own house for testing, so I gave it to my little brother (Who is 5 and LOVES things like these) and we hung it up in his bedroom. He already had a small chalkboard easel but this was so much better because it gave him more space and was available easily on the wall without creating a mess everywhere else.Installation was very easy and straight-forward. Very easy to press onto the wall and I had no issues with bubbles, despite the wall behind it not being perfectly even. Within minutes, Matt was away to writing his alphabet and coloring in random objects he's learned to draw at daycare!I attempted to peel back the chalkboard from the wall, just curious if it would be difficult to remove or leave behind a lot of residue. Much to my surprise, while it's secure enough to not come off by accident, it comes off quite easily - All in one piece and without leaving behind a sticky mess! We will leave it up of course, but it's great to know this isn't going to ruin the paint or finish on the wall behind it!Overall this is a great product. I'd recommend it for far more uses than we have found for it - I love the idea of dedicating the side of a cupboard for it (as indicated in the pictures). I'd imagine a use like that would work fine!!

I'd like to state up front that I did receive this item for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive to provide a 5-star review - The manufacturer was releasing this new product and needed critical, honest feedback for potential shoppers on Amazon. This review is written as if I have paid full retail price for the item myself.That being said, I'm very happy with the quality of this brush set and it is fully deserving of a 5-star review! While this item is relatively inexpensive and simple, I still think it is better than the competition. I gave this set to my wife and she's very happy with it. Here are some key points that she loves:EXCELLENT FOR TRAVELThis product was really designed with portability and travel in mind. All of the brushes stow away into a container hardly bigger than a tampon, and are extremely easy to carry around with your makeup or travel bag. My wife even tosses it into her gym bag for in between the gym and going to work.BUILD QUALITYThese items are built with excellent quality. The brushes are thick and durable, and the container is heavy-duty for the price. It feels like these brushes will hold up far longer than the competing products we have tried, which remind me of some 'Fisher Price' paint brushes or something that will likely snap and already flex a lot.Overall I'm very happy with this item. My wife has already referred two of her friends to grab these for their makeup collections - She's happy with and swears by it!

I bought this phone holster because I wanted an easy, secure way to hold my Galaxy S5 in my car. I had tried a few universal sets from local department stores, but they use a different clamp style, and they simply do not hold the phone securely. Not only did the other brands fail to hold the phone properly vertically, but the wheels on the back of the holster allowed it to tip around too easily. It was just too hard to use.I must say I'm very happy that I bought the Gaoyi model. It takes care of all of those problems and makes mounting my phone much easier. I have this mounted to the air vent in my 2012 Toyota Corolla, and it works great. It may not mount to all air vents, however, especially the round ones like in my wife's 2007 Pontiac G6. I would take note if you have that kind of air vents that this still may work in other locations, but probably will not mount properly to that type of air vent.The great thing is that this doesn't block the airflow and it stays nice and secure to the vent even if I move it around to redirect airflow. The form factor is excellent and it can clip in my Galaxy S5 (5.5" phone) even WITH my slim UAG case on it. It's really nice not to have to take the case off to get a good fit in the holster, as I can just grab my phone and go once I'm done in the car.Overall I'm very happy with the build quality and functionality of this phone holster. It holds my phone securely and reliable, is very easy to position, and it has made it much easier to use hands-free functionality of my phone while driving.

Id like to state up front that I did in fact, receive this product for review purposes from Ecandy. I was not required nor given incentive to provide a 5-star or even a positive review for this item. I was asked to provide potential consumers with my personal, critical feedback on the item regardless of whether or not it was positive.That being said, Id like to make it clear that I have rated this item with a 5-star rating as if I had purchased it for the full retail price myself. This light system is extremely high quality (especially given the price) for what I intend to use it for. I have never had any issues with any Ecandy products  neither products Ive received for review purposes nor the ones I have purchased directly. Its nice to know, though, that Ecandy does stand behind all of their products if it comes to that.I wanted to use these lights for illuminating the path along the driveway up to the front door at my parents house. They wanted to get some garden lights, but for such a short path, and on a limited budget, these heavy duty solar lights were not required. I instead opted for this set from Ecandy because it was far easier to setup, included fewer parts, and was far less expensive.I couldnt be happier with the results! It turned out so well (across a 10 foot or so path from the driveway to the stairs, with some lights along the railing of the stairs), that I wish I had taken pictures. Unfortunately, they live a bit of a distance from me so it may be some time before I am able to.These are built well, shine bright with minimal solar charge throughout the day, and are an extremely cost effective way for me to show their guests the path and stairway at night. No more stumbling over the stairs/lawn carrying in groceries or other items late at night!

I'd like to state up front that I did receive these headphones for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for writing a 5-star or even a positive review. Aukey was releasing a new pair of headphones and wanted my honest, critical feedback to be provided to other customers on the market deciding if these are the headphones for them. This review is written as if I have paid full price for this item and is not bias.That being said, these are some great headphones and you won't notice much difference in quality with these being wireless, and especially not for the very low price. Like other reviewers have stated, these have some great volume, are easy to connect to, and have some decent sound output for the price. There are many other builds on the market that you'll see that are very similar to these, but Aukey makes a quality product and I've been very happy with it.These have become my 'daily drivers' for exercising: Trips to the gym for lifting, running, and cycling outdoors have been made much more pleasant with these. They get plenty loud enough even in a noisy gym or with lots of wind on the bike. They have plenty enough battery life to last me even the longest of bike rides.Fit has also been excellent. A problem for me with many pairs of earbuds is that they just can't seem to fit properly. If you have any fit issues with these out of the box, I'd advise trying bigger ear tips. Most people try to use tips that are too small since they're easier to insert, but you generally get a better 'seal' if you use the bigger size.While on topic of 'seal', these do provide an excellent seal for me once I found the combination that works best for my ear shape & size. With the included tips, most external sound is isolated even when playing music through the ear buds on very low volume. It also gives incredibly deep, powerful bass - So I can't advise enough to make sure you that you have the optimal fit before coming to a conclusion on the sound quality of these buds!Overall these are a great unit. You can't go wrong for the value and functionality at this price.

I bought this phone holster because I wanted an easy, secure way to hold my Galaxy S5 in my car. I had tried a few universal sets from local department stores, but they use a different clamp style, and they simply do not hold the phone securely. Not only did the other brands fail to hold the phone properly vertically, but the wheels on the back of the holster allowed it to tip around too easily. It was just too hard to use.I must say I'm very happy that I bought the Aukey model. It takes care of all of those problems and makes mounting my phone much easier. I have this mounted to the small CD player in my 2012 Toyota Corolla, and it works great. Id imagine that this should work in nearly all CD players  even aftermarket.The great thing is that this doesn't block the airflow like the air vent models, and stays nice and secure regardless of the cars motion (in my case). The form factor is excellent and it can clip in my Galaxy S5 (5.5" phone) even WITH my slim UAG case on it. It's really nice not to have to take the case off to get a good fit in the holster, as I can just grab my phone and go once I'm done in the car.Overall I'm very happy with the build quality and functionality of this phone holster. It holds my phone securely and reliable, is very easy to position, and it has made it much easier to use hands-free functionality of my phone while driving.

I'd like to state up front that I did, in fact, receive this item for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive to provide a 5-star review for this item. AKDY was releasing this new showerhead and wanted honest, critical feedback whether it was positive or negative.That being said, I do believe this item is worth a definite 5-stars. Not only because it's a great showerhead that has performed at or above expectations, but because I'm also baffled that they're able to sell it for a measly 9.99. A similar item would go for over double at any of my local department or hardware stores.This showerhead is made of a soft yet durable ABS material, and is of excellent build quality. It was very easy to install and does not leak or have gaps in the fitting. It looks elegant and expensive, in my opinion - Not like some cheap showerhead I got on Amazon that was made in Japan.Once I actually used the showerhead, I was even more impressed. It has two output options - either your standard 'shower' stream where the water jets from the various small holes over the head, or, the 'waterfall' mode where the water jets from the slit at the edge of the showerhead. This mode feels and looks great! It has even gotten a few 'WOW's from guests that stayed overnight and used the shower downstairs.It's very easy to switch between the two options, with the responsive buttons at the 'bottom' of the head (depending on orientation) but they're very easy to find and work quickly as they are likely just physical buttons that block off waterflow as you press them.Overall this is a great unit and I'd recommend it for its build quality, price, and multiple options for a shower!

I bought this light for use inside my closet, which is kind of a small walk-in closet, but is positioned in a way in the room that almost no natural light or light from the ceiling bulbs really enters. It's very difficult to see in there, especially at night. I really wanted this light so that I could mount it in the back with ease, and it would come on only as I needed it.I must say, I've been quite happy with it and it was well worth the small price tag. The build quality is even better than I expected. Ecandy normally does a great job in crafting quality items for such a low price. It looks like a premium product that I'd pay 40+$ for.The best feature of this is that it's battery operated and motion-detecting. There's no need to run cords, punch holes in the wall, etc. Very easy to mount and use - Just mount it up and put batteries in it. From there, each time I open my closet door, the light turns on. It emits a yellowish, very bright, non-harsh light that makes it quite easy to see everything in my closet. The light disperses quite well and is definitely designed for adding light to tight spaces.The fact that the light is constructed with 80,000 hour LED's is even better! LED's are much more power efficient and tend to put off a brighter, longer lasting light. I have not yet worn out a pair of batteries in the unit and I've been using it every day for about a month. I'd imagine that, since these are LED's, they'll last a few months without needing to change the batteries, based on my use.Overall this is a great item and I'd recommend it to anyone who needs to add some light quickly and easily, in an attractive form factor, to any part of their home - inside or outside!

I bought this unit as a gift for my little brother, who loves to have sound and light as he goes to sleep. He has a similar item but it's growing old and this seemed to be of a much better design and quality than the unit that we paid almost triple the price for locally.So far he's very happy with it! Setup was a breeze and the lights are much more colorful and bright than the previous unit. You can hook up your own music device to it as well but we have not done this yet. What a nice extra feature that they added iPod/Mp3 input and a speaker...I was really surprised with the build quality of the projector - I didn't expect a cheap 20.00 light to be built so well and durable.Overall, I'd recommend this to anyone interested in it. It's definitely worth its value and is a great addition to any room at night!

I bought this engine diagnostic tool to figure out why in the world my 2012 Corolla check engine light kept coming on, even when there were no issues detectable anywhere! Everything seemed to be in tip-top shape with no issues anywhere - ride smooth and no clunks or clinks!After receiving this diagnostic device (shipped fast - Thanks!), I hooked up to my Android phone (Galaxy S5 but it seems that it'd be compatible with far more devices due to wireless connectivity), and within just a few minutes I was hooked up to the car and I had a code, which I was able to define as 'Check Gas Cap'!As it turns out, my gas cap was on loose. Not sure how I managed to do that for two tanks of gas in a row, but surely enough, re-tightening the gas cap and clearing the check engine light made this device not able to find the code anymore and the light never came back on.Saved me quite a bit of time and potentially a trip to the mechanic where they may have tried to sell me something more I didn't need! I also saw it gave other useful information about my vehicle through the application - Like Tire Pressure, Fuel Level, and a few other odds and ends. Of course, this would vary based on the sensors of your vehicle as this device does no magic.Overall it has already paid for itself in the first week of ownership. Very easy to install and use, and I can't wait to help others with their vehicle diagnostics!

I'd like to state up front that I did receive this item for review from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for providing a 5-star or even a positive review. RAVPower was releasing this new gadget and wanted critical, honest feedback for their customers. This review is written without bias as if I had purchased this item for myself at full retail price.That being said, this wireless 'all in one' deserves a definite 5-stars. I have used and reviewed many of these types of units in the past, and while the opportunities and features for which you can use this item for are overwhelming, they all work exceptionally well.BUILD QUALITYThe build quality of the WD01 is as good as any of the other RAVPower units - Built very well and with the user in mind. This is one of my favorite form factors as it can easily fit in my back pocket or in many different pockets of my backpack. Built  with high quality materials to last a long time.FILE BACKUPThe main intended use for this device (although there are many others) is for backing up files and photos from mobile or wireless-only devices that you want to free up space on. The reason this is wireless is for convenience - It's not like you can just plug a standard external hard drive or SD card into your phone, but the WD01 can provide the medium to do so! Just connect to it over the wireless network that it provides and transfer away! After you've moved all of your files to the SD or drive plugged into the RAVPower, you can delete them from your phone if you wish as they are already stored on the other unit. This is a convenient way to transfer, store, and save file space.SHARINGThis unit is also great for sharing files. Say you are having a company meeting where most users are using mobile tablets. These don't make file sharing very easily done if you just want to keep things local and private (without putting the files on the Internet). So you can send all of the files to the WD01 (think of it like a local NAS), and others can view and collaborate with the files on the WD01 after connecting.CHARGE OTHER UNITSLastly, on top of all of its networking features, this unit can also charge a phone or mobile USB device in a pinch! It's not meant for charging other units as a primary function, but if you're on a plane and your battery is running low, you can always use the WD01 to charge it up in a pinch.Excellent product overall - Many features - You just have to know what you want it for! RAVpower makes quality items and I know you won't be disappointed!

I'd like to state up front that I did receive this charger for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for writing a 5-star or even a positive review. ZeroLemon was releasing a charger and wanted my honest, critical feedback to be provided to other customers on the market deciding if this charger is for them. This review is written as if I have paid full price for this item and is not bias.That being said, this item definitely deserves a full 5 stars. There isn't a whole lot to say about a charger, but I'd like to let you know a few of the key points that make this an excellent value:FORM FACTORThe form factor of this charger is one of my favorite features. It looks much better than all of the cheap Chinese knockoff versions of OEM chargers. It looks great, fits into the wall with ease, and feels like it is of great quality that will outlast any phone you charge it with.SPEEDIt charges as fast as my OEM charger! I am using this with a Galaxy S5. Take note that even if you're charging a USB 3.0 phone with the included 2.0 cable, charging speed will not be reduced from using the OEM cable as 3.0 only affects data transfer speeds when plugged into a computer. However, you can always use a USB 3.0 cable with this charger, as they are detachable - It just isn't included.EFFICIENCYWhile this not play a major role to most, I love how efficient this charger is. I know it's more efficient than the other brands I was testing because it doesn't get hot when charging for long periods of time, and also doesn't make that high-frequency noise when in use. These are signs of a cheap charger and the ZeroLemon does none of it!Overall, this is a great charger that has become my go-to charger for the bedroom due to its reliability and design. I would recommend this charger to anyone in need of a replacement or alternative/secondary charger for any phone that can be charged via a USB wall charger.

I'd like to preface this review by stating that I did, in fact, receive this item for review purposes from Muber. I was not required nor given incentive to provide a 5-star or even a positive review. I was asked to provide critical, honest feedback on a new item for potential customers on Amazon. This review is written as if I have purchased the item at full retail price for myself.That being said, this case deserves a full 5-stars, especially given the price point. Since you may be shopping for several other cases on the market for your GoPro and accessories, I'd like to point out what I really loved about this case in short, to help you shorten your shopping time.Compatibility: This case has listed compatibility for GoPro 4/3+/3/2/1. It should fit most of the cameras! I personally use it with my GoPro 4 and the fit is snug and secure. I really feel like my camera is secure in this case and can carry several accessories as well.Build Quality: The build quality of this case is impressive for the cost. The outer shell is soft, but durable enough to protect against drops and bruises. I'd also like to add that the case is extremely lightweight, so you'll really only feel the weight of the camera and whatever other accessories you like to keep with it (spare batteries, lenses, stands, straps, etc.)Room for accessories: As mentioned above, there are plenty of slots for lenses, straps, stands, spare batteries, and many other items that you can easily fit in the slots near the camera. I also like to carry a microfiber cloth and some disposable lens cleaner wipes in the mesh pocket above the camera.Overall this is a great case for the GoPro line and I'd recommend it to anyone looking to carry their camera & accessories in style with protection.

I'd like to state up front that I did receive these headphones for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for writing a 5-star or even a positive review. AngLink was releasing a new pair of headphones and wanted my honest, critical feedback to be provided to other customers on the market deciding if these are the headphones for them. This review is written as if I have paid full price for this item and is not bias.That being said, these are some great headphones and you won't notice much difference in quality with these being wireless, and especially not for the very low price. Like other reviewers have stated, these have some great volume, are easy to connect to, and have some decent sound output for the price. There are many other builds on the market that you'll see that are very similar to these, but AngLink makes a quality product and I've been very happy with it.These have become my 'daily drivers' for exercising: Trips to the gym for lifting, running, and cycling outdoors have been made much more pleasant with these. They get plenty loud enough even in a noisy gym or with lots of wind on the bike. They have plenty enough battery life to last me even the longest of bike rides.Fit has also been excellent. A problem for me with many pairs of earbuds is that they just can't seem to fit properly. If you have any fit issues with these out of the box, I'd advise trying bigger ear tips. Most people try to use tips that are too small since they're easier to insert, but you generally get a better 'seal' if you use the bigger size.While on topic of 'seal', these do provide an excellent seal for me once I found the combination that works best for my ear shape & size. With the included tips, most external sound is isolated even when playing music through the ear buds on very low volume. It also gives incredibly deep, powerful bass - So I can't advise enough to make sure you that you have the optimal fit before coming to a conclusion on the sound quality of these buds!Overall these are a great unit. You can't go wrong for the value and functionality at this price.

I bought this product because, as others have stated, the factory cradle for the Fit Bit Flex can sometimes, for whatever reason, be very hard to fit in. The one that I received with my Flex *worked* but it took some force to get it into the cradle. Couple that with the fact that the flex doesn't come with (at least mine didn't) the AC wall adapter, and you have yourself a winner with the Arrela charging cable cradle with AC adapter.While you could probably use another AC adapter for USB output that you have just lying around, you never know the correct voltage/amperage and you don't want to risk damaging the FitBit. That and USB slots on a computer aren't always available, so the Arrela combination works out really well for me as I typically just leave the AC plugged into the wall in the bathroom with the cradle hanging from it. I never forget to grab my Fitbit from it as I leave the house because I see it immediately in the bathroom as I leave.The Arrela cradle also resolves the issue of poor fit. Strangely enough, this unit is actually built to spec better than the OEM equivalent. Charging works reliably and quickly both with the AC adapter or by plugging the Arrela cradle into a PC or Mac. I've had no issues with it since purchasing and it has replaced the one that the Flex came with!

I'd like to state up front that I did receive these headphones for review purposes from the manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for writing a 5-star or even a positive review. Axgio was releasing a new pair of headphones and wanted my honest, critical feedback to be provided to other customers on the market deciding if these are the headphones for them. This review is written as if I have paid full price for this item and is not bias.That being said, I do find that these headphones are worth a definite 5 stars. I have used and reviewed MANY pairs of bluetooth headphones (we're talking 20+). Honestly, the headphones that these best compare to on the market are the Blue Buds X by Jay Bird. These are 150+$ headphones that are known for being top-end. The Axgio actually compare and in some cases, improve upon many of the features of the Blue Buds X.SOUND QUALITYThe sound quality of these headphones is exceptional. If you get a great seal (using the correct tips and proper insertion), bass is excellent as well as sound isolation. These are 'sound isolating' in that they dampen all external sounds when you have them in. If you have these sealed well in your ear with some light music playing, you are unlikely to be able to be able to hear someone talking to you right next to you. I've found it also does a great job of blocking out treadmill noise and other sound at the gym.FORM FACTORThe form factor and fit of these headphones has made them my primary 'active' headphones (the ones I use for cycling, lifting, running, etc.) This is because not only do they fit nice and comfortably, but they're also water/sweat proof to some degree, and also stay in very well. One of the biggest problems with my other headphones would be that even if they stayed in my ear decently, if the cable moves around (running) or gets snagged or my head moves (sit ups) the buds would pull out from my ears. With the form factor of the Axgio Sprint, the cable wraps around your ear. All cable pulls are absorbed by your ear and do not yank the buds from your ears! This makes them highly effective for exercise, while still remaining quite comfortable and great-fitting.CONTROLSIn-line controls are where it's at. The bluetooth earbuds that place the controls on the earbuds themselves are terrible by design. Imagine having to press the buds into your ears with difficult-to-press buttons each and every time you want to change the song. Annoying! Axgio did it right by moving the control panel to a spot in the line itself. This is easy to reach whether you have the cable behind your head or running down your chest/neck area. They're very responsive, intuitive, and easy to use.BLUETOOTH CONNECTIVITYI haven't had this issue with many, but with some cheap BT headphones you'll have issues either with pairing or with staying connected. Neither were an issue with the Sprint - Simply turn on, connect once, and then each and every time you turn them on they'll automatically connect to your phone if it is nearby. I've never had any issue with the headphones disconnecting while in use.BATTERY LIFEIn terms of listening to music (my primary use) the battery life is, as advertised, about 6-8 hours on average for me. If listening at full volume, the battery life may be closer to 6-7 hours, but it is very close to 8 if listening at a reasonable level with your phone placed not too far from the headphones. This is more than enough for me, as I never listen even close to that much in a day. I generally recharge the headphones about once a week on average.Overall these are a great pair of bluetooth buds, especially if you plan to use them for sports/exercise. They have a great form factor, are secure in the ear, and have excellent audio quality to top it all off!

I bought this stand primarily to make charging my Apple watch easier while making the face more accessible while it is charging. For the price, I couldn't have asked for more. It's sturdy, cosmetically appealing, and the cable was very easy to run through it. The cable remains snug and in-place even after moving it around on my night stand.The best feature is that I'm able to look at charging status and other items on the display of the watch while it's charging in the upright position rather than just sitting on my nightstand. It will likely prevent scratches and damage in the long run, and makes charging much less of a hassle.There's not much more I have to say about such a simple item - other than I'd recommend it for the reasons above!

I bought this selfie stick because I was looking for an affordable secondary unit to keep in my Camelbak backpack that I use for cycling. While I liked the selfie stick that I already had, I was always forgetting to bring it on my group cycling trips because it was packed away in my camping gear. I wanted this unit because it was affordable and wouldn't require a charger, since it wasn't wireless, and would therefore always be ready for use without any maintenance or charging.What I found was that this stick was even better than my other unit which cost twice as much! Since it isn't wireless, not only does it not require charging, but that also means no fuss of dealing with bluetooth pairing and connectivity. A lot of the time when I'm riding my bike, I am paired to either my bluetooth speaker or bluetooth headphones. There is the hassle of disconnecting or turning off all of the other devices before being able to use the selfie stick that requires bluetooth connection. With the wired Foxnovo selfie stick, I can leave all of my other wireless devices connected and simply attach the AUX cable to the phone. No hassle of dealing with connecting, pairing, disconnecting, or charging!I couldn't be happier with the build quality for the price. It holds my phone securely, is easy to hold onto, and has a lanyard attachment for any accidental drops. The connection is reliable and snappy - The photo is taken as soon as I hit the button as there is no delay for wireless connectivity.I must say I also appreciate how collapsible/portable this unit is. My other unit does not fold down to nearly such a small item. It's also lightweight since it doesn't need to carry a battery, and makes no noticeable difference to the weight of the gear on my back.Lastly, the clamp mechanism is very easy to use, yet still holds the phone securely. I much prefer it to those that use the 'X' pattern to clamp the phone. Overall this is a great unit. Built very well, easy to use, and for a highly affordable pricepoint. Highly recommended.

I'd like to preface this review by stating that I did, in fact, receive this item for review purposes from EasyAcc. I was not required nor given incentive to provide a 5-star or even a positive review. I was asked to provide critical, honest feedback on a new item for potential customers on Amazon. This review is written as if I have purchased the item at full retail price for myself.That being said, this case deserves a full 5-stars, especially given the price point. Since you may be shopping for several other cases on the market for your GoPro and accessories, I'd like to point out what I really loved about this case in short, to help you shorten your shopping time.Compatibility: This case has listed compatibility for GoPro 4/3+/3/2/1. It should fit most of the cameras! I personally use it with my GoPro 4 and the fit is snug and secure. I really feel like my camera is secure in this case and can carry several accessories as well.Build Quality: The build quality of this case is impressive for the cost. The outer shell is soft, but durable enough to protect against drops and bruises. I'd also like to add that the case is extremely lightweight, so you'll really only feel the weight of the camera and whatever other accessories you like to keep with it (spare batteries, lenses, stands, straps, etc.)Room for accessories: As mentioned above, there are plenty of slots for lenses, straps, stands, spare batteries, and many other items that you can easily fit in the slots near the camera. I also like to carry a microfiber cloth and some disposable lens cleaner wipes in the mesh pocket above the camera.Overall this is a great case for the GoPro line and I'd recommend it to anyone looking to carry their camera & accessories in style with protection.

I'd like to preface this review by stating that I did, in fact, receive this item for review purposes from EasyAcc. I was not required nor given incentive to provide a 5-star or even a positive review. I was asked to provide critical, honest feedback on a new item for potential customers on Amazon. This review is written as if I have purchased the item at full retail price for myself.That being said, this case deserves a full 5-stars, especially given the low price point. Since you are probably looking at several other cases on the market for your Galaxy Tab A 9.7, I will let you know what I really liked about this case versus many others on the market to make your shopping experience a bit easier.Form Factor - This case is slim and lightweight while maintaining a perfect fit for my Galaxy Tab. Many cases either add excessive bulk or don't fit perfectly. This unit does neither!Stand - This case takes it a step further and adds in a multi angle stand! I've found that in testing this unit, it's very easy to see the tablet, and the stand keeps the unit secure and upright.Auto Sleep / Wake - I believe this is done with magnets in the case, but I greatly appreciate how each time I open/close the case, my Galaxy resumes from sleep or goes back to sleep. I'm sure this definitely aids in saving power.Lastly, this comes from a quality company with a reputable stance behind all of their products. I have worked with EasyAcc in the past and they always stand proudly behind all of their products. Couple in the fact that this is one of the best values for cases for the Galaxy on the market, and you have yourself a winner!

I'd like to state that I received these headphones for review purposes from the manufacturer upfront. Upon accepting this item for review, I was not instructed to provide a 5-star or even a positive review - nor given any incentive for doing so. Ecandy was looking for honest, critical feedback of their new product so that consumers could get some input on a product that was new to the market. This review is written as if I paid full retail price for this item.That being said, I do believe these items deserve a full 5-star review. I have sampled and reviewed at least 30 bluetooth headsets. Thus far, my favorite pair is the LG Tones. These headphones have a very similar form factor and build quality to these Ecandy headphones, however, they cost 3-4 times as much. The Ecandy headphones, while costing about 20% as much as the more expensive LG headphones, are still about 80% as good as the big brand!SOUND QUALITYSound quality is decent. They get loud enough for my cycling rides, even when I have a lot of wind going through the wires and over my ears. Most headphones without a great seal are very hard to hear down these same hills but I haven't had many issues with the Ecandy. I'd say that these headphones have 'OK' sound quality across all ranges.BATTERY LIFEBattery life seems to be very close to the LG unit, but probably a bit less. It seems on average, the batteries in the Ecandy set last around 4-6 hours of heavy use (very loud music). They charge relatively quickly.BUILD QUALITYThis is the real major difference between the two sets. There is a distinct (lacking) difference in the build quality of the Ecandy set, but functionality wise, they are very close to same. For the price, I don't feel that this is worth deducting a star, as Ecandy had to save the consumer some money somewhere.EASE OF USE / CONNECTIVITYI had no issues getting these to turn on or connect to my Galaxy S5. Every time I turn these headphones on when in range of my cellphone (with BT radio turned on) they connect automatically and are ready for playing music. This is extremely convenient for exercise. I use them a lot at the gym, and cycling. I recently took them on a cycling ride in the sweltering heat (90-95 degrees) where I rode over 60 miles in one sitting. Needless to say, I sweated on them a lot and they continued to work throughout the day without issue. When I got home, I wiped them off, and they still worked fine! Very durable and somewhat waterproof, it seems!Overall these are a great headset if you're on a budget. For 1/4 the price of the LG unit, I think they're definitely worth getting and are a quality item.

I bought this selfie stick to replace one that I got wet by accident. Apparently, they are not all waterproof!Anyways, I am very happy with this stick as it has many features that are greatly improved over the previous brand.Connecting and reconnecting was a breeze - I wonder if the other reviewers had some issues that are related to their phone's bluetooth or got units that were new in production? I just turned mine on and my phone picked it up - I hit connect, and it stays connected. It turns off after about 5 minutes of inactivity. When I turn it back on, it connects to my phone right away (granted my phone is in range and has the BT radio on).I love the clamping mechanism on this selfie stick. It's very easy to use (fool-proof installation and operation) yet grips almost any phone on the market safely and securely. The photos of someone using it sky diving may be a bit far fetched, but I'd think that the wind would rip the entire selfie stick from your hands before the phone comes out, as it is held pretty snugly. But not to worry, there is also a lanyard to really step up the safety!Another issue with my other selfie stick is that the grooves that extended were not very laterally stable (that is, the entire pole was able to twist and the phone would follow) this one uses much more precise tracks on the rails and the stick itself is not able to twist much at all. This makes taking photos and just generally using the stick much more solid feeling and easier.Lastly, I can really appreciate how well this unit folds down. My old unit extended to about 6 feet but only collapsed down to about 1 foot. This one extends quite far, but also collapses down into 6-8" that I can easily stow away in my back pocket.Overall a great unit that I'd easily recommend to anyone looking for a very portable, easy to use selfie stick!

I bought these Lightning cables for charging my iPhone and iPad as I really liked my other BAXIA products and thought the design of these was much nicer than the stock Apple and other brands. Not only that, but the cables are far less expensive (no idea why lightning cables cost so much).Best yet, they are APPLE MFi Certified, which means that they are not just some cheap knockoff and are up to par with speed and performance of the original Apple cable. Each cable has a smart chip that communicates with the device directly to provide the proper power supply and communication. If a cable isn't Apple MFi Certified, you can't be sure that it won't damage your phone as it is just a 'dumb' cable and will provide whatever specifications to ALL phones and will not adapt to each phone or accessory.I have had an awesome experience in testing - these cables are able to charge my iPhone and iPad just as fast as the OEM cable, and they look better as well as are cheaper! They're a great length and are durable and tangle-proof.Not much else to say - These are quality cables at an excellent price. I'd recommend them and have purchased a second set as a gift for a buddy at work that has been wanting mine ever since I started using them for my company iPhone at work!

I bought these headphones because I was tired of all of my various other headphones. I am a big fan of bluetooth headphones and wireless technology in general. If I can cut the cord without sacrificing any quality realistically, then I will always do it!That being said, these are some great headphones and you won't notice much difference in quality with these being wireless, and especially not for the very low price. Like other reviewers have stated, these have some great volume, are easy to connect to, and have some decent sound output for the price. There are many other builds on the market that you'll see that are very similar to these, but Syllable makes a quality product and I've been very happy with it.These have become my 'daily drivers' for exercising: Trips to the gym for lifting, running, and cycling outdoors have been made much more pleasant with these. They get plenty loud enough even in a noisy gym or with lots of wind on the bike. They have plenty enough battery life to last me even the longest of bike rides.My favorite feature about these versus many of my other wireless bluetooth pairs is that they have in-line controls rather than controls on the earbuds. This is much more pleasant, as pushing buttons that drive the buds into your ears when you want to change a song is not pleasant.
