The ability to press them right on the wire between the earbuds (on your neck if setup like I prefer) is not only easier, but far more comfortable and responsive.Fit has also been excellent. A problem for me with many pairs of earbuds is that they just can't seem to fit properly. If you have any fit issues with these out of the box, I'd advise trying bigger ear tips. Most people try to use tips that are too small since they're easier to insert, but you generally get a better 'seal' if you use the bigger size. The included ear cages make them extremely secure even in sports that require a lot of motion and where you can become sweaty.While on topic of 'seal', these do provide an excellent seal for me once I found the combination that works best for my ear shape & size. With the included tips, most external sound is isolated even when playing music through the ear buds on very low volume. It also gives incredibly deep, powerful bass - So I can't advise enough to make sure you that you have the optimal fit before coming to a conclusion on the sound quality of these buds!Overall these are a great unit. You can't go wrong for the value and functionality at this price.

I bought these headphones because I was tired of all of my various other headphones. I am a big fan of bluetooth headphones and wireless technology in general. If I can cut the cord without sacrificing any quality realistically, then I will always do it!That being said, these are some great headphones and you won't notice much difference in quality with these being wireless, and especially not for the very low price. Like other reviewers have stated, these have some great volume, are easy to connect to, and have some decent sound output for the price. There are many other builds on the market that you'll see that are very similar to these, but Vtin makes a quality product and I've been very happy with it.These have become my 'daily drivers' for exercising: Trips to the gym for lifting, running, and cycling outdoors have been made much more pleasant with these. They get plenty loud enough even in a noisy gym or with lots of wind on the bike. They have plenty enough battery life to last me even the longest of bike rides.Fit has also been excellent. A problem for me with many pairs of earbuds is that they just can't seem to fit properly. If you have any fit issues with these out of the box, I'd advise trying bigger ear tips. Most people try to use tips that are too small since they're easier to insert, but you generally get a better 'seal' if you use the bigger size.While on topic of 'seal', these do provide an excellent seal for me once I found the combination that works best for my ear shape & size. With the included tips, most external sound is isolated even when playing music through the ear buds on very low volume. It also gives incredibly deep, powerful bass - So I can't advise enough to make sure you that you have the optimal fit before coming to a conclusion on the sound quality of these buds!Overall these are a great unit. You can't go wrong for the value and functionality at this price.

I bought the latest MPOW Swift headphones having already owned several other pairs of MPOW headphones. I love bluetooth headphones and trying the latest products. I have established a relationship with MPOW's marketing team just because of how impressed with their products I am. I could have gotten these headphones for free but decided to purchase them anyways.My absolute favorite pair of bluetooth headphones under 50.00 is the original MPOW Swift (they used to only come in Black & Green). You'll see that several other sellers out there use a very similar hardware build to the MPOW Swift, but MPOW does it best. I have tried very similar products from several competing brands, but there always seems to be something lacking. Either they include some cheap rubber ear tips that aren't comfortable, they don't get loud enough, or there are issues with the bluetooth constantly disconnecting. NONE of those issues apply to these latest MPOW Swift headphones.VOLUME:Plenty loud enough, I can even hear over my lawnmower. I generally only have to keep these tuned to 75% at MOST even while cycling into the wind. The seal with the included buds is more than enough for me. The better the seal you can get, the deeper the bass will be and the less volume is required, so a good fit is imperative.FIT:The included tips in the MPOW branded headphones are just always so perfect for me. In one of my MPOW headphone reviews, you will even see me hanging a hammer from the headphone cord with the buds still firmly in my ears (extreme). I never have any issues with these coming out of my ears nor being uncomfortable. That being said, many people like to use buds that are entirely too small because they go into the ear easier and deeper. If you have any issues I'd recommend trying to go up at least one size in the ear buds as the seal is generally better, and once you get used to them they fit better as well.BLUETOOTH CONNECTIVITY:No issues connecting nor staying connected to these headphones. All around easy - just connect once and then every time you turn them on in proximity of your phone (with your phone's BT radio on), you will be all set and they'll connect automatically!BATTERY LIFE:Battery life is very consistent - about 5-6 hours almost every time for me. I generally just charge them twice a week if I am doing a lot of cycling, but these have a great battery life for how lightweight they are. Don't let other brands that advertise 10+ hours fool you - those are often either way off, or you will only get those numbers if the phone is very close to the buds and you're playing at minimal volume. MPOW's specifications are realistic and accurate.Overall these are great headphones and I recommend them to all of my friends that are seeking some quality bluetooth headphones at a great price. Most of my friends that run and cycle always come back to me telling me that these are some of the best headphones they've ever owned!

I bought this mirror because I was sick of peeking over my shoulder to see where other riders were behind me, or to check for cars when I was riding in traffic. It's often more dangerous to look for traffic behind you than it is to just ignore them and hug the curb. This is because when you look over your left shoulder, you often accidentally lose your line of pace and veer out into traffic. If you look over your shoulder and notice a car is there, you may end up hitting it!That is why I bought this mirror. I wanted to eliminate the need to keep doing those hard shoulder checks, but didn't care for many of the bike-mounted mirrors available as they seem a bit tacky and require you to take your eyes off the road to look at them.This mirror attached to my glasses easily and securely, and now I don't have to take my eyes off the road to see what's behind me, nor do I have to turn my shoulders/body and put myself at risk of riding into potholes/traffic. Best of all, I don't have to make my bike look super goofy with mirrors sticking out of it! If I'm just trail riding, I don't have to bring this mirror with me as it easily detaches from my glasses, but I've found that I've become so used to it that I want to always ride with it. It makes rides with the wife easier as I don't have to keep seeing how far she is behind me. It makes spotting cyclists that are gaining on me on the trail easier, even, and allows me to attack sooner!Overall this is a great product with easy installation and excellent quality that makes my riding not only easier, but safer!

I'd like to state up front that I did, in fact, receive this item for review purposes from G4Free, The manufacturer. I was not required nor given incentive for providing a 5-star or even a positive review. I was asked to provide critical feedback that may benefit their consumers, as it was a new product and consumers like to hear honest feedback.That being said, this review is written from the perception that I have paid full retail myself. I can honestly attest that this is a 5-star item! It's so good, in fact, that while I didn't think it would be great, it has replaced my on-frame bike pump on my road bike! I had an aluminum misc brand pump that I stumbled upon after looking at several in stores. I had always liked it, but the G4Free mini bike pump is better!BUILD QUALITYThe build quality is top notch. The pictures do it no justice. This is not a cheap plastic pump that breaks after a few uses. I have been using it a while and I can already tell it's a device that's built strong to last long. Excellent seals, smooth pump action, easy to use.EASE OF USEVery easy to install on my bike (you attach it via the water bottle brazes - you can still have a water bottle on the same slots!). In a matter of minutes it's mounted, and it only takes about a second to securely clip it on or clip it off. The included shrader/presta valve stem adapter makes it very easy to switch between the two and you can inflate virtually any bike tire with it.PRESSUREI had to make a separate sub category for this - So many bike pumps you buy will only go up to 70-100 PSI, which is not enough for many road bike tires (100 PSI may be, but you'd be pushing the upper limits of the pump each and every time). With the G4Free mini bike pump going up to 130 maximum PSI, you can inflate just about any tire out there! Unfortunately, there is no gauge (would not expect in this price range), but this also helps cut down on weight, and generally it's quite easy to tell where you're at pressure wise by the resistance of pushing in the air, and by physically checking the tire. It's definitely enough to inflate a tire after a flat.Appearance is also great. It goes great with the bare aluminum/black/red setup on my Cannondale, but I'd imagine it would go well with most color schemes as they are pretty neutral colors and design.This is a great pump. Like I said it has replaced a pump that I shopped heavily for and was for years my favorite. Excellent product from a great company.

I bought this bag to carry camping supplies with the occasional need to move around or pack up camp. I've also found it to be very handy for my fishing trips down to the local lake, where I can pack up everything into the bag and be quite mobile while not limiting myself to only part of my supplies, as 40L is a massive capacity!Upon receiving I was very impressed with the quality of the backpack for the price. The materials appear to be very strong and well-built. The zippers do not snag, and the pockets hold tight. The bag has some 'structure' to it, so that it doesn't wilt even if you don't fill it in its entire massive 40L capacity.I'm able to carry several tackle boxes, 2 collapsible fishing poles, several extra reels, live bait, a blanket, a collapsible tripod chair, and 2 water bottles into this backpack without much struggle. I could probably fit even more if I needed to. This is perfect as I can pack this up, drive down to within half a mile of the lake, and hike to the lake with the pack on. No more multiple trips and no more struggling to carry all of the gear in both hands. It also makes it a breeze to pick up and move to another section of the lake when I'm not having much luck.All in all I couldn't ask for a better backpack, especially for the price. I personally made this into a fishing backpack, but it would be great for day backpacking/hiking trips, camping, and various other uses. Built with quality, I figure this bag will last me several years if not indefinitely.

This is my second pair of the same style, different color.  The fit is absolutely perfect all around my narrow feet.  I like that everywhere on the sandal is adjustable, especially across the top.  My feet are not very fleshy and most sandals are too tall if there are no adjustable straps.  The Clark brand appears to be a quality product, as these sandals get a lot of wear during the extended hot weather months here in the Phoenix area.  Thank you Clark, for making good looking and comfortable shoes for us gals with narrow feet!

This is my first experience with a shapewear garment.  The Flexees brand is familiar because of the panties, so thought this would be interesting to try as a camisole for the cooler weather, with the added bonus of smoothing out those pesky back bulges around my midsection.  It fits snug, but not super tight.  The fabric is really weird, feels rubbery, but not uncomfortable.  The Smoother, as it is called, is finished around the armholes and neckline with the fabric folded over, and the bottom is unfinished.  I like that it can be worn either scoop neck or V-neck. There is some flattening of the breasts, but personally I don't mind, as it is comfortable to wear.  It does ride up a little around the hips but that was expected because my waist is smaller and this type of fabric would naturally want to return to it's original size!  All in all, I like this Smoother and will plan to wear it under a blouse or shirt for extra warmth when needed.

This is a cross-cut shredder that has the unique feature of compacting!  So when this thing is getting full of shred, which is a lot of "fluff", you simply unlock the clips at either end of the motor unit.  The motor unit becomes the compactor, you simply push it down, as it rests on four spring loaded supports.  No mess no fuss----It will hold at least twice the volume before it is full.We do a moderate amount of shredding, mostly old bank statements, invoices and credit card statements.  Anything with account numbers and any personal information.  The Sentinel is very well built, handles several sheets at one time with no strain at all.  I did run an old back-up CD through the machine, with no strain it chunked it up very well.  Has many features like overheat warning light, reverse switch and, naturally, an on-off switch.  For our household use this is just perfect, completely satisfied with the performance, the ability to pack it around with the handle and the ability to compact----it holds a lot!  Definitely would recommend.

This is the first butter bell that we have ever used that is actually the shape of a cube of butter.  The one that this will replace is an Emile Henry that we bought long ago, you must really soften the butter and smooch it up into the bell....the Butter Bay is so much more convenient---no smooching required.  It keeps the butter soft enough to use anytime, yet not too soft.  We keep it where we spend most of our meal time, so for morning toast, the mashed potatoes at dinner it is ready!  This is a high quality product, have not seen one better; even the Emile Henry which was quite expensive, made in France and has been around for years!  Butter Bay I think you have outdone the French at their own game!For those who have never used a butter keeper or butter-bell this is the one I would recommend!  Easy peazy to put the butter in, keeps it a just the right temp, and looks great on the table.  First cabin merchandise that you will enjoy for years!  This company can be very proud of the product they make.

After using this product I find that it is not quite up to the hype!What I do like is that it is very quiet and that it has an amply long power cord.  The filters are washable and very easy to get to.  Emptying the dirt is a simple push of a button over the trash can.For me to use this as a hand vac is a stretch---it is much more heavy and bulky, than say a Dustbuster.  I think for an older person it would be out of the question.  Using it on the carpet is not quite as convenient as a regular upright!----Remember the bulk of the weight rests in your hand as the entire unit is at the top at the handle.  It will not stand up on its own, either you have to lean it up against something or just lay it on the floor---so when the phone rings it becomes just a tad of inconvenience.  Bissell does include a mountable hanger that must be screwed into a wall----and I just am very cautious about putting holes in the wall. It is not cyclonic, the very fine dirt clogs the final filter not even making it to the dirt cup.  Picking up cat litter would be course enough not to do the clogging thing.The power brush head has its own motor and is has plenty of power, that's a good thing! but it cannot be turned on and off.  There is a hard floor head that has a dust pad attached, something like a dry Swifter head; that works fine.  Also comes with the usual crevice tool, a dusting attachment, as well as the two large floor heads etc.  Changing the vacuum heads, from the power bristle to the hard floor is a bit challenging.  The whole unit must be lifted to a counter top or you will have to do it on the floor....I suppose that's not a big deal.  I can see removing the extension to use this say as an upholstery vac on the couch and chairs would be helpful, but most uprights with a hose would do the same thing, without having to remove the extension tube and change the configuration of the whole thing.  So here we have this unit with a lot of stuff to store in the closet, the two large cleaning heads, the extension wand and all of the other attachments and then having to lean it up against the wall--- it's a tad much for me!  As you can see I just am not too enthusiastic, but that's just me.  I know a lot of others will find this product to be very helpful doing routine house cleaning---we are all a bit different.UPDATE:Forgot to mention several other things that I did like.  The floor heads are articulating, really easy to get around furniture.  Easy to get it really low, like for under the bed.  Now, I think I'm done!  Just want to be fair.

I got this because I enjoy listening to up-beat music while I do my morning walk, I do not want to be disturbed with a phone or texting; just some quiet music.  This is a perfect fit for me.....It has so many more features like radio, voice record, video, micro sd slot  and etc.  The included ear buds are a tad on the weak side, I use others that seem to fit much better.  The sound quality is fine and the size is very small compared to MP3 players that I have used,  I think I started out with a unit that played tape!----how things change.  You can even read an E-Book on this, the small screen would be problematic for me, at least you can.  Overall this thing is stuffed with features and for the price it us unbelievable.  Like I said I use this primarily for my morning walk and it is perfect for my needs.  A real pleasure to use and I am very satisfied with this product,

I'm not a great swimmer and have always bought el-cheapo goggles.  What a difference a few bucks can make!  These are very comfortable and look awesome!  Very well made they completely keep the chlorine water out of my eyes, and what a pleasure that is.  The MP's even come with a protective case to prevent scratching and keep them clean while not in use.  I am totally satisfied with this product, even though I am unable to compare to another quality brand, just can't see how they could be any better than this!

Fuji Apples, Raspberries, Fruit Pectin and Apple Juice Concentrate are the only ingredients in Fruit Clusters.  No sugar or preservatives!  These are a very unusual snack as they are very light, something like eating a cheese ball----the texture is about the same, and they munch down to almost nothing.  The product is freeze dried, that is why they are so light.  I notice a slight sour taste, but not bad at all.  Understand, this no way is like eating a piece of hard candy that will last, these are gone fast!  For me they are not quite as satisfying as a regular piece of hard candy, weird I know!-----that's just me.

First, I think it is important to state that contrary to past reviews the one tablespoon measures exactly one tablespoon.  Possibly a batch of inaccurate ones got on the boat!  Whatever the problem some experienced it has been corrected.These are heavy duty, probably the last set you will ever buy!  The slim design makes it easy to get a measure out of the spice bottle, that I do like!  Each spoon is engraved with the measure amount, not just printed.  Great Product!

I had my first experience with Nori (seaweed) while on a stay in Japan.  An unusual experience for my taste buds.  I found it to be rather interesting and unusual as I had never had it before.  First came across Annie Chun's at a local market where I was able to buy Seaweed Crisps.  I really enjoy these as a snack and the crispy texture pushes these over the edge.  I think for a lot of us Westerners Nori is a bit of an acquired taste as we are unfamiliar with it---unless at a Sushi bar.  I have offered this snack to friends.  a few liked them as several we're not too enthusiastic.  Taste is rather subjective and these are different from our usual snacks.  The Nori itself is just a very thin layer over the crisp cracker.  Everyone should try it at least just once!

Replacing an old el-cheapo kitchen faucet with was nothing less than pure pleasure!  This unit is a very heavy high quality product that is solid and looks great on the sink.  My sink has four holes, the old faucet took one for the water valve handle one for the dishwasher anti-syphon, one for the faucet and the last for a soap dispenser.....so now I have an extra hole, decided to use a plug but rather a lotion dispenser that looks the same as the soap dispenser....perfect!My frustration was getting under the sink and removing the old unit which had been there since day one.  After a bit of patience and persistence I got it out.  The Moen was a cupcake to install.  The water hoses are plenty long to reach the water valves, the spray hose simply snaps into place and attaches to the sprayer with a nut, allowing for easy removal to replace the screen filter which is behind the sprayer.  Everything is solid metal except for the sprayer end which is made of a high-quality plastic......that makes the sprayer lighter weight and very comfortable to use.  The rise of the faucet is plenty high for rinsing dishes and larger items.  A push control on the underside of the sprayer allows for either stream or spray, rinse dishes or get a pot of water---perfect.There is great satisfaction for me when a do it yourself project turns out so well, no plumber required for this one.  This thing looks great and the quality is beyond my expectations----that is Moen!

With a combination of carpet and ceramic tile floors an upright just doesn't hack it all the time.  This is the first non-upright we have owned in a long time.  The last was a monster that was a real pain till we just gave up.  This vacuum is very compact, light weight with ample attachments for any use.  It comes with an upholstery brush, a crevice tool, a hard floor head along with a carpet head with rotating brushes.  One big advantage this has over an upright is in the articulating wand, it goes almost flat against the floor,  allowing easy peazy  cleaning under the bed and other close to the floor furniture.  The suction is superior!  I did notice that on carpet it is a tad hard to push the head back and forth because of the suction strength---I find that to be a good thing.Emptying the canister is rather straight forward and simple, and it will pick up more that I would imagine, doing a great job on both carpet and the hard surface floors.  Another great feature is the self retracting cord, just one push of the button and away it goes!  The footprint is rather small compared to other units I have seen, allowing for easy storage.  A handle at the user end of the wand is very comfortable during use.  This is a well made sturdy unit, the wand is solid, easy to extend and retract.  It would be hard to expect more from a vacuum than this!  Extremely pleased, I would recommend the Bissell Hard Floor Expert to anyone!NOTE:  In my review I noted that it was a tad difficult to push the head on the carpet.  There was a reason, I was using the rotating brush head----that was designed for use on the bare floors not carpet.  I replaced with the correct head and the thing pushes smooth as silk-----oh, dumb me!

We started the two Min. Schnauzers out with Solid Gold by offering a kibble or two as a treat----first reaction, meh!  Then a bit of curiosity set in and they took a try, that was it they scarfed down a small handful each.  Being a picky bunch we are happy that they actually took to a product of this quality-----usually it's noses up to anything we think is good for them!  Now, no problem, as they eat every bit offered at dinnertime.  Wish the price was a tad less, however, quality sometimes is not "cheap"!  We are all quite pleased with Solid Gold and from our own experience would put this on the recommended list.

Yes, the dog did scarf this down!....for our Miniature Schnauzer it was not very long lasting!  Enjoyed the whole thing down to the last morsel....just was hoping it would last a tad longer than it did.  Will say that this is a wonderful reward for our dog......and was happy to see that this treat is made in the USA!  The package says "medium chew", possibly indicating that a longer lasting product is available from this company.

This necklace is absolutely wonderful.  I ordered the 20" size and it is perfect for my needs.  Previously I have owned sterling silver necklaces that end up not wearable because they have blackened with oxidation, and it's a hassle to clean them.  They end up languishing in the jewelry box.  So far, this lovely White Gold over the SS is holding up beautifully.  The 3.5 mm size of the Figaro chain design is a very comfortable weight and look...not so delicately fine so it is not noticable, and not bulky to be obvious.

I must be one of the lucky ones because this black Houndstooth Duffel Bag with black straps is absolutely wonderful.  No obnoxious smell and the quality is perfect.  All the zippers work and there is plenty of places for individual storage.  We have been looking for a roomy "carry-on" bag for a long plane trip, and this bag is just the right size!  In fact, this 19" size should work for a short casual weekend getaway for two, as there is an amazing amount of room all over this attractive bag!  The difficult choice was trying to choose one...this company makes quite a few colorful patterns that would match anyone's personality.  We chose the black to match our existing luggage.

Looks great in the yard and certainly adds a splash of color.  Putting this together is a tad problematic, it almost takes the hands of two people.  The hub assembly which holds the spin rod is in two pieces, and must be snapped together over the rod---not exactly an easy job.  We did get the thing put together after a few unkind words.  It would have been much more user friendly if the manufacturer had pre-bent the blades---that takes quite a bit of time!  The hub assembly is quite flimsy, there is a notch on the shaft that the hub assembly will fit only one way. no mention in the instructions.  Assembly is doable but a rather convoluted process.  Too much assembly is required for a product at this price point!  If you are a rather patient person and have a bit of help you will succeed at putting this together----then there is the procedure of bending all of the blades.  Just a bit much!

Definitely a quality product!  We are having such a great time making our own expresso and cappuccino at home that is (we feel) just as good as at a good coffee bar!  After reading the instructions, we found this machine easy to operate----especially having never made an expresso at home before.  Takes up not too much counter space and looks great in the kitchen and seems always the subject of conversation when we have company.  We did break down and buy several "proper size" cups.  Extremely pleased with this machine and now wonder why we did not have one sooner.....being your own barista is a real kick in the pants!

This arrived one day before leaving for a trip to New Zealand,  I took it.  Summer here and it was Winter there, so it was rather chilly.  Was able to use this jacket early mornings, very comfortable and it did keep out the breezy chill.  The lining is a very soft flannel material that is bonded to the heavy duty denim outer material.  Very good looking and well made, this jacket was everything that I needed for the trip.  The fit is just what you would expect for a large.  It has the feel of a very tough material that could take lots of abuse!  Extremely pleased, and I know it will provide many years of use.

This arrived at a perfect time!  I was taking a break from doing a bit of work under the hood of my car in the garage.  Anyone who does such work knows that a good light is required.  Thinking this would be a perfect time to try out the Oasity Lamp I inserted the included batteries and headed back to my project.  It has a very substantial clamp to hold it in place. Looking for a place to attach and getting a tad frustrated, I saw that has two built in magnets!  What could be better for under the hold, it's mountable anywhere!  The lamp is amply bright, the twelve inch goose neck makes it possible to focus the light exactly where it is needed.....I love it.  I know this was designed primarily for the Bar B Que, but what the heck, it's so perfect for the garage.  Beings as this was new to us,  we had the perfect excuse to fire up the Q in the evening,  We had been using the patio lights, which are indirect fixtures and have good spread but not that bright.  I clamped this to a handle and fired off for a dinner steak.  Again, the gooseneck is handy, put the light exactly where it works best.  This makes the BBQ so much easier to see what is happening!  Yes, it is bright.  I do appreciate the quality too---very impressive.  I can think of so many other uses for this light, really happy with it.

We have a small TV in our den, the sound, like on so many flat panel TV's is rather lacking.  Fortunate enough to have a USB port on the TV.  These speakers are the perfect solution without breaking the bank.  The sound quality is so much better than what we were accustomed to that the whole viewing experience has been kicked up several notches.  Quality of sound is fine and having a separate volume control is nice....we are both enjoying this product very much.

Just finished assembling this unit.  Did not stack one on top of the other as shown, rather two separate set of shelves.  Needed a work bench in the garage along with some extra storage.  The particle board is a bit on the thin side but I think sufficient for my needs.  Coated the shelves with Polyurethane to keep a clean appearance.  One set of shelves has thee, the other two shelves....perfect for larger items.  I put this together myself but it would go a lot faster with an extra set of hands.  Very pleased with the appearance and the quality of this product along with the ease of assembly.

I do the gym this three times a week.  When I am done I try to do a run home, that's when I thought this product would be a big help for a second wind.  My age is past 65, not realizing it at the time, I find out that Creatine Nitrate really does not work for a "senior" as it does for a young buck.  I have taken the recommended amount of C4 more than several times and must say that I really don't see that much difference in my ability to keep going.  So now I know why, it's just an age thing.  Well, I did give it an honest try and if there was an improvement it is just nominal.  Just hoping for more. For the above reasons I can only give this product three stars, and I know the younger group will have a completely reaction; as I wish I would.  The flavor is not all that bad, it's easy to take---I was just hoping for more.  So if you are an old geezer, like me, don't expect too much and you will not be disappointed.

This is replacing a KitchenAid blender that we have had for quite some time.  It cost quite a bit more than the Black & Decker and has served us well.  Blenders are quite the hot thing now with the Ninja, those $500 machines that will turn out hot soup---we've all seen the infomercials.  Anyway I can honestly compare this to what we previously used.  KA 4.8 amps, B&D 9.4 amps....the Black and Decker has a much larger blending container along with a Personal Blending jar which is great for a single smoothie.  We put both on the kitchen counter filled each with the same amount of ice and water and let them rip!  No contest, the B&D tore the KA a new one. Much, much faster, pulverized the ice (the KA still had chunks), the B&D was more quiet, you would enjoy the show!Auto function is handy, simply press "auto" all lights flash, press the number of the function you want. Soup is no.1, smoothies no.5 It stops at just the right time.There is one recipe from the included booklet that we made last night using the Auto function.  It is delicious and great for very warm summer evening here in AZ.  Chilled Spicy Gazpacho Soup, simply put all of the ingredients in the blender use Auto 1 setting, and watch out!  The texture perfect, and one of the best tasting I have had in a long time, just toss on a few croutons. If you buy this thing be sure to try it.Everybody loves a good smoothie, using their own favorite ingredients.  This makes a great one, if ice is an ingredient for yours, you will find not one chunk like my KA.  A real smooth smoothie!  I gave this product five stars because of the major improvement over what we had, the comparative quiet, and how fast it does the job----by the way, another feature that's handy, built in cord storage.

I am an older lady with very fair skin, who needs all the help she can get!  The idea of a "healthy glow" sounded very appealing!  So, I was thrilled to receive the Neutrogena Blush #10 Rosy (Rose is my usual color, different brand).  Included in the package: 2 other colors to try: #40 Bronzed, & #50 Luminous.  Of course, for my complexion, Rosy is just right!  I have tried the other shades, and my consensus is: I like the Luminous better that the darker Bronzed.  All three glide easily over my face and leave a silky feeling...I like that!  I think the Luminous may be used for highlighting purposes at the brow bone area above my eyes.  The Bronzed may be used when I require a slight darker blush under my cheekbones.  Anyway, I'm having FUN with the different colors!  For me, the boxes open easily, and I don't miss an included brush.  I already have a collection of different sizes and never use the provided brushes anyway!  So far, I'm liking this Neutrogena brand!!!

The gardeners call it "caliche"---that is a soil condition that makes the dirt so hard you would think it's concrete.  At the time we first planted I could not get a shovel in the ground, I soaked and tried--nothing worked.  Finally we had to get some help, they used electric jack hammers to get into the soil.  Dig a large hold used plenty of planter mix and finally were able to get some vegetation.  Growing veggies is near impossible.  That is when we did our first raised bed garden, and it worked! We were extremely happy to get the Spacemaker Raised Bed.We assembled it yesterday without a hitch.  A rather simple job and with the two of us it took no time at all.  Went to a store and bought enough planter mix to fill this thing to the top, it took about 21 cu. feet.  We hooked it up to the watering system with flex spaghetti line and installed seven or eight adjustable drippers.We purchased the book "Square Foot Gardener", quite some time ago and find the contents most useful for maximizing a small space for gardening, in fact, I think Amazon carries the book.We have had great success with tomatoes, spinach, broccoli and swiss chard.  We are looking forward to an expanded garden this year.Veggies are always better when they come from your own garden, and what a great hobby!I give this product five stars because of the quality build, the ease of assembly and the rewards of the work.

Ordered these for our guest bedroom.  We bought a double size bed and a new mattress set.  The fit is right on, they look great are finished off with some ripple embroidery.  The fiber is 100% polyester and is very, very soft to the touch.  I realize that the fabric is not cotton and does not wash or dry like cotton---naturally polyester is much more reactive to heat.  Be sure to use the lowest heat setting in the dryer, or just air dry to avoid problems, just a tad of common sense. Wash in cold water.  We purchased the ivory color and it really looks good. New sheet scratchy is missing here, they are super soft right out of the package.  We feel that at this price point these sheets are quite a value, especially with the embroidery detail.

I just finished installing this showerhead a few hours ago.  It is very large 12X8", the instillation was simple, plumbers tape included in packaging.  Solid build, rather on the heavy side and made of stainless steel.  Looks great, has a mirror finish and thankfully rubber nozzles---they are so easy to clean.  Old shower head did not have that feature and the calcium build up gets to be a problem.  The water disbursement is very even for the large area of this head.Just finished my first SharkSPA shower.  It is a gentle flow, over quite a large area----yes, something like a quiet rain.  This is a high-quality product.  If you take the time to compare to similar products you will find prices twice that of this product and several at much, much more than that. This showerhead certainly will be the subject of conversation---it is that unusual.

Let me tell you why I find five stars appropriate for this item.  We live in Arizona where the Summer temps. often exceed 110 degrees and the winters can be a tad chilly.  The Summer electric bill, because of air conditioning, can be a bit on the high side or more than that.  My bill consistently has been more than I thought it should be and even compared with the neighbors (same size house).  After spending a bit of time figuring out the operation of the C2 and allowing it to charge, (had a bit of a problem getting the appropriate male plug adaptor to fit properly)---I went about checking different sources.  Easily locating appliances and lights etc., and just having a bit of fun getting used to the operation.  Scanning our living area I found a section of an outside wall that appeared different from the rest of the outside walls.  It was showing a higher temperature!  Later I found myself in the attic checking for leaks in the AC ductwork, and I did find one, where two sections of ductwork come together the sealing tape had come loose.  We were loosing a bit of AC to the attic, not that it was keeping it cool but still-----Was able to fix that myself!Now about the wall in the living area.  I called a local insulation company, they came out the next day and found the insulation between two studs completely missing!  They drilled several holes in the outside plaster and did the repair with some kind of foam and relieved me of a few bucks.  If I only had found that when we bought this place, would have saved a bunch.  Anyway, repair is done I'm a happy camper and hope my experience may be of some benefit.

I've been a fan of Creative products since the late 90s when I first replaced my onboard audio with a Soundblaster Live. The sound difference was a night and day difference, and I couldn't believe what I had been missing.Here we are, more than 15 years later, and Creative is repeating history yet again. The Sound Blaster Roar 2 is my 4th bluetooth speaker - and trust me, I'm getting sick of these things piling up - but I have not been this impressed in quite awhile.Pairing the Bluetooth is simple, and only took a few seconds. Exactly how it should be. I don't understand how recent products always have such a hard time pairing with my phone, whether it be a car, tv, or other speakers. I almost always have problems.Once the Bluetooth is connected, the sound quality is phenomenal. You'll get a great mix of mids, highs and lows with zero distortion at the highest volume settings. Of course you'll likely not go near the highest volume settings (unless you're throwing a poolside party) because this little box is LOUD. I made the wise decision of testing the volume about 2 feet from my face.. my poor ears.If you're an audio purist, you'll want to connect via aux or a micro SD card for the extra fidelity. I personally think Bluetooth is fine, but we all know that one guy who is way into audiophilia.One of my favorite features, that has been absent in my other Bluetooth speakers, is the bass boost setting. Once you hit the Tera Bass, you can feel the Roar start shaking in your hands immediately. The sides of the Roar have plastic plates where the woofers are, and it's really cool to watch them. I'd imagine this may hurt the battery life a little bit, but you should be fine for the day.As expected, call quality is great when used as a speakerphone. I brought the Roar on a car trip, and didn't have any problems hearing or being heard over the road noise. I haven't had much of an opportunity to use the voice recorder, but the 10 second call I did happen to record sounded great. You'll want to have an SD card handy if that's a prominent feature for you.The Roar 2 is a great little speaker that I can't recommend enough. It has great battery life, terrific sound quality, and it looks flat-out cool (those moving woofer flaps - yum!). I'm starting to wonder where Bluetooth speakers can go from here... perhaps adding a small screen with Netflix support is the next step!

This mat is being used for our two dogs that share a water bowl and kibble bowl, and it is just what I needed to keep things tidy.  I had been using a folded paper towel to catch the slopped water.  We have two mini schnauzers about 20 lbs each that sometimes make a watery mess or toss dry kibbles around the area. These bowls are for their "anytime" drinking or snacking.)  I was looking for something that would be slightly larger than the frame that holds the metal bowls. The Bone Dry mat is a nice size at 18x20", and made of a soft, cushy material.  It actually is microfiber, just like the one I use when setting pots and pans on the counter after washing.  Same thing: does an excellent job soaking up excess water, is cushy for keeping the bowls in their place, and it also has a non skid backing.  Have not needed to wash the mat yet, but will probably just hand wash and line dry...it's not that big.  The mat has a cute embroidered dog bone in one corner, probably for dogs, but I think this mat would be perfect also for cats.

On long flights, like ours, 15 hrs. from LAX to Melbourne, Australia our Dr. recommended compression legwear to prevent blood clotting.  We are up there in age so we rather take such things seriously.  These fit the bill perfectly, they come as a pair rather than some that only provide one at nearly the same price as these.  Rather easy to get on and off they fit the bill perfectly.  Very comfortable to wear and you can feel the excellent support.  They are not a fashion statement but do provide that which is necessary for us.  Excellent quality, and stretch ability.  Have been thinking it truly would be fun if they came in some hot colors---but, that is not why we got them.  Overall I think these really deserve consideration because of the quality and the price.

Okay, 5 Stars = I love it  My Mini Schnauzer Kaiser, absolutely LOVES his new blanket!  As soon as the box was opened he claimed it as his own!  He is like the cartoon character Linus, very attached to his blanket.  It is so very soft and plush, and for him, just the right size...36"x48".  This was going to be placed on top of his bed for comfort, but he decided that he would drag it around, suck on it, and cozy up to it when needed.  The blanket is 100% Polyester, so it will be a breeze to wash.  The color is a pale bluish grey with a nice overall dog bone design in a navy/charcoal color.  All four sides are finished, and it is lightweight.  We now have a happy, contented dog!

These are really good!  We got this box of 5 cheesecake bars today and tore into them right away.  Our favorite, caramel flavor was just to irresistible to let sit there for too long.  We decided to split the first one to do a "taste test", and we both came to the same conclusion....Yummy!  Now, these are supposed to be like a cheesecake in texture but we felt it was more a drier cake-y texture.  I guess it depends on whose cheesecake is the most familiar to you. The bars are soft and delicate.  Anyway, the graham cracker taste/texture was the most noticeable, then cheesecake flavor, following with the gooey caramel and salt.  Each bar has 10g of sugar, and 130mg of salt/sodium...hoping for a lesser amount.  There is not a lot of Fiber in these - 5g, but every little bit helps.  We would buy these for a tasty and filling snack,... and a delicious substitute for real cheesecake that has a lot more calories!

A great flavor combination for the very few ingredients in this bar.  Somehow this combination of nuts, honey and a tad of sea salt really works well!  Probably why it's called a "simple nut bar"---not one item in the list of ingredients is unpronounceable. I like products like this, that are not packed with stuff that who would know the reason other than a long, long shelf life.  My wife and I are both very pleased with the quality and taste of this product.  When the munchies attack this is a perfect solution!

Spicy Chili led me to think this would really be spicy and hot----they are not.  Rather, there is just a slight hint of chili which adds a very nice layer of flavor to the bars.  We live in Arizona, it was 110 yesterday when they arrived in our mailbox, needless to say they were a tad gooey.  Put them in the fridge for a short period of time and all is well.  Naturally I couldn't wait to try one, it was very good and left a smear of dark chocolate on my face.These are a great snack item when you feel the need for something in the stomach!  Much more rewarding than a candy bar---has lots of good stuff that gives instant gratification.  I have had my fair share of junk food snacks, I seem to get the same satisfaction with these knowing they are just a lot better.  I'm on my way for another which will not be the gooey mess of my last one....they really taste quite good.

We live on a street that is lined with Sissoo Trees, it has a very invasive root system.  New growth will come up from the roots and it is very hard to control.  The best method is to dig up the roots, which is a royal pain! I let a patch of these "new" Sissoo come up to try Ortho Max on.  I did a very generous spray, the next day I saw nothing that would indicate the product was working, thought I would at least there would be some indication.....not until three days later did I notice that the product was working.  So, it's not quite as fast as other products that I have used but seems to be working very well.  Wish that I could give a long term report as to how this works over the months, for now, it seems to be quite a good product for removing woody plants.  My experience indicates that along with the spray a tad of patience is required.Updated:Now that several more days have passed I can say the Sissoo is toast!----The product that I was using would knock everything down, it would turn brown, but at the same time new growth would appear.  NO new growth with Ortho!------totally pleased!

Used these for the first time yesterday.  Took a bit of time to get used to the feel, didn't take long to realize how good they felt.  No seams is one reason the other is the compression.  They are snug, but really feel good.  Very light, made of nylon and spandex with moisture wicking and an anti-order property.  So, I took a few laps around the neighborhood only to realize that I wish I had a pair sooner.  The no-slip cuff fits well over the ankle and does hold the socks in place very well.  I wear an 11 1/2 shoe and the size large did it for me.  I'm very pleased with this product and would suggest to anyone who has not tried a pair of this type of sock, and is a runner or walker do try a pair.....I think you will be pleased.

For years I have been using a trimmer with a fifty foot extension cord, which time after time has proven to be a real pain.  The extension cord itself makes me nuts!  Yesterday I was able to try this for the first time!---What a difference.  Started out by mounting the charger in the garage, plugged it in and waited for a full charge, there is an indicator showing how "full" the battery is.  The mount allows for hanging the whole unit while charging or just the battery.  Handy to have a place to store the trimmer.The head rotates for vertical or horizontal trimming, just like my old electric, this is a tad easier as you don't have to mess with a cord.  Anyway, I went to work, nailed the grass under several plants and around a tree then did the edging at the sidewalk....it did a great job.  Not having to deal with an extension cord made the job so much faster and with no frustration.I had it in the back of my head that cordless trimmers were wimpy and would need to be charged before the job was done-----wrong!  This thing has plenty of juice to do my yard, and it seems just as or more powerful than my old one---all without that nasty cord.  So impressed that I really want to try the Scotts blower that uses the same Lithium-Ion battery.  Yes, my blower uses the same unwieldy fifty foot orange cord that forever gets tangled up etc., etc.!  I am so pleased with this thing and the job that it does I'll never use my old one again!  Great job Scotts----you've just made my life a tad better!

This being my first rechargeable toothbrush, I find it quite impressive.  Seems to do an excellent job at brushing using sonic pulses, hard to reach places behind the teeth are no problem at all.  I especially like the size, not much larger than a regular toothbrush it is very comfortable to use.  The charging base  has a very small footprint, takes up very little space on the countertop.  With the color rings and the two included brush heads it would work well for two people.  I did the full charge thing before using have seen no loss of power at all.  Says it can go two weeks between charging, that seems generous. It lets you know when you have completed two minute brushing time, which is recommended!----have never timed before, so I find that very useful.  Right now I'm thinking that I will not go back to a regular toothbrush---ever!  My mouth really has a clean feeling when I am done, and that I do like.  Overall I must admit that I wish I had one of these long ago!  I'm so behind the curve!  Very pleased and feel this product certainly deserves a five star rating.

No coconut soap here. It's not a "body wash". Instead, it's a dang good oat & chamomile 1.3% dimethicone skin moisturizer.The Amazon ID sticker has been re-stickered with the error.Assuming Amazon notices the error, I'll revise my review. Good moisturizer though.

Robinson has delivered her share of superb, attention grabbing philosophical works engaging man and mind and soul. Her topical range, grasp and elucidation of post-modernist, deconstructionism's stunning technical success.She notes that we live in the best time to be alive in human history but can't quite understand why an unease and unhappiness still lingers in our selves. There is a reasoned 'more' at the core of these Robinson essaysAs for my reading experience, I'm happier for having explored an intellectual elucidation from among our words and speculations just beyond linguistic expression.This is a chapter at a sitting read. Robinson's economy of words delivers profoundly more mind fodder to be consumed. Each chapter essay demands a break for introspection before plunging forward. That's a 5-star read.
As advertisedMaybe the best product labeling I've seen. The assay values hopefully match the contents.
I'm ready and waiting on the next installment. Will humanity survive this crafty invincible enemy? Who can tell?
As advertised. The wide elastic waist band was a surprise. It's stair stepper ready.
Comfortable and casual. It's a quality, tailored design in 70% Polyester/30% Polyamide wicking wear for lounging and workout. It's Swedish sizing and one fit smaller then US ... Medium is Small.

Maybe it's the illicit 'thrill' the dogs seem to enjoy. They act like they know they're not supposed to chase a toy dart because the kidz are launching it like it's a kid toy. It seems to add to the dog fun more than fetching an old tennis ball. The dart won't last long, but it's fun while it does.

This complete combo for joints is an excellent volume choice and value for money. The combo is mandatory for the athletic, achy knee and long term injury set. It is my solution suggestion to friends with knee pain. As a recommendation, it's been a 100% new user relief after a weak. It's a small miracle.

They come a bit larger than expected for athletic compression. I wear them under my Baeurfeind knee brace to reduce irritation. My 16" measured knee would be best served with a medium. These are fantastic all-day wear knee supports at the large size. It's longer than most and warm..

A premium sock. The standout feature is the deep woven heal that completely distinguish these from 'tube socks'. Colors are stay fast. The weave weight is high and just short of a heavy winter sock. For house slipper's they're perfect.An excellent gift option for the quirky.

It makes the perfect fresh squeezed lemonade. The lemon squeezer top design is perfect. The screen is ideal for seed catching. The top seals tight. The parts are easily assembled and disassembled for cleaning.Add ice and sweetener and shake = a perfect single serve lemonade.

This second installment delivers. Great action in a mega-scale space opera. The 'left behind' fleet is all teeth. Super robots vs trapped humans on the robots home field is always an entertaining read. Installment #3 is anxiously awaited. Jay Allan has a Crimson World spinoff space opera winner here. It's a page turner.
Interesting control concept. Excellent survivability ... so far.If you're looking for a toy that gets the kidz running around, yelling and falling over the furniture in rapt giggles, look no further.

Whatever was the reason for the products poor reviews in 2013 must have been corrected. It works like a champ. I wasn't expecting a noticeable bump with the amperage. The main car application is powering MapQuest around town. This actually charges the battery in spite of the MapQuest power draw.
Pros:Good colorCons:Low quality stitchingLow quality weaving

Jasper Scott's Dark Space has logically progressed from a thoughtful, far future space opera into a metaphysical sci-fi must read with this book 6.  The best sci-fi for me explores the meaning of man in the universe. Scott charts a stunningly complex long read in the domain of Heinlein and Clarke.  It's a massive scale story. At several points the reader is challenged to grasp moral right and wrong in an engrossing way. This 6th book might easily conclude the epic but the reader is left to wonder. Opportunities for prequels and sequels abound. It will be fun reading where ever Scott takes Dark Space.I give the whole a 5 star rating and this installment a 5+.
Great stuff. Amazon reviewers pegged it. Thank you Amazon reviewers!
Silicone gasket seal lid, sturdy lock, terra cotta insert, 6 cup capacity ... as advertised. Technically, it's not an acceptable design choice for the plastic. It'll crack with out much effort.
As advertised. Quality product. Meets expectations.

Warship was a stunning entre to a new trilogy. Call to Arms is wholly less entertaining. It's a plodding read unable to hold my rapt attention. Warship was a page turner. Call to Arms is an effort. But I'm committed to the trilogy and hope for the best in book 3.

I thought the harbor seal puppet would be JUST a granddaughter attraction. As it would happen, an animal circus was formed up around it. The dogs believe they have a new pup of extraordinary talent with superpowers bestowed by the puppet master.  No biting the sacred puppet. Its like a zany instinctual love fest.The puppet is high quality and dexterously animated.  Quite cool and a third grader (plus family) hit.

Injury = >10 yrs of MCL, knee sprains, a bit of spur, and thinning meniscus on the right inside of knee joint. Easy to tweak on a full blown crutch event..Sport = Racquetball and sleeping wrongAccumulated supports collected:1. Neoprene pressure sleeves in the $30 range2. Donut knee cap and hinged stabilizers in the $100 range3. Double configurations of bothI've spent >$500 on right knee supports.This is the one. Buy it now or sooner or later after you've tried the rest. I really have no idea why the P3 is superior. There is a cross-knee adjustable strap across ACL and MCL that seems like a good idea. There are more pressure pads in seemingly unusual places.Whatever it is, it's freed up degrees of knee torque that I'd lost. It's a robust design from the best materials

This is a fascinating space opera and meaning of life exploration. The scale is intergalactic. The action is continuous, crisp and focused. The plot twists and turns at the extreme edges of survival, hope and meaning. The themes are extra-corporeal. The tech is extreme and theory anchored. Character development within the trilogy is classy protagonist/antagonist conflict.5 Star excellent genre trilogy. It will stick with you

The protagonist is stupid. Earthlings are stupider. And I have no ill feeling about the 'alien' antagonists.The tech is for crap. The plot sophomoric. The politics are anecdotal and boring. There's just no character development to much care about.For a long time reading, the first space ship is described like a flying Confederate submarine Hunley. The discovered "warship" that replaces the Hunley delivers the wallop of a flying K-Mart.I wish I hadn't wasted time reading it. 4-5 star ratings have to be bogus. There's simply no way to enjoy the reading experience in the genre of space opera.Larson has written some great stuff but this isn't one. It was a miserable endurance test to finish in just 3 weeks. Every time I opened it I was challenged to through it away with an attitude.

This connection system has a limited life ... bad design, manufacturing process, inherent reliability risk or something. They fail and are now on the list of routine replacement needs in the phone cost of ownership. As expected, this AmazonBasics is good value for money. Hope it lasts.

I bought these after searching for a step up from my neoprene knee sleeves. I have an MCL problem with an easy to sprain inside knee at the tibia to femur bursa squish.Frankly, the old neoprene's provide more compression where I need it. Except I need more and I'm playing with the neoprenes + this sleeve. This sleeve alone doesn't solve my problem. Hope my lower leg doesn't rot off from the tourniquet effect of the two.This is a quality product. It rides with minimal behind the knee chaffing and would be an excellent everyday wear for the standing. The combined donut and compression just dont solve my particular problem.
Perfect. These sell elsewhere for 3-4x the Amazon price for the same label. Buy more than one.

This replaced a 7 year old same-as iteration that disintegrated to SoCal sunrot of the plastic tube. It was a great feeder with adjustable feeds for dispensing various sized seed lots.This version is substantially cost reduced. The feeding cups are stamped sheet metal vice the older aluminum castings. One of the stamped cups fell out (or the smart birds/squirrels figured it out) on the second refill  and dumping the seed load. Fortunately happening before the old cast cups went to the dump. Safety tip - make sure the cups have a solid top and bottom mating to the tube before use. The old cast cups are interchangeable and far more robust then the stamped cups.Could be a 5-star except for cost reduction engineers. It's been cost reduced for less value for money.This has been an excellent feeder design. The risk to its future will be determined by hyperactive cost reduction engineers. I believe the price is unchanged after 7 years but you are now getting a less robust feeder with material changes  lighter gauge plastic, lighter gauge metal, loosened tolerances. Im not counting on it to survive 3 years.

McGinnis ventures out of his genre in this one. It's a sort of "Man From Uncle" meets "X-files". Somewhere in the author training to write paranormal mystery thrillers, they must teach write scenes in excruciating detail. The annoyingly irrelevant details of the mundane permeate the genre. I mean everybodys walked into a Days Inn mote room  readers get it. You just dont need a 2 page of narrative replaying a couple times  especially when nothing is going on in the room. Am I to be surprised or shocked by a queen size bed? The story wraps up like a crash to meet wordcount.McGinnis asks for feedback at the end to seek reader interest for another installment. Heres mine. The premise and characters are good. Decide if a series is comedic satire or plot twisting mystery thriller. Tune down narrating the irrelevant mundane. Bottom-line, its a promising genre excursion from the delightfully zany space opera. Surprise me with the writing that makes another installment compelling.

What a great value for money for the seeker of buds that stay in your ears during exercise. They fit out of the box, sound great and stay in with silicone sticky enough to defeat sweat and repetitive pounding. These are the first I've found that accomplish the exercise objective. The convenient magnet mate is a surprise when you take them off. They secure around your neck.10/22/15 - RIP ... They died

Heres the first installment of a clever 5 book series. Theres a lot to not like for a space opera techie seeker   a million year space culture is combat weapon ranged at 40km? Makes your head spin strange. A tech editor might have been a welcome addition to the authors team. I very nearly fired the author after tech laughing through 2.5 installments.Then at about the 3rd installment, the author introduces a stunning philosophical bent to the whole. The 5 book set becomes something quite unexpected in space opera. Its an interesting change up and makes the 5 book read worthy.It might have been 5-stars if not for the laws of physics

Serenade to the Big Bird has been on my list of first person narratives to read for some time. My review is framed from within reading the collection of first person war narrative greats. Combat narratives that I compare Serenade to the Big Bird with range widely in the quality of work but the best experiential readings come from the images the reader captures from the greats like Voices from the Pacific, EB Sledges With the Old Breed, or Ambrose Bierces haunting collection from the Civil War.Page turning, addictive, all-nighter reads deliver the best images. Serenade to the Big Bird was a pick-it-up-where-you-left off sort of narrative. Its quite good but falls short of the compelling beat to drive the reader straight through.
Very nice. 1" diameter, sparkle and sterling as advertised.

Its more compact and ergonomic than the picture makes it appear. Its remarkably well engineered in typical Dyson fashion. Without question, it delivers the most concentrated suction Ive ever seen in a hand vac. The mattress clean attachment is unique in its extraordinarily high RPM. This package includes the other usual hand vac attachments as well.The construction is heavy gauge, high quality, precision molded plastic. The filters and dust collector are tough, tight, push button accessible and easy to clean. The weight and balance is optimized about as well as I can imagine.It appears pricey except it's 2-3x the value proposition of its high end competition and really in a class of its own. It delivers an overall wow-factor and over the top straight out of the box.Usage so far  Using basic attachments: window sills and sliding door tracks, shop dust, broom swept marble floor corners, chair seat cushions and cracks.Mattress attachment ... I won't be exposing the mattress until he next sheet change. The mattress attachment runs at such a high RPM and vacuum, I had to try it on something and chose the carpeted stairs. It cleans the step and tight corners better than our main Dyson vac's attachment designed for the purpose.The motor has 2 speeds. The Li-ion batt is 21.6v, 16.2A recharged from a plug in trickle size transformer (no brick). Haven't run out of a charge yet. I've run on high for 10-15 minutes.

I go through a lot of hum food year round and maintain 3 feeders.  Ive pretty much experimented with the range of low cost through premium priced formulations. Perky Pets formulations deliver average attraction. Premium brands have a noticeable ability to draw more interest that can and do attract a frenzy of hum varieties and aerial combat. I have at least a dozen permanent pairs that compete with the wave of migratories and thats when I shift over to Perky. The little winged-warriors will compete to consume a quart a week.This package is good value for money for anticipating periods of high consumption.

If that one tidbit had been enumerated in the description, I'd have passed on it. The nailer wasn't operational on receipt until after a dose of oil.  An oil misted brad drive in hardwood makes finishing more difficult. This Arrow is at least a pound heavier then price class competition. The magazine loads with considerable force. It does drive a 2" brad into oak @ 100psi.The oil, weight and ease of magazine load are strong negatives in my main applications.If you're purpose is to drive brads in surfaces to be painted, it will do the job.

This is a great toy from concept to design to application and quality. It gets the G-zidz into the bug big game hunting in the woods, field and streams and away from the TV and videos to independently exercise their minds and experiment.If I had bet on the bugs theyd collect, Id have naively bet on the usual benign sort. But no, they go straight to investigating hornets vs mud dabbers vs locusts, spiders vs crickets, mantis vs fly  they watched the TV show pitting mean insect face offs and went off to conduct their own experiments.Now Im sure theyll get to around to collecting basic beetles and bugs. But for now, its the nasty bug on bug stuff. Its become a basic tool in their backyard tool kit.

There's not much ostentatious technical speculation here. FTL, no matter how its derived from theory simply transports folks a long way and very quickly. Ultimately, the reader just has to accept it to get any fun out of the telling. The storytellers skill is the central element here. The audience is young adults. The situations evolve in psychologically naive ways easily recalled by the reader. This recollection makes the story entertaining to any age reader.Some reviewers have related a lack of hard science backing the fiction. To a degree, the author sacrifices technical detail for a smooth narrative. However, the books basic premise is technically driven by technical speculation. The action spreads from Earth to the Magellanic Cloud. The author has based the story on recent speculation that these neighboring, primitive galactic-like forms were retarded from development for lack of heavy elements like our own Milky Way. Shortages result in conflict  and there you have it.I'm ready for the next installment.

Spent a good part of the day learning and practicing. Weve had at least 2 before that we wore out. Unlike the others weve had, this unit is far more powerful and better engineered.The attachments are key and they work as advertised and as instructed. The lowest power setting was adequate for the stuff I experimented with. I got a perfect shred from a block of Parmigiano Reggiano.Its big as others have mentioned. Ill be interested in the durability of the lighter engineered plastic. Previous processor failures were associated with broken interlock parts. This one does reveal improved design features among interlocking mechanisms.A visual comparison to operational interfaces and attachments in processors 2-3x the price dont reveal any discernable differences. This is a great value for money to replace older evolutions.update  ... whips out a perfect gazpacho and hummus
More then expected and as advertised. It's the latest evolution in your must have hair management tool set.
7 episode classicThe series is wrapped up tight. It's excellent space opera entertainment of a unique type. Lot's of action and original concepts. 5 star fun!

As advertised direct replacement on a 2002 Lincoln Navigator hood.  Pop the the lock ring holding the OEM shocks off the ball pins on the hood with a lever. Twist a wide screw driver or chisel between ball pin and shock.

Here's an enjoyable mash-up where the grey between science and sci-fi are parsed by the sci-fi giants. There's are some dated, 1970-1980's throwbacks that remain poignantly framed strategic alternatives to roads not traveled in scientific notions. It's an interesting peek into how the sci-fi sausage is created.

Rugged, compact case provides secure socket pick and replace. That means self-organizing. Crescent quality hardened steel.provides a high quality product. Fits under the pick-up back seat. Exceeds expectations. You can never have enough socket sets.

Picks up a fresh start about those left behind the wormhole. It was a 2 day forced read because I started it too late to read it all night. Suspicions confirmed with a raised bar for action. I was ready to transition immediately to the next installment ... but I'll have to wait until the August release ... and with great anticipation. Space opera well done Jay Allan!
Pro's:1. Mousse application enhances application uniformity2. Superb color texture 'tan'Con:Remains sticky on the skin longer than othersTry it. You'll like it
Burt's quality in a smoother compounding. The diameter is larger than usual and might be a consideration if compact is a necessary discriminator.
Commercial, high end hotel quality curtain. The weave and design are made for use without a moldy plastic curtain liner. High value for money.

Leg pain from a day on your feat is loathsome. Sure, you can lather on aspercream to treat the effects. But, you just cant spend 8-12 hours day on your feet or rack up double digit miles a day on your pedometer without after hour leg ache and the screaming, middle of the night, calf cramp.I learned about calf compression while manning a busy convention booth. A compatriot older than me seemed tireless in his standing and walking. I whined about my legs and he pulled up his pant leg enough to reveal that he wore calf support. I was sold.These may be the best Ive found. They are light and effective. I wear them under long pants. I dont use them in exercise (they look kind of silly in shorts) but in active sport recovery at home. These are 5-star great.

After a day of periodic sweaty aerobic uncharted pathfinding on the mountain and reeking with smell of campfire smoke, I don't fall asleep ... I collapse into sleep. Collapse on your back after lugging the pack all day, wake up on my back. You either know what I'm talking about, or don't. The first priority is a rock free sleep ... check. The number 2 priority is tight, compact carry vice topping the pack off with a pad wider than your shoulders to trudge you way through brush ... check. Desert mountain camping has never had a perfect solution. This Klympt is as close to 'best for purpose' as I've found. Ive paid more for less.

These are, without doubt, the best racquetball shoes yet. They are the best on the knees, best on the floor grip, best foot tightness, best airflow through the shoe, best response to quick direction change. Mizuno has developed a more radical heal support in this edition. I like the evolution and look forward to the next development.
Tomcat works. Rats and unexpectedly possums love it to death. The outdoor dead rat smell is the proof. I'd hate to have one die in the house.

By far, this is the most cost effective way to brew your own Hyaluronic Acid compound. Mix with a small amount of H2O from a $1 bottle of distilled water. You can add vitamin C at a ratio that suits your skin best. Buy some brown glass dispenser bottles that are commodity cheap and get on with it. The homebrew is to 3-4x less expensive than consumer packaged.

Yes, it seems like a lot but its not. These are identical to premium priced variants. Its likely the premium variants are these, repackaged.They come in a very Greek grocery store package. The tub is topped by a seal lid and secured by a hefty, secured screw top. I dont know how you get better Kalamatas for the price. Great value for money!

Turmeric as a supplement is claimed to improve general inflammation and immune response. I doubted the effect at the 30-60 day mark. Then, after the 90 day mark, I began to notice chronic inflammation hotspots clearing up. Joints and knees seem improved. My chronic tennis elbow improved.So, I think if your considering Turmeric one needs to anticipate a slow response. It does appear to be an effective homeopathic. Turmeric is a thousands year old spice. It has an ancient track record. Time tested I suppose.

The first thing one notices is that they look like paper towels in the package. Add water and the cellulose sponge wipe appears. Theyre pretty cool but surely an underwhelming looking gift as packaged if thats what youre looking for.Im not sure Id buy another set at half the price. The value for money proposition of these vs cotton competition is a stretch. But  so far so good. How they hold-up in the dishrag laundry rotation vs the standard, robust cotton dishcloths will be revealed.

An entertaining trilogy completesOh yes, there are interesting characters for Joe Abercrombie to build more sequels around and circumstances of  interest to build new adventures upon, but the action and premise of the Shattered Sea trilogy is wrapped up quite well in the now complete Shattered Sea Trilogy. Abercrombie succeeds with this 5-star trilogy.For those new to the Shattered Sea, this genre-type is now a straight through action entertainment read without the months long wait between installments  thats likely a special treat. Abercrombie develops the key characters, plot, subplots and theme across sagas installments. Those readers who have waited between installments begin with his typical Abercrombie story telling.Half a War begins with the introduction of new and compelling protagonist characters and thoroughly nasty antagonists. It takes about 50 pages or so for the time delayed installment reader to re-establish continuity with the whole. A complete trilogy reader will likely not note the confusion of injecting new characters and their subplots to the whole.At this pre-release point  At least one speculative notion about the whole is revealed and at least one of your favorite characters will get whacked. But, there are surprises aplenty along the way.The Shattered Sea, Half a War is a hit. Buy all three at once and save yourself from the anxious gaps.

This is a fantastic tea designed for the tea connoisseur to collect in taste memory. The box description in the Amazon picture says it all actually. Its tea sensory experience exactly as described  special stuff. Well worth the try. Kudos to Capital Texas Tea for delivering an as advertised product

Well, its a just right mini-futon size for the g-kidz to watch TV up front with the happy dogs and transitory cats. Yes, the dogs love it and spend way too much on it. The cats are taking their time. What else can you want?From a form, fit and function standpoint, it's the best I've seen, sans gold bar gentling massaging the dogs.

Im always looking for a new BBQ sauce for the grilling season.Brand name, OTC BBQ sauces have been in a state stagnation for some seasons. I usually fast scan the ever growing BBQ sauce shelf at the grocery store and can recognize them from taste memory  spicy enough for me but nobody else, generic emulsified stuff that provides the appearance of BBQ sauce, combos that yield mediocrity, no more Teriyaki please! The more BBQ sauces that appear on the ever expanding BBQ grocery shelf  the greater the central tendency toward blando.This Minors Bourbon BBQ is an upgrade. First, its a new tasting light/sweet sauce out of the bottle. Second, it tastes more like a restaurant grade, specialty sauce. Third, its an excellent base for creating interesting combos with wasabi, peppers, juices, mayo, sour cream, etc. Fourth, the flavor balances and transitions from first sweet, then the bourbon barrel, that fades into an interesting BBQ sauce sensation.

This product confuses me.  It's marketed as a nail biting and thumb sucking deterrent but the box says Base Coat as well.  The ingredients are supposedly horse chestnut(?) and marine algae.  There is little to no information other than that included on or in in the product box.  The Probelle website lists the ingredients as: butyl acetate, ethyl acetate, cellulose acetate propionate, mek, isopropyl alcohol, adipic acid/neopentyl glycol/trimellitic anhydride copolymer, silica, denatonium benzoate, tocopheryl acetate, benzophenone-3, propylene glycol, helianthus annuus seed oil, aqua, ascophyllum nodosum extract, yellow 5 lake ci 19140, calcium pantothenate, retinyl palmitate, urtica dioica extract, aesculus hippocastanum seed extract (horse extract), magnesium ascorbyl phosphate, ferric ammonium ferrocyanide, tocopherolI am not sure which of the above ingredients are the marine algae without looking up every single ingredient.  The hippocastanum is the horse chestnut and I only know that because I looked up horse chestnut.As you can see, the first two ingredients are alcohol based so even if there are no DBP, Toluene, and Formaldehydes the odor is pretty chemically overpowering.  I suggest you use in well-ventilated room or even outside.This is a base coat essentially but because you would be buying it to serve as a nail biting deterrent, you should use it as a top coat to be applied twice a week.  Fully dried the taste is disgusting so it is gonna work for me everytime I go to bite a part of my nail. The ingredient list alone is enough to keep my nails out of my mouth even if the product didn't taste so gross.

This is a great alternative to a backyard pool.  Works on flat lawn surface or a sloped one.  Blows up easily with an air pump (not supplied).I think some people don't understand how to fill these things with air properly and they don't understand the way to get the water flowing in it.  There is a trick to it and the first trick is to just not overfill with air or too much of a water flow.  Also, don't let the kids jump on it or body slam it!At 18' long this really isn't going to appeal to anyone older than a 5 year old.  The dual sides aren't really wide enough to accommodate a true 2 person race.  The water pool at the end doesn't really collect much water, it serves as more of a bumper/stopper.I like this for my 2 year old grandson and his little friends.  Do I think it is gonna last more than one season?  NO, but the price reflects that.

This baby play mat is one of the best designs of this kind I have seen.  The flexibility of use alone is impressive.The mat itself is a little thin but the other features make up for that.
