You can use it as just a plain mat to lay baby on to keep the little one off of carpet fibers or fold up the sides with velcro and attach the toy crosspiece for visual stimulation and/or play activity.There are plenty of loops on that mat and crosspiece to attach the included toys and add your own.  I like that fact that the music provider is an elephant that can attach where you want it instead of being built into a stationary place on the crosspiece like on some play mats.The mat itself is machine washable (I suggest non-agitator machine wash only) and the crosspiece is easily damp cloth wipeable.The mat folds in half and the crosspiece dissambles easily for quick storage/transport in the plastic velcro closed bag.This mat takes 3 AA batteries not included.Again, this is one of the most verstatile play mats I have seen and any new parent would be thrilled to have it.

I have an auto immune disease that causes Edema here and there.  I had a pair of compression socks but I didn't like my toes covered up, especially at night when the swelling got worse.These compression socks are just the thing to help squeeze the fluid up away from ankles (cankles, LOL) while keeping me comfortable.  Once they are on (and it takes a bit to get them on; I suggest you use the scrunch up technique one uses with regular socks) they stay in place without rolling of the top or bottom.  They're thin enough to wear under regular socks.I would give 5 stars but I ordered a large and really could use an even larger size if it had been offered.  At any rate, it was great to evaluate these compression socks free of charge in exchange for this honest review.  Overall, I recommend this product for anyone dealing with Edema issues.

This sterling silver diamond heart pendant is a pretty little necklace.  The 18" chain is the perfect length.  The chain is a bit fragile however, so if you are rough on your jewelry you might consider a different chain style such as a box chain.Some pendants constantly move around but this heart is so light in weight it lies flat against your skin without rolling.The diamonds are tiny but large enough to sparkle.This necklace is a lot more expensive looking than it is.  I think it is perfect for all ages and all occasions from everyday casual wear to that special fancy occasion.  I personally am going to wear it every day with a tiny pair of silver and heart diamond earrings I already own.

These Maidenform flexee slim waisters are not binding in any way.  The high waist design covers where it needs to without feeling restrained.  The top of them don't roll either like some other brands.  The fit is true to size.  I really like these and will look for a pair in the nude color.

Normally I am skeptical about these squeeze bottle water flavorings.  Seems everyone is jumping on the bandwagon with them.  I don't care for most water flavors but I do like lemon and I love iced tea.  One generous squeeze of this Lipton Iced Tea Mix in 8 ozs of water is enough to make a rich tea and lemon flavored drink.  It blends quickly and evenly.Great for home use or to keep in purse since it doesn't need to be refrigerated.  Use it at a restaurant discretely and save some money!  Some people might have an issue with some of the ingredients not being all natural but I honestly am not concerned anymore.I will definitely buy this product regularly and will try the 5 other flavors Lipton offers.

I am a tea fanatic.  I especially love teas that can be made hot or served up nice and iced!  This Cherry Blossum Rose has more of a subtle fragrance and flavor than I was expecting, even after steeping for several minutes.sThe little satchel bags are very cute!  I am glad they are biodegradable as there are some brands that feature a fabric bag that are NOT.  The teabags come wrapped in a sealed plastic bag along with a cloth sachel drawstring bag the teabags can be transferred to for storage.  This drawstring bag seems like it will preserve the integrity of the teabags as well as make a nice presentation if one is giving the teabags as a a gift.This is a perfect tea for me in afternoon.  I prefer something stronger in the morning but it is a nice relaxing treat for afternoon or early evening.

I love the size.  There is no weird sticky coating on these like on other other microfiber cloths I have purchased in the past.  The colors are nice.  I like that there are two of each varying gray color.The edge stitching is all uniform and securely finished.  They laundered fine in washer and dryer without losing any softness.  I will be using these a LOT.

My grandson is always grabbing our phones to play with.  I got him his own play cellphone a few months ago but he is always losing it under my furniture, etc.  I figure this larger "tablet" might be easier to keep track of as well as be more interactive.The tablet measures 5" x 7.5".  It is fairly lightweight.  I think it should have some side handles to make it easier for little hands to hold. There is an on/off button located on the back of the tablet.  Batteries come installed.There are 3 learning levels with 2 different songs on each level that are accessed by pushing the musical note button in each level.  The songs are fairly short to match fairly short attention spans (mine, LOL).  This might just be the case with the one I received, but the play level switch is hard to move into the level one position.To me, the level 1 and level 2 activities are backwards.  Level one play consists of pushing the letter buttons to hear the word of the featured picture starting with each respective letter.  The S picture is a dog and confused me at first because it sounds like "fish" but I figured out that it was saying "sis" for the Fisher Price Laugh and Learn dog's sister.  What little toddler is going to know this?  Level two says the letter pushed and a second push says the word for the featured picture.  If you press the A once it says "a" and push it a second time it says "apple".  The next letter you push will say either the letter first or the picture depending on what was pushed last on the last letter.  I feel like level one should do what level 2 does and vice a versa.Level 3 sounds depicted are the actions the pictures would make when being used.  Like "B" has a ball picture and the sound is "boing" for a bouncing ball.  Some letter's pictures don't really make sense in level three.  For instance, the letter "C" picture in level three sound is a "mmmm" instead of what I think should have been a crunching sound.  This is pretty much all level three does aside from pusing the note button for two songs.I don't know how much learning this toy is going to provide but I gave it three stars for its interactive distraction factor.  Like most toys of this type, an adult really should be playing with the child and guiding them in their play.

Although this is smaller than it looked on the Amazon page, this necklace is quite pretty.  It looks more expensive than it is.  It is lightweight.  The chain is decent but if you are rough on chains you might want to consider replacing it with something more durable.  This is a piece that one could certainly wear on a daily basis.  It comes in a very nice box in case you are purchasing as a gift.

Smells good. Easy to apply.  I have really thick medium length hair so next time I will do two boxes.  Washes out in about 24 washes (depending on harshness of shampoo, I wouldn't wash my hair with shampoo for at least 3 days after coloring).  I love the coconut oil conditioner included.  The color came out even but will only be as even as you apply!  Covered most gray.I would buy this on a regular basis.

I don't know where to begin to express how much I detested this book.  I will try.  First of all, I am in my mid forties and I read quite a bit of literature for YR's.  Some of it is written really well and some of it is just crap like this offering by Neil Smith.  I found the entire book from the premise, to the characters, to the overall message to be so disturbing as an adult I can't believe it is being marketed to teens!  There is no way I would have let my daughter read this as a teenager and I never did censor what she read.This is a depressing tale about a 13 year old boy who dies suddenly at his school from a heart defect.  After his death he wakes up in a strange place called "Town" where he learns everyone who is there comes from America and died at 13 and stays 13 no matter how long you hang out in "town".  First of all, America?  Americans who die go to a place where ONLY other Americans are?  That was my very first problem with the story.  The overall premise is this boy telling the story of his experience in "Town" via correspondence he writes to his still living Agnostic parents.  I have no problem with the fact that his parents were Agnostic and raised their son the same way but I had a problem with during his correspondence to his parents he renames God as Zig so as to not offend his parents.  Well, if the boy was really trying to convey what it is like in his heavenly "Town" he would have just said "God is here and he provides for us".There is nothing exciting or funny about the story as suggested on the Amazon product page and the back of the book.  I couldn't wait to get through it so I could throw it in the trash.  The happenings in the story are depressing and to me seem dangerous for any teen that has depression issues to read as it might glorify heaven to them.I hope school libraries ban this book.

Batteries that last longer?  I am in!  These Fusion by Rayovac keep my cordless computer mouse running smoothly for at least two weeks at a time instead of the average of 4 days with regular Duracell.  I first was introduced to these by my daughter who buys them for my grandson's toys that are constantly left turned on.  They not only last longer, they do improve the performance of the toys and other electronics around the house.The increased initial cost is offset by the longer power lasting performance.  I recommend these batteries and now buy them in their larger package.

I can understand the appeal of this product to use as a rinse in lieu of brushing.  It is a little more expensive than some of its competitors and contains a lot more ingredients than the rinse I use on a regular basis (CloSys).  Yes, the ingredients are natural but I don't really like any product I am possibly ingesting to list "proprietary blend of" on its ingredient list because I don't know what that blend contains.  The natural ingredients are also a bit suspect because I really never see them used in a mouthwash.  The ingredients as listed on the bottle label in order are as follows:Purified water, Sorbitol, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, PVP, OXYD-8 (proprietary blend of C102), Chamomilla Recutita Flower Extract, Avena Sativa (oat) Kernel Extract, Allantoin, Glycerin (from vegetable sources), Sodum Citrate, Xylitol, Polysorbate 20, Tetrasodium Pyrophosphate, Disodium EDTA-Copper, Ammonium Glycyrrhizate, Menthol, Citric Acid, Sodium Bicarbonate, Sodium Benzoate.I am not sure why the Chamomile is highlighted on the front label when the product contains more Aloe than Chamomile.  Those allergic to Chamomile should be aware however that there is a good amount of that.The sorbitol and xylitol give this a funky aftertaste and I really don't know why the product has to be blue.  The rinse I regularly use has not sugar or sugar substitutes and is flavorless.  I add my own mint extract from time to time to that one.While I was happy to try this rinse, I think I am going to stick with CloSys.

I have never liked the alcohol burning sensation of more mainstream mouthwashes.  I am a regular user of CloSys which uses Chlorine Dioxide as its main active ingredient (the one that serves as bacteria control).  I was happy to use and review Therabreath Plus as it too doesn't use alcohol but its main ingredient is Oxyd 8 (a proprietary blend of sodium chlorite) along with a pretty extensive list of other ingredients.  The ingredients listed on TheraBreath's Amazon product page does not include all the ingredients in this mouthwash.  Here is the list of ingredients found on the actual TheraBreath Plus bottle:Aqua, Sorbitol, PEG-12, OXYD-8, Zinc Gluconate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Xylitol, Ammonium Glycyrrhizate, Camillia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree Oil), Menthol, Sodium Bicarbonate, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Citrate, Polysorbate 20.The inclusion of sorbitol and xylitol give this mouthwash a funky aftertaste.  One or more of the ingredients leave an undesirable coating on the tongue.  It does seem to leave your mouth clean however.The Therabreath costs a little more than some of its competitors.  I am not thrilled with all the "extra" ingredients in this product and think I will just stick with the CloSys brand.

Easy to use for extra laundry freshening.  Just pour as much or as litle as you need in the cap and add to the washer drum directly.  I add it to the drum before I place the items to be washed.  I personally don't use it on my apparel items but I do use it on all bedding and towels as well as the washable pet items.This Fresh Protect fragrance is the most appealing fragrance of these beads I have tried so far.  Some fragrances are a little too overpowering but this one (to me) is more neutral and won't overwhelm any fragrance of my detergent.This product is certainly not a laundry need but it is nice to have if your budget allows.  I will be buying regularly.

I have been using laundry scent beads since they first came out.  I think they are an easy, quick way to enhance your laundry's freshness.  Some brands are more chemical in scent (seems every laundry product company is jumping on the bead bandwagon now).  Downy Fresh Protect doesn't have the chemically smell to me.  I like the blossum scent although I am not sure exactly what blossum I am smelling LOL.Only 4 stars because there seems to be discrepancies regarding how many loads these beads will wash.  There is no set amount of beads to use per load as usage depends on size of load as well as how much scent you want etc.  I do know there is no way this size bottle is going to cover 42 loads!

I eat flour tortillas exclusively over corn tortillas.  These are perfect for a family dinner or as a vehicle for a taco (or any kind of salad) for lunch.  The packaging is great in that you can easily use them all at once or just take one or two at a time out.I crisped them up in my toaster oven a bit for salads.  For regular tacos I like them soft out of the package.  These can be used also as one would use pita (pocket) bread.  My daughter looked at the shape and suggested they would be good for desserts like a banana split or ice cream sundae.  I agreed so I made a sugar and cinnamon sprinkle mix (I use the raw sugar), brushed some butter on the inside and outside of the tortilla shell, sprinkled on the sugar mix and baked in my toaster oven.  It made a great vehicle for dessert!These are such a fantastic idea I can't believe it took so long for one of these companies to come up with it!  I will be keeping these in stock in my pantry.

I wear men's cologne because I don't like the floral, sickenly sweet female scents.Calvin Klein ETERNITY is a classic scent.  I remember a few years ago following a man around a Macy's because he was wearing it.Eternity for Men to me has a subtle, clean, grassy scent at first.  Then the layers of the bottom notes (Amber, Sandalwood, etc.) start to come through.  This is not a manly man scent (like Obsession for Men) but I would certainly recommend it for women and men who like a lighter scent.

Very Comfortable.  It smelled weird out of the package (like Chinese Food, seriously).  I put it in the dryer on Air Dry with a couple of strong dryer sheets and then let it air out outside for about an hour and that took care of the odor.The suction cups worked fine.  I think those who are complaining about them coming off are pulling the pillow off the tub by the pillow part.  You need to put your fingers underneath the suction cups themselves to release the suction.I am very happy with this pillow and will definitely recommend it.

I am a big fan of the Fisher-Price baby swings over any of the other brands.  I find they are the easiest to assemble, are the most sturdy and have the most useful features.  I had this one but with the monkey theme and I used it as long as I could with my grandson.  When he grew out of it my daughter and SIL swore they weren't going to have any more kids so I sold it.  You guessed ittwo months later daughter announced she was pregnant again.  So, of course I was thrilled to get another one.  I like this one even better because it comes with a cradling insert for the newborns or small babies.There is nothing bad I can say about this swing except something I wished it had after experience with the last one I owned.  It would be great if they came with a remote control.  There were many times with my first one grandson swinging that I would have liked to control the song volume and swing intensity without having to get up and possibly make noise.  He always seemed to sense whenever I was a foot away no matter how quiet I was!The color and patterns are gender neutral and will blend with any home decor.  Keep in mind that the swing base IS rather large and will take up quite a bit of landscape.  It's worth it though.  If you can only purchase one piece of equipment that you will see as a lifesaver, skip the bouncers and the rock n plays and get this swing.

I have hardwood flooring throughout my house and I used to have a few throw rugs here and there.  After a year of having to vigorously vacuum those rugs on a daily basis due to the two furry dogs and cat, I had it and threw them away.  Since then I haven't felt like my furniture asthetic was really tied together and I also miss the rugs since my grandson has started walking and consequently falling.I know the Stainmaster name from regular carpeting but I had not realized they made area rugs as well.  The 5x8 size is perfect for so many room situations.  I am using this one in the center of my living room seating arrangement to once again tie it all together.The Navy background color is neutral and goes with the beige sofa set and the chain pattern is more of a light cream instead of a true white.  I haven't noticed any color discrepancies in either the navy coloring or the pattern color.  The edges of the rug are serged well and evenly.  The built in "no slip" backing is great because when the animals get wild and chase each other the rug isn't getting moved around like the other rugs I had.I had the rug down for three days before evaluating in order to allow pet fur to accumulate.  Since the pile on the rug is pretty tight, the fur didn't get all entwined in it and vacuuming was very easy.  Cat throw up also cleaned up easily.  This is definitely a pet and kid friendly area rug.  If I had known about this brand of rug earlier I certainly would have bought several for the home.  I now plan to buy a few for the bedrooms since there are many patterns to choose from.

This set is another version of many of T.S. Shure's magnetic doll and clothing sets.  Made in China like the others, it has the same fairly weak magnet backings on the body pieces and clothing.As far as being anatomically correct, they sort of are.  There are male and female genitalia pieces included but I honestly don't think any young child is going to know what they are looking at.  This is definitely a play set that needs to be played with adult supervision so the adult can explain the different internal and external parts.There are some pieces of clothing that represent a doctor's coat so I guess the one doll can play doctor and examine the patient doll.  LOL.The set comes in the same thin plastic bag with plastic snaps as many of the T.S. Shure sets.This isn't a bad idea for a toy but I just doubt the validity of it really being a learning tool.  I think it would just tend to confuse (and maybe even scare) some little ones.  I say stick with the bear doll or mermaid sets by T.S. Shure as I find those more believable.

This girl doll and clothing set is a good size for little hands.  They are thick enough that the kiddos would have a hard time bending and breaking them.  Like the other T.S. Shure play sets, this one is made in China.  I, like other parents and grandparents, do have concerns regarding the paints and magnets used in China but honestly, it is just so difficult finding toys that aren't made in China.I have a toddler table that features a magnetic chalk paint board so I was disappointed that the backs of the dolls aren't magnetized.  The dolls don't come with stands either like another popular brand.  The magnet strength is a little on the weak side so if the dolls are played with in hand and shaken, etc, the clothing will fall off.  If you kids are impatient and you know they are going to get frustrated by that then look for the play sets that have clothes that velcro on (or modify this set with velcro) instead.I like the handy storage/carry bag that makes it easy to pack up the set and take to grandma's or to a friend sleepover although I don't see it lasting more than a month or so before tearing.Overall, this is a reasonably priced set for all the pieces you get.  I would just like to see some of the improvements I mentioned above.

Set comes with 2 girl bears and tons of outfits for them to share.  The clothing pieces mostly seem activity related so the kids can use their imaginations creating play scenes for these activities.  I have a toddler table that features a board with magnetic chalkboard paint that I feel would greatly enhance the play experience if the BACKs of the bears were magnetized.The product is made in China so like so many other toys I guess we are taking our chances regarding what materials are used in coloring the pieces.The set comes in a wooden storage box that seems very sturdy.  My one complaint is that the plastic slide-on lid already cracked and broke on the corner while sliding it on so just perhaps be sure to assist the little ones when they are putting it back on.I think this set would be fine for a boy to play with since they are bears (I don't believe in limiting toy play to gender specific toys though).

This pasta tastes great.  It isn't "al dente" like the all wheat pastas.  The tomato and carrot lend a nice pinkish color that complements a tomato sauce.  I am always looking for a way to supplement my vegetable intake and with 25% of this pasta being vegetables, it fits right in with my cooking regimen.  Makes a GREAT pasta salad as well.

I started out with just one unit of the Wireless Alarm for Windows to feel more secure with an upstairs window that isn't locking properly.  Then I had the opportunity to install the Wireless Alarm Kit which includes 3 door or window alarm units plus a programmable shed or garage alarm.The window alarm units in the kit come with the LR44 batteries already installed in each unit.  You will need 3 AAA batteries for the garage alarm.  You can install the garage/shed unit with included screws or with adhesive tape.  I recommend the screw installation because you will need to access the back of the unit in order to change batteries.This is a very easy system to use and gives me a great sense of security at such an economical cost.  My daughter lives in an apartment that does not feature an alarm system so I am going to order a kit for her ASAP.

Older lady living alone.  I have felt secure in my house for the past 16 years but the neighborhood is changing regarding car and home break-ins.  I am on a fixed income and can't afford to have a security system installed and pay for monthly service.  These door and window alarms from Sabre seemed like the perfect solution.This is a very small alarm.  It is smaller than the dimensions the Amazon specs provide.  It is more like 2.5" x 1 1/4" and I was happy about that.  I had previously purchased a couple of Doberman Security brand door alarms that were 3 times the size and they just stook out like a sore thumb on the doors and windows.This alarm offers a "chime" and "alarm" sound that are both very loud (120 decibles according to Sabre).  I really wouldn't call the one sound a "chime" because there is nothing pleasant about it.  There is no volume control on this alarm.The door and window alarm requires 4 LR44 batteries (included).  I hope they last awhile because those batteries can be expensive to replace.I am very happy with this alarm so far.  I have an window upstairs with a broken lock and haven't been able to look into getting it fixed.  Knowing I will be alerted if someone tries to come in makes me feel more secure.  In fact, I am going to check out the system that will secure my front door and other windows and doors SABRE Home Security Alarms.

This is a horrible product.  I have used pepper sprays in the past (real police issued to women who take their self-defense courses) and after my good experience with those I just have to say that I don't even KNOW what this product is.First of all, in my opinion, the neon pink color is just dumb.  Who really wants to be walking around with that in their hand?  Why do these companies think women need a gender "friendly" colored weapon?  I laughed when my daughter came home with a pink tazor too.I don't know what Sabre Red's idea of a gel is but the spray I received is very liquid in consistency.  Yes, It squirts out easily and has a span of 5-6 feet.  It has an initial direct stream for a second and then mists out.  The best way I see this working on someone else to stop them is to be no more than a foot away but you increase your risk of spraying yourself too at that range.The biggest problem I had with this spray is that it leaks all over your hand.  It is a gross, liquidy mustard colored mess.  You can't just wipe it off with a cloth because even dry it has permeated your hands, clothing and underneath your fingernails, thus posing a risk of self-infliction.My container of this garbage went straight in the trash.  I will stick with my trusty Springfield XD 9.

I have always been a Crest girl and have used pretty much all varieties (except for the one that had those little plastic beads in it).  I use the Crest Whitening strips twice a week but really like the idea of a daily maintenance routine.Step one is your basic toothpaste.  The consistency of Step 1 is nice and smooth.  I don't care for "grainy" pastes.  Step 2 is the whitening agent which is mainly hydrogen peroxide and carbomer.  Step 2 definitely leaves a polished feel, especially with using my rotary electric toothbrush.Some folks might not have the time (or want to take the time) to brush their teeth in two separate steps.  If not, then I found that it is just as easy to squeeze the Step 2 whitener on top of the Step 1.  If you opt for that I would just be careful to brush a little slower than normal.All in all I really like this system.  I would have given it 5 stars but I think the toothpaste is a tad too sweet.

I haven't been a big fan of canned olives and still am not.  They just taste like the can to me.  I don't understand why, if Kalamata olives can be packed in glass jars then why can't black olives?The Mario brand is the only brand I could find a Low Sodium version.  Amazon is the only place I could find them (I tried 4 different national supermarket chains).  They are fine to cook with or add to salads but one of my previous food guilty pleasures was to just eat them out of the can.  I can't do that with this low sodium version unless I soak them in a vinager herb brine (no salt of course).The olives themselves are uniform in size, color and texture so that is good.  I would give them 5 stars if they didn't have that aluminum can taste that is more obvious without the salt.  I don't understand why the manufacturers can't impart SOME kind of low sodum flavor though.

I purchasaed the Gund Peek-a-Boo Elmo for my grandson a few months ago and he loves it so I knew he would like this one.  He became fascinated with Elmo at 6 months old (he is now 13 months) and I think I have purchased every Elmo made since then.This Elmo is the same compact size as the Gund Peek-a-Boo one but this one feels plushier to me. His on switch is on the bottom of his foot and is fairly easy to push without effort. He reads 5 different nursery rhymes from his "book" and follows along with head movements.  Like any of the animatronic doll toys, if your baby likes to grab the mouth and pull on it he can break the mechanics of it.The recommended minimum age for this toy is 18 months but if your child is more mature like my grandson then I think it would be fine.If your child is an Elmo fanatic this Gund version is a must have.  He would make a good companion to the Gund Peek-a-Boo Elmo as well.

This set is the perfect set to get your family away from all those "virtual" family games!  As the name of the product suggests, this set is for game playing first and foremost.  The fact that they convert to regular tables for me is just an added convenience.Our family loves cornhole (bean bag toss) and we had one for over 15 years that my father-in-law made for us one Christmas.  That finally fell apart from being left out in the elements.  It will be interesting to see how this poly one holds up.  As soon as they arrived we pulled them out of the box and carried them outside.  We didn't care that it was a brisk 39 degrees out, we wanted to play!  Set up is super easy.  We played the cornhole first and it was a bit different from the wooden one we had due to the slick poly surface.  Figuring out the learning curve (so to speak) made it more fun though.  Next we played the ladder golf game.  I have never seen a commercial version of this before.  I first saw this game on Jimmy Fallon's Late Night show and I thought the show had made it up and built one specially!  This game takes some practice!  I would suggest that the minimum age to play this should be 8-10 depending on how reckless your child is.After playing the games we turned them over to use the table functions.  There isn't really a large surface area for major crafting but I can see 3 or 4 little kids sitting around them doing outside crafts and then hosing down the tables after!  My daughter and son-in-law looked at the circles and the table height and said "Hey,we could play Quarters or Beer Pong!"  So they got the Solo cups and arranged them in each circle instead of the tradtional cup positions for those games and had a great time in freezing weather (those crazy kids).Folded up, the tables are very easy to carry--the handle straps look pretty sturdy but I can see those wearing out first if left out in the elements.I am very happy with this game set and look forward to the backyard get togethers this Summer.

Pulling the Frigidaire Aroma Fresh-50 out of the box, I was relieved to see that it wasn't overly huge. Standing at about 10" H x 6.5" W, it is smaller than the average personal humidifier so you won't need to clear much space for it.  With its black, glossy finish it does appear a bit utilitarian.  I would prefer a brown or faux woodgrain finish.Getting started is easy.  The Frigidaire Aroma Fresh-50 has a little compartment in the front that holds a 2" wide scent pad.  This pad comes clean so that you can choose your own essential oil scent.  I tried to find here at Amazon as well as Frigidaire's website (as suggested in the manual) the replacement pads and filters, to no avail.  I guess one would have to call the 800 customer service number to get that exact information.  As an alternative to replacing the scent pad, I plan on using pieces of felt fabric I have lying around to change out my scents (I don't see why makeup remover cotton pads cut to size wouldn't work as well).  I also plan on vacuuming the filters themselves often to extend their life.Before plugging in and starting the air cleaner, lay the cleaner on its side and push down on the little tabs to remove the bottom panel.  This took me a bit of effort.  Remove the plastic wrap on the filter.  Snap the bottom back on.  Place the air cleaner on a stable area that allows good air circulation around the sides and front of cleaner.The fan operates with a simple dial that features a soft green operation light.  To turn off the fan just turn the dial back to on til it clicks off.  The fan is very quiet.  I guess noise level is subjective but I find it really quiet and wouldn't even mind it louder because I am one of those people who sleep better with some white noise going on.The scent (I used lavendar oil from Bath & Body Works) lasted quite awhile throughout the night (only used one small drop).I have two furry Papillons who sleep with me and I really felt like I needed something to freshen and clean the air I try to breathe at night!  This small tabletop unit just might be what I need.  Although the Frigidaire Aroma Fresh-50 only cleans about 50 feet of surrounding air that is really all I needed it to clean at night.  It would be a good choice for an office cubicle setting where your cubicle neighbors are not always considerate of the odors they exude with their cologne, nail polish or weird lunches they eat at their desks.I would give it 5 stars but it only gets 4 because of the fact that I have to work to find the information regarding obtaining replacement filters.  That information should be included in the manual (other than the part number they provided) and I should easily find it on the Frigidaire or Electrolux (Electrolux has owned Frigidaire since 1986) website(s).

Before I got this drill bit set I was beginning to think I was just an inept power driller.  I had been using the set that came with my power drill and either felt like I wasn't putting enough muscle power behind the drill or I was constantly breaking a bit on something.  They also don't randomly fall out of my drill due to too much vibration.The only thing I wish is that the set offered a 1/16 bit instead of just stopping at 1/8.You get what you pay for so these Irwin's  are my go to drill bits now and in fact I am just tossing (whichever are actually left unbroken) all the other bits I have.  Speed up your drilling projects and lessen your frustration with this bit set.

It's so nice to to have both these sizes of zester/grater in one set.  The one I currently own is just a small grate and it doesn't have the non-slip holder foot so if I get a little overzealous it slips and there go slivers of my fingers and nails into the bowl.  That doesn't happen with this design.I love that they come with their own protective sheaths.  While I tend to try to keep my utensil drawer organized sometimes things get jumbled so I can easily reach into the drawer for these tools and not worry about cutting myself.These are a good buy and you will find yourself using them for more than you originally thought.*Honest review posted in exchange for trying the product for free*

Easy to use.  These are constructed just as well as my favorite kitchen utensil brand but the cost is so much more reasonable.Easy to hand clean (don't put these in the dishwasher folks as even though they are Stainless Steel I have found in the past that the dishwasher really dulls the blades on items like these).These would make a lovely gift for yourself or for that new couple setting up their first kitchen.

I tried these on my grandson (1 year old) because the poor kid has some eczema issues.  We don't use the wipes on him if we are just changing a urine diaper because we don't think extra moisture needs to be on his skin and then covered up with a diaper.  These wipes are just the right amount of moisture for those who DO choose to use on all diaper changes as well as for messy ones.  I personally think this shorter size is fine as I often only use half of the longer competitor brands so I feel like there is less way waste here.They don't come in their own plastic pop out container but I managed to stuff 2 packs into an extra deep Pampers brand box I had leftover.I don't flush them and I don't put them in my compost pile.  Their claim of being compostable makes me feel a little bit better about putting them in the landfill along with the diapers that are NOT compostable.  There is a slight fragrance which smells completely natural.  It smells like the Chamomile to me.I am not sure where these are actually manufactured.  I think I remember somewhere that said they were made in Turkey.  I prefer that over China where the OTHER similar brand a well-known actress is behind is made.

Good Lime flavor but bewareThe "Fiesta" in it is definitely pronounced!  A little bit goes a long way.  I would prefer this if the lime stood out more than the chili flavor.  Buy this for the convenience but personally, I am just going to use fresh lime zest with a hint of chili powder instead.

Would like to buy more in a greater amount.  I can eat this every day.  To me, there is no difference in taste of the higher sodium product and this one.  Do your body a favor and purchase this low sodium version.

This salt substitute is DELICIOUS!  I can't do any Potassium so I was at a loss as to how to season my food until I discovered this product.  Those who are claiming that there is no "saltiness" are either crazy or their taste buds are messed up by whatever ailment they have that is causing them to be on a no sodium diet.It does get a bit "caky" in the bottle.  I emptied the contents into my Bullet blender and got it all loose and then put it back in the original bottle with grains of rice here and there to absorb moisture in order to prevent it from caking up again.I am definitely going to buy the larger size next time.  This product is now a staple in my kitchen.

My grandson loves them!  He is only a year old but can easily set them up (maybe not as straight as I would).  He uses both hands and his feet sometimes to roll the ball.  I like how the pins are all different characters.  We play with them like they are friends and have named each one.  The only thing I wish they had going for them is if they squeaked better.  I know they probably aren't designed to squeak but that would make them more fun I think.

I am giving these 4 stars because my cat ate them and wanted more.  I would have given them 5 stars but when I rolled a couple of them across the floor the cat pounced on one and since they are so tiny, it got caught between her toes!  That wouldn't have been a problem but she stretched and shook her paw to get it out and it went rolling somewhere underneath the cabinets that are bolted to my wall.The bag is fuller than some other cat treats I have purchased in the past.  The bag reseals well which is good because my cat will paw at the top of opened bags until she can get them open.I would buy these for my cat but would love a variety package or at least a cheese flavor.

These are one of those kitchen basics that one is always meaning to buy but tend to forget about until each and every time the occasion arises when you wish you had some!The spoons are lightweight and very smooth with no rough edges.  They are stamped "stainless steel" on the handle.I really like making my own iced sweet tea and flavored cream iced coffee and these spoons were just the thing to stir those drinks with in my 16 oz cups.  Previously I had been using my normal short spoons with these tall glasses and I always end up either dropping the spoon down in the glass while trying to stir the very bottom contents or I just get my fingers all sticky.I am so happy to finally have these long spoons.  I wouldn't hesitate to get more as a gift for others like me who just always forget to buy them!*Received free product sample in exchange for an honest review*

I have been using this anti-wrinkle cream for a week now.  Yes, it softens my skin to give the appearance of less wrinkles.  The hydrated feeling did not last through the night however.  I feel like this is more of a daytime facial moisturizer because it is nice and light and has a scant fragrance.  It smoothed my facial skin nicely so I didn't need to use a foundation primer like I usually do.This is the first time I have heard of the Scalisi line.  It is a bit pricey for me considering that if a blind test was done using my usual Olay products, I probably would choose the Olay creams.I did like the center pump dispenser as it really let me control how much cream I was using without having to dip my fingers inside the jar, thus avoiding the introduction of bacteria in the jar.This is a nice moisturizer.  It works.  I just won't buy it because of the cost.

After trying Passport to Organics' Charcoal Magic Cleanser, I was thrilled to try the Turmeric Cleanser.  I recenty have been diagnosed with a medical condition that causes external and internal inflammation.  I have done a lot of research for natural remedies to reduce the inflammation.  Cherries, Ginger, Lemon, and various other natural foods are all good but the most promising was Turmeric!  So, I have been drinking a Turmeric Lemon Ginger tea I make myself for over a month now and the inflammation has been greatly reduced.The idea of Turmeric in a facial cleanser just makes sense for me.  Like Passport to Organics' other fine products in their line, the Turmeric cleanser comes in an attractive bottle with the same easy pump dispenser.I start by removing my eye makeup with coconut oil (I don't like petrolatum products).  Then thoroughly wet my face and neck (don't forget your necks ladies!) with warm water.  I then apply the Turmeric cleanser with my fingers and gently massage face in circular motions.  Word of Caution:  Avoid your eye area.  This product does have quite a bit of Turmeric in it and it is powerful.  Don't burn your eyes.  Rinse thoroughly and pat area dry.  Be sure to wash your hands with regular soap afterwards.I love the tingly feeling it leaves on my skin.  Tingly without a dry feeling.  I use this cleanser primarily in the morning because it acts as a stimulant and wakes me up even before that first cup of coffee.I am very impressed with not only this Turmeric Cleanser but with the entire Passport to Organics line.  I am very picky about the ingredients I put in and on my body and I will definitely recommend this line to anyone who will listen to me about it.*Honest review posted in exchange for free sample*

I have been going through erratic post menopausal face breakouts that are taking me back emotionally to my teen years.  I have tried normal drug store brands that claim that the salicylic acid ingredient in them is the way to go.  The results of those ranged from giving me dry, leathery skin to no result at all.So, having the opportunity to try Charcoal Magic by Passport to Organics I was intrigued.  Reading the ingredients list (Aloe is the very first ingredient instead of water in most cleansers), I felt like I could eat this stuff in addition to cleaning my face with it.  All the ingredients are natural and organic.The cleanser comes in an attractive bottle with an easy push down pump spout.  The cleanser consistency is a little more liquidy than I would have guessed but that allows it to be applied nice and smoothly on your pre-moistened skin.  I just rub the cleanser gently in a circular motion all around my face (but I have used my spin exfoliating brush with it as well with good results) and then rinse.  There was a hint of tingling after drying but that made me feel like my pores all got nice and cleaned out of the acne causing junk.  There IS a different "herby, earthy kind of fragrance that I kind of like but others might find it offensive.  I prefer that over some over perfumed, chemical fragrance.I normally always HAVE to use a moisturizer at night with most other cleansers.  After pat drying my face, I couldn't believe how smooth it felt.  I had no need to use a moisturizer before bed!  The next morning I expected to awaken with some dryness but there wasn't any.  Within two days of using this cleanser night and morning, my blemish areas were almost gone.I am pretty picky about what I use on my skin.  If I can't recognize the ingredients then I tend to shy away.  I am also one to state in reviews if I don't care for the product and why, even if I get to try the products out at no cost to me.  I love this cleanser and am just sad that it took so long to discover it.*Product received free in exchange for honest review*

This is by far the most interesting coffee maker I have ever owned.  It has quite the unique look with its beaker type carafe, its rain shower water distribution and the sleekness and height of the machine itself.  At about 14 1/2" tall, it fits fine under my cabinets.Before you buy, you really want to consider your coffee making needs.  If you are an "I need hot coffee now" kind of person, then this isn't for you.  I am a person who likes to make iced coffee in the Spring and Summer so brewing a carafe of this "concentrate" lasts me all day.  I simply add ice and creamer to make my own (less expensive!) Starbuck versions of iced coffee.  Making hot coffee is simple enough if you are patient.  You will need to heat water using a different source and then mix that water with the amount of concentrate to achieve the coffee strength you prefer.  I suppose one could drink the coffee straight out of the carafe without diluting with water, but that would be more of a Turkish coffee and would probably put hair on your chest.I like to use this cold brew maker for iced tea.  I buy the large family size tea bags and brew the same way as the coffee.  If tastes even better than brewing the tea in a Sun Tea Jar (and much quicker!).The only thing I am not so crazy about is the cleanup.  Since there is no paper filter holding the coffee grounds, dumping them out in the trash and rinsing the coffee chamber mesh filter and filter cup can be a little messy.All in all I like this brew system very much.  I am not sure I would make it the ONLY coffee maker I have in the house and I would like to see a lid top over the Rainmaker in order to keep dust etc, out of it between uses.

Since I was widowed a couple of years ago, I have really been paring down the tool/equipment collection in my late husband's work area in our garage.  I have been keeping the tools I deemed basic and necessary in a medium sized toolbox but I am getting tired of digging through the toolbox looking for just the right tool.These baskets are just the thing to get my stuff organized.  They attach easily to the pegboard back of my workbench.  If you have installed your pegboard correctly, with the proper spacing between it and the wall, you should have no problem attaching.  If not, then the wire pegs can be bent easily to accommodate your board placement.I am using the large basket for tape measure, stud finder, staple gun, drill bit case, etc.  I attached little "s" rings to the bottom of basket to hold bags of nails, screws, bolts and staples.  The medium basket is holding a variety of tapes and gorilla glue.  The smallest basket fits screw drivers and punches (placed face down with handle up inside basket).I love now being able to go into the garage when I need something and can see exactly what it is I am looking for without any effort.  I love these so much I am going to buy at least 2 more sets.

Nope...not the same pens we all knew and loved years ago. Sad, but true. However, the ink is similar. The big plus is the fantastic array of colors these are now available in. As a self-described writing instrument freak, I love this box of 36 Tropical Vacation Colors. Just like the ones of old, these lay down color in a neat, thin line. They are like a thin version of the best markers you can think of. My handwriting tends to be on the larger side and I love to add doodles and flourishes to my notes. Whether those notes are a To Do list, a permission slip for the kids, or a page in my journal...it doesn't matter. Doodles and tiny drawings just kind of show up on things - and thanks to Flair pens, the doodles, writing, whatever, always turn out colorful and cute.With their smooth ink, these write beautifully. There is no drag, no scratching, no pen "pooping". The colors are bright and vivid, making it fun to read whatever is written with them. I use them for everything from grocery lists to art projects and scrapbooking. They are acid free, which is important in art. Most of the pens I buy are acid free - I don't want to find pens I love to use and then have to remember to keep them far away from my studio. The water based ink dries quickly. So quickly it's highly unlikely you will smear the ink just by writing or drawing with it. I appreciate that this set includes every Flair color there is - and I LOVE that there are 26 medium tips and 8 ultra fine tips. This is especially helpful when you use these as a sort of letter highlighter, which is one of my favorite ways to use these. Rather than using a thick highlighter to draw attention to an entire word, if you are creating decorative lettering these are impressive to add color to "plain" (or one-color) letters, for example. Their thin line is perfect to make each letter stroke stand out in an interesting, uncommon way.Whether you use these to create the base of your letters or sketch - or you prefer to use these to add detail and decorative embellishments to your writing, I'm confident you will adore these. Although I know there are some differences between this version and the "original" version from years ago, I'm just as happy with these little color monsters as I was with their predecessors. I don't plan on switching over to a totally different pen any time soon. I like these little guys and will keep using them for as long as they produce fine points in so many colors.

I accidentally purchased 1/2" tape the first time, not realizing that little 1/4" makes a difference, but that tiny bit makes an enormous difference! I love this tape width - it's nice and wide and works really well for everything from hanging notes on the door to wrapping presents. I've used countless other clear tapes and they just don't compare to Scotch. I'm guessing that's where the catch-all term "Scotch Tape" comes from. This disappears magically on the surface - just another guess, but I'm thinking that's why it's called "Magic Tape". ;) The tape is clear once adhered, but it becomes difficult to detect once you quickly rub a finger over it. It also doesn't show when copied with one of those excitin' newfangled copy machines. The adhesive is nice and sticky - and can even be gently peeled from some papers and surfaces to be re-stuck to something else! It is the exact opposite of those cheap, cellophane-like, shiny, slippery, skinny tapes. You can also write on this tape. How could it get any better??This is my very favorite tape...EVER.

I bought the Colorful Thumb Gel Ink Pens. Basically there are six tall pens constructed from rubber. At one end is the pen, the other end has a cartoonish hand - all in different positions. Each hand has a little black face located on the palm or on the fingers. There is a cap that fits onto the pen over the writing tip.You can see most of my review in the picture I attached, which was written with the pens. It will give you an idea of how the pens write - they aren't bad, but they do skip and "poop". I cannot stand pens that poop. That is THE quickest way for a pen to land in my "crappy pen basket". (Haha Altho unintentional, that's kind of funny that the "poopy" pens go in the "crappy" basket. Sorry.) The other issue I have a hard time getting over is the thickness of the pen barrel where I hold it to write. The length of the pen is basically soft and rubbery...except for the part where the ink must go up in the arm (?) of the pen. Right above the writing tip is a hard, thick, plastic piece - and it's very uncomfortable to write with. Yes, I understand these pens aren't for extended daily writing - I view them as more of a novelty. That said, if a pen is going to make it around here, even as a novelty item, it must be somewhat useful. Would I write an essay with this pen? No. Address holiday cards? No. Write a quick message in a birthday card to someone? Probably not. Sign for a package? Yeah, probably - if the pen was handy.The blue pen was DOA. Also, once you remove the caps from the pens, they never quite go back on correctly. (See photos.)These kind of remind me of pens a doctor's office would keep at the front desk for people to use to sign it...but that's about the extent of their function. If this was the pen I was handed to fill out paperwork, I would request a different pen. (That plastic part digs into the top knuckle of my middle finger, making it sore pretty quickly.) It was momentarily fun to twist the pen into different shapes - I can see how it would be easy to absent mindedly play with them while on the phone. The top half is easy to bend, and just as easy to straighten back out. The lower half of the pen, although not filled with ink, won't bend. (That is why only the tops of the pens are bent in my photo.) The photo of the red pen shows where the pen becomes hard and unyielding.It is due to those reasons that I gave the stars 4 stars. If it was solely based on writing performance and ink, I would rate these a 2.5.I am a total pen and marker FANATIC. I own more pens than is probably legal in most states. Most likely more than many countries have within their borders. I can't help it. It's an illness. I've had it my entire life - it's chronic, but thankfully not terminal. :)

I've fed my dogs Blue Buffalo for years. There has been some rhetoric about Blue Buffalo in general - some of which has caused me to seek out other foods for my little guys - but we always wind up returning to it. It's the only food I know they will eat. This Adult Small Breed is no exception. The dogs usually don't like the LifeSource Bits - I find them scattered on the floor around their food dish. Until this flavor. I don't know what's up with these LifeSource Bits versus the LifeSource Bits in the other flavors, but these VANISH. I think I have found one - and that was because it had rolled under the water bowl and they probably couldn't reach it.My teacup Chihuahua had Parvo as a pup. When I adopted her from the shelter no one mentioned she required a high protein diet because of this - and I had no idea. I found out, after feeding her a regular diet for awhile - that if she doesn't have the high protein, she vomits blood. Over and over - usually until we wind up at the animal ER. Some fluids and medications calm her system, but the high protein food seems to quell the problem altogether. Blue Buffalo is the brand the 3 of them like best of all the high protein foods we've tried...except the home-cooked high protein food. (Of course!) My vet has warned me about the nutritional deficiencies home-cooked food has long term, even if you are adding egg shell, etc for calcium and following other little tricks. I feel better about feeding them a good food that has been scientifically proven to be nutritionally sound.The small kibble is easy for tiny breeds to chew and I haven't seen any negative effects from this food. As long as their is a need for high protein food - they like the taste of this - and it keeps them healthy, this is our dog food of choice. If anything changes, I will update this review, but this will be in my little one's bowls until then. I don't mind spending the extra to know that they aren't eating "crap". (They probably do enough of that - for free - in the backyard.)

I'm a Venus fan. I prefer the Venus razor much more than any other razor on the market. I've been using the razor since it's public release in 2001 - my favorites are the Original Venus, Venus Divine and the Venus Embrace. I remember raving about it to my friends way back then, describing it like "shaving with a pillow attached to the razor" - it's that comfortable. I would know - my legs are sensitive, my bikini area is beyond sensitive, and I hate to shave. HATE IT. I have been known to do just about anything to avoid shaving, including trying the old EpiLady in 1990. (I shudder when thinking about that horrific experience!) Barring that one experience, I prefer just about any hair removal method short of shaving - waxing, buffing (which doesn't really work - but I still prefer treating my legs like a piece of wood to shaving!), even laser hair removal. The Venus razor toned down my razor despise...well, more than anything else has.I bought this version liking the small size - it seemed easy to travel with, especially with the included blue, transparent, hard, plastic case. And it is. However - I don't care for how the razor feels in my hand. Especially when shaving my pits. The way it sits in my hand is awkward and I usually wind up with at least one cut from it. (This from someone who has been shaving for about 30 years and could easily navigate a razor in the dark.) It's better when I use it on my legs...but who is going to use two razors?? Not this gal! Since it is interchangeable with other Venus and Mach3 blades, it's easy to replace the blade with whatever Venus blade you prefer. (Or to share the small size with your man and his Mach3 blades, but I don't know a man alive who would choose this over a full sized razor. The traveling convenience is just not worth the handling discomfort.) I am giving it to my daughter to see if she prefers this compact hair slicer. I'll stick to the full size Venus handle, thanks.PS - If you have trouble with razor burn or folliculitis, I have had great success with Venus razors and the pink Skintimate Shave GEL. I don't know why, but I know it's kept razor burn at bay for me, since I started using the two together. Changing razors (or blades, to be more specific) results in the painful folliculitis bumps coming back. Changing shaving gel brings back the same problems. I had folliculitis for years - it was so bad I had a prescription for topical erythromycin ever since I began shaving at 13. It was painful and probably "at the root" (haha) of why I detest shaving. However, those issues disappear when I use a Venus razor and the pink Skintimate Gel. I don't know what it is about the gel, but it works better than the cream. I'm serious. If you struggle with stuff like that, try it!On a tangent...Shaving just seems like a waste of time - I have long legs and it takes me a good 10-15 min to shave them. For what? So they can be stubbly the very next day and I can repeat the time-wasting, painful experience?? Ugh! I had gone with Dollar Shave Club once...BAD idea! Their stuff doesn't even remotely compare to the awesomeness of the Venus. It was like shaving with my grand dad's razor from the '70s! (Yes, like using his razor from the 1970s. A 40-ish year old razor blade. Unfortunately.)

Great little button batteries - they fit the flameless candles I bought them for. Mine arrived in the blister pack. I have used 3 of these - they don't seem to last quite as long as the original batteries that came with the candles, but they aren't bad. I get about 17 days of use out of them, using the candles on a 4 hour timer at night. They were inserted into the battery compartments in the candles when it snowed one night - and I forgot to grab the candles to bring them in. The next day I noticed the batteries did leave a little rust on the candles, but once they were dry the batteries worked just fine again. I was pretty impressed! (The rust wasn't bad at all - I say that as more of an informational piece for you to have, than as a complaint. I can't see it on my votive candles when they are displayed, so no harm, no foul.)At the rate of almost 2 batteries per month, per candle, I can tell I'm going to become very good friends with this seller. Since the batteries arrived quickly, are individually packaged, and are a decent price in comparison to similar batteries, I guess there are worse things that could happen. My front flowerbed looks beautiful all lit up with candles!

I like using this much better than vellum or other tracing papers I've tried - it has a surface that is much better to work on. At least with ink. I find I have issues with the ink skipping on vellum, and pencil lead smears terribly by the time I'm done with other tracing paper, but that is not the case with this. The Huion Tracing Paper accepts Pigma Micron ink writes like a dream! This is also cheaper - it's almost like getting double for your money. At about $0.08/sheet, it's a pretty good deal, as most tracing paper comes in pads of 50 sheets for a similar price. It fits the L4S light box perfectly and the clear plastic envelope it comes in works perfectly to keep the paper clean. I slid a piece of cardboard in the back of the sleeve for a little more support - just to make sure it doesn't bend or curl. So easy to see through - with or without the light box. I will definitely order more when this package runs out.

Very cute towel! It dries my dog quickly - and the towel itself dries pretty fast. The size is perfect for my little Chihuahua - at 44 x 27, it's certainly long enough to dry her off, but it's also perfect for wrapping her up afterwards. (Which she loves!) The towel doesn't seem to be a magnet for their hair, either - it's easy to take the towel outside and shake it out, but the towel does remove the hair that's loose after bath. I like that the towel is big for her for the reason I mentioned, but also because when I use small towels to dry her off, they get sopping wet and seem to stop working...this one doesn't do this. The green is a pretty mint-like and the embroidery is nicely sewn. The design is adorable, too!I actually purchased this one, the pink one (with WOOF and a little dog face), and the red one (with a paw print), so each of my pups has their own towel. All three towels are exactly the same (with different embroidered designs) and I recommend each of them. A great purchase -  it looks nice hanging in my bathroom - and it's awesome to keep the dog hair off my human towels!

Very cute towel! It dries my dog quickly - and the towel itself dries pretty fast. The size is perfect for my little Chihuahua - at 44 x 27, it's certainly long enough to dry her off, but it's also perfect for wrapping her up afterwards. (Which she loves!) The towel doesn't seem to be a magnet for their hair, either - it's easy to take the towel outside and shake it out, but the towel does remove the hair that's loose after bath. I like that the towel is big for her for the reason I mentioned, but also because when I use small towels to dry her off, they get sopping wet and seem to stop working...this one doesn't do this. The pink is a pretty pastel and the embroidery is nicely sewn. The design is adorable, too!I actually purchased this one, the green one (with a bone), and the red one (with a paw print), so each of my pups has their own towel. All three towels are exactly the same (with different embroidered designs) and I recommend each of them. A great purchase - and awesome to keep the dog hair off my human towels!

It's quite possible I live under a rock, but I don't know who Karim Rashid is, so that obviously didn't influence my decision to purchase this tape dispenser. What did? The little "hood" portion. I've had several regular tape dispensers over the years, but before I get to the end of the tape roll, I always wind up with dog hair and dust all over the tape. It seems to happen every single time. I thought this design may help to prevent that issue - and it does! I am totally thrilled with this dispenser - it looks nice, it's sleek and compact, you can pull and cut the tape with one hand, and even though the bottom is weighted, the dispenser itself is pretty lightweight. It should last forever, which is good - since I don't plan on parting with my furry roommates (and can't get away from dust). The price was also less than many of the traditional Scotch dispensers I looked at. Great buy!

Looking for something to seriously exfoliate your feet? This is exactly what you need! The deep purple side will slough off the most calloused skin, while the lighter purple side is a little more gentle. I use the dark side first, then kind of smooth things over with the lighter side. I have used Mr Pumice for years and know the price for this 4 pack is fantastic! (They are $2+ at a local beauty supply place.) These last a long time and leave your feet soft and smooth - without spending a long time, or expending a ton of effort smoothing out the rough spots. Using these Pumi Bars extend the length of time I can get out of pedicures. I highly recommend these - and with a pack of 4 you are covered for awhile.

I have thick hair and have always had to use conditioner after shampoo if I wanted to be able to get a brush through my hair. It's gotten better as I've cut my hair shorter, but without conditioner my hair has no shine or luster. And so it's been for 35ish years - whether I use cheap shampoo (Pantene, Herbal Essences, Aussie) or salon brands (Redkin, Biolage, Matrix). I've chosen to stick predominantly with cheap shampoos - if I'm going to get results so similar the gal who has cut my hair for about six years can't tell which one I'm using, why shell out the extra funds?Enter Bed Head. Ok - well, not all Bed Head - some haven't played well with my hair. (Short, color treated over graying, from stick straight my entire life to curly/frizzy over the last two or so years. I also use quite a bit of product to get some big time volume in my long-spiky-ish hair.) This Urban Antidotes Recovery 2 Shampoo and Conditioner? This totally rocks!No residue. Leaves my hair soft and shiny, but not "too" soft - it has body. It's easy to brush. I like running my hands through it (until I add all the product.) It smells pretty good. I no longer use a curling iron, but I like that it protects against thermal damage and split ends.If I love it so much, why only 4 stars instead of 5? There is no pump. Few things irritate me more than sellers misrepresenting their products. I will continue to use this shampoo, but I won't buy it from this seller again. The "free shipping" and the speed at which this conditioner arrived is nice. I always struggle with whether to deduct stars - or how many - if the seller screws up, versus the actual product. It isn't fair to ding the product for a seller's mistake - but all they need to do was put a photo of the actual bottle they are selling on there, and not make it appear to buyers that they would get more for their money.

I love me some black, ultra fine point Sharpies! The only thing better than an ultra fine point, black Sharpie is a box of 12 ultra fine point, black Sharpies - especially at this price! The permanent ink, combined with the awesomely ultra fine tip is what people adore about these marker pens. Very simple, but very powerful. These are kind of like the little black dress of mark making. The ink is fadeproof, the barrel is comfortable to hold, the marker/pen seems to be filled with a never-ending supply of deep black ink, and the tips spring back time after time. I can use one Sharpie for weeks without ever worrying about the tip flattening out. Sharpies can write on an incredible variety of surfaces - even writing on fabric, the writing is clear and readable (assuming it was legibly written ha). There is a reason Sharpie Ultra Fine Point Permanent Markers are a classic - and I don't see that changing anytime soon. These are the best...EVER!

I love me some black, fine point Sharpies! The only thing better than a fine point, black Sharpie is a box of 12 fine point, black Sharpies - especially at this price! The permanent ink, combined with the awesomely fine tip is what people adore about these marker pens. Very simple, but very powerful. These are kind of like the little black dress of mark making. The ink is fadeproof, the barrel is comfortable to hold, the marker/pen seems to be filled with a never-ending supply of deep black ink, and the tips spring back time after time. I can use one Sharpie for weeks without ever worrying about the tip flattening out. Sharpies can write on an incredible variety of surfaces - even writing on fabric, the writing is clear and readable. There is a reason Sharpie Fine Point Permanent Markers are a classic - and I don't see that changing anytime soon.

Sharpie is synonymous with rockin' markers. The wide variety of tips, combined with Sharpies amazing ink, produces some of the best loved markers ever invented. From metal to glass, fabric to paper, Sharpies are the go-to marker many people reach for when they need permanent ink. This has become especially true since Sharpie expanded their color line around 2002 - so there are now approximately 67 colors, 5 neon colors, and 3 metallics. That is a pretty enormous color expansion since the inception of the plain black in 1964. Sharpie has done their best to make sure they offer just about every pen style one could want - the regular thin barrel (ultra fine), the fine tip that has a slightly thicker (but very smooth) barrel, retractable, twin tip, super, mini, and the list goes on. There are also several different tips you can choose, depending on the width of the line desired...ultra fine, chisel, fine, and now BRUSH! (Please note that I will not touch on all the various "types" of markers offered by Sharpie in this review, but it is helpful to keep in mind that Sharpie is available in tons of forms - highlighters, markers, wax pencils, pens, paint pens and markers, industrial....and the list goes on. There is even a stainless steel version!)As a self-proclaimed pen freak, I was anxious to try Sharpies brush tip markers - I have a range of brush tip-type pens or markers, whatever term you want to use. Prismacolor, Marvy Uchida, Sargent Art, Tombow, Posca, Faber-Castell...the list goes on. And on. And on some more. Brush tips are not my favorite tips to use, but I do find they hold an important place in my art. For example, I would much rather use a brush marker (on most projects) than to drag out the paint and a paintbrush - many times it's possible to get similar results from a brush marker. I also like the interesting strokes you can get from brush tips, so I occasionally use them in my writing. Of course, some are better for writing purposes than others. The tips that don't spring back are a pain, as are the brush nibs that have a single stray hair, and the ones that release way too much ink.I haven't found Sharpie markers to have the issues that other markers have, no matter what tip I'm using. Their brush-tip is nice and tight - none of the sections of the nib hang loose or stick out, leaving stray marks. When writing, the tip "bounces" back to its original shape (after pushing it on paper to write) - and I found this to be true no matter how long I wrote with each one. I have noticed that if I color with pretty good pressure (so I'm utilizing the wider part of the tip), the tip does slightly degrade over time. I also enjoyed the resistance these offer - sorry, I can't think of another name for it. I like how they stay nice and thin at the tip, making it perfect for getting into small, detailed spaces. The beauty of brush tips - especially Sharpies - is that with a small pressure change of the hand, the overall look is completely different. I love that one marker can go from a thin tip, to a much thicker tip - all depending on how hard you press. I have noticed that many "cheap" brushes don't bounce back very well or very quickly once you've used them for a little while. Although the Sharpie brand falls into an affordable category, it performs much better than some higher priced markers - totally slays most brush tips (dare I say markers in general?) that fall into similar - and lower - price points.The ink these brush tips lay down is just as luscious and bold as it is with other Sharpie markers. This ink is fadeproof and "water-resistant", although in my brain I tend to think of them as "waterproof", since something like rain (or other small, quick exposures to water) hasn't ever affected my Sharpie-created projects. I'm not suggesting you dunk your newly created, favorite Sharpie masterpiece in a bathtub of water, but it's good to know that if you have to run to the car in a downpour - and you have your Sharpie creation in hand - it won't be ruined. I can't promise the same for the paper you used (wrinkles and buckles), but the ink should be alright.With the twelve pack you get a nice variety of colors, from the original basic colors to a few of the brighter colors - you will be hard pressed to notice you need a color that isn't included. ("Where's the Techno Blue color?" isn't likely to cross your mind. That said, including a lighter/brighter purple - in line with the lime and turquoise hues - would have significantly increased my color-love for this set.) The only thing I don't care for about the ink? The tips of lighter colors can sometimes pick up the darker colors used first. The ink in these brush-tips dries just as fast as the ink in the other Sharpie pen/marker varieties, but that doesn't always stop the color-pick-up I referenced a sentence ago. (This seems to be more of an issue on plastics than it does on paper, but I have encountered this issue on paper, as well.) When the tip picks up another color everything gets muddy - and many times you don't realize the other color has attached itself until you've placed the tip back on your project, and the muddy color makes a sudden streak - which causes me to shriek! That's never a good feeling, so it's one thing I watch out for when changing colors. (Checking becomes habit once you've ruined something you've spent hours creating.)I have noticed these seem to feather, or bleed, more than some of the more expensive brands do. (For example, compared to Prismacolor brush tips, I find the Sharpie brush tips bleeds noticeably more.) Very absorbent papers make this issue worse, so I would use a paper that contains a sizable amount of sizing. (Haha) These brush tips work awesomely well with the "Color Me" line of coloring books. They also work well on the mixed media paper I use (Strathmore) and a joy to use on watercolor paper, although depending on the fibers of the paper will, again, dictate the amount of feathering.Overall, I like these brush tip markers. They maintain the same level of quality we've all come to expect from Sharpie. HOWEVER, I believe it's important to remember the limitations of Sharpies - they are not created to be fine art markers. Without even thinking about it, I tend to abuse my Sharpies more than my fine brush tip markers. It totally isn't a conscious thing - I guess I'm just used to grabbing a Sharpie for so many different applications that these are no different. Using a light pressure, these are acceptable to write with and can create some awesome details, lines, flourishes, etc on the letters you draw. There are so many applications for these, bbbuuuutttt I won't be getting rid of my other Sharpie pens - with any nib - in favor of these. These have an important place in my art repertoire, but they won't/don't replace either my fine brush tip markers, or my other Sharpies. I will use these a lot while creating things I normally use Sharpies for (which is just about anything!) - they provide a totally different line than is possible with any of the other Sharpie tips.Are these as great as Sharpies typically are? Yes. The ink is just as bright, bold, and brilliant. It's fun (and useful) to use one pen to make fine and wide lines just by varying your hand pressure - which is something you just can't do with a fine marker. Even a chisel tip won't produce similar results. If you like Sharpies and appreciate brush tip markers, you will undoubtedly love these. If you are looking for a brush nib to create fine art, I would most likely skip these and head for a "fine art" marker. For everyday use? These ROCK! For drawing interesting designs on fabric? These are a WINNER! For creating detailed compositions on paper intended for fine art? I'd definitely do a test first to check feathering. I'm glad I have these and think the price I paid was very fair - 12 markers for around $13 is hard to beat, especially when free shipping is included.I didn't mean for this to be so long, but I told you...I am a pen/marker FIEND! If there is anything I didn't cover, or you have any additional questions, I am happy to answer them. Just leave a comment and I will respond quickly. Thanks for reading - I hope this helped you make an informed decision about the Sharpie Brush-Tip Permanent Markers.

What a great idea! I'm so sick of trying to leave notes for myself all over the place, but constantly losing them and never remembering what the note said in the first place. Yes, I can put stuff in my phone - but I'm one of the "old schoolers". Since I grew up with pen and paper, then spent my early adulthood writing everything down in Day Planners...so writing reminders, notes, and To Do lists is just much more natural for me. It's faster for me to just write it - and actually seeing the reminder sitting in front of me (rather than being hidden on my phone in some app) reminds me that I need to do/get/buy/pick up/etc whatever it is.This is such a great idea - it's one of those "why didn't I think of that" kind of things. These make infinite more sense than trying to use sticky notes on your purse or car. Now I can loop one of these around my steering wheel to remind me to give the kids lunch money - instead of writing it on a Post-It, which falls down on the floor, I don't see it, forget to give the kids lunch money, the school calls - mad (for the second time that week!) and I worry that I'm a horrible mother because I send my children off to school so they can starve. So in a round-about way, these nifty new Post-It Reminder Tags are making me a better parent, which will allow my children to grow up and be more productive, responsible, nutritionally balanced citizens. WOW - who knew these were awesome enough to (possibly) change our world's future??So you better buy yours now, before everyone finds out about these and the rush hits. If you don't, you'll be one of "those" parents, who has one of "those" kids ("those" kids always spring forth from "those" parents, ya know)...and just imagine what people will be saying about your grandchildren! <gasp> OR YOUR GREAT-GRANDCHILDREN!! Please...stop the horror altogether...just buy the Post-It Reminder Tags already! Oh - just so you know, they took FOREVER to get here...twelve days. Much longer than one usually waits for an Amazon delivery.However, ordering them now will still put you ahead of all your friends. And your kids-friends-parents. And your friends parents...

I had never worked with this stuff before, but it's really easy and fun to use while decorating for Halloween. You don't need much - a little goes a long way. That said, I purposely purchased this one because the title says "Glow in the Dark Spider Webs" - and this does NOT glow in the dark. At all. That was disappointing - had I known this wasn't glow in the dark I would have used the coupon I had to buy this at 50% off locally. False advertising bugs me so bad that I deducted two stars for that.It's easy to attach this almost anywhere - it doesn't require tape or additional adhesive. It sticks on anything rough, which made it perfect for my back fence. The effects are great!
