I am stoked at the seemingly unending list of items I can stick together with this. And let's be honest...holding the light on the curing glue is just FUN.

This is so much better than anything I had imagined!! First of all, it arrived much faster than anticipated - which I really appreciate. I ordered it late on a Wed, was due to arrive ten days later on Fri, but actually got here Mon. Not bad when something arrives four days early!I had no idea that this is as freaky as it is. It's almost...just...wrong. Unless you're twisted and looking to freak people out - then this is the perfect decoration for you! It is not motion activated, but rather it must be moved. I hung it on my back fence and every time the gate would shut (on its own - I didn't push or slam it), the motha' would go off. Ghostly, kind-of muffled nursery rhymes emanate from this 24" thang. (Approximately 24".) The baby is tucked safely in the old lady's arms, which may or may not be good. (No one will be grabbing this baby away from her!) The eyes light up and flash - they are the bright white LEDs. It is AWESOME!I bought several decorations this year - and made quite a few - this and the skeleton dog I bought (http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KRLEG3Y?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00) are tied as my favorites. This mother/baby combo is just plain CREEPY. There really isn't another word that fits as well. I think the front door would be the perfect place to hang this - it seems small to put on the ground. (Maybe a stake that would prop her up above something else in front of her to hide the stake?)She does require two AA batteries, which she does NOT come with. They are easily placed in the battery compartment, which is also where the ON/OFF switch is. Just a note: I would most likely not have purchased this when my kids were little. (Now that they are teenagers, all bets are off. I want to scare them silly! Haha) I think this would seriously scare most kids - and not in a fun way. You may want to consider that prior to purchasing...and perhaps before deciding on her location. She will definitely cause a stir, and people will certainly ask about her. She wickedly creeps you out. All that for less than $30? A delightfully good deal. Dare I say it's dead on?? A morbidly good deal? Of corpse it is!Seriously...I'm so glad I bought this. You should be dying to get one. If you get one, you will most likely want morgue. If you can't afford one, maybe your mummy could help you? Ahh, come on, don't be a baby - this mother really sings! Should I put a mort-atorium on this already? Well, that would just be rotten. I'm so sorry for this disgustion...please don't lose your decomposure. (I'm dying!) Oh this has become a grave situation...it's tomb much! This review has obviously turned into a malignant tomber. I will wrap this up <cough> by saying that this item is quite lively - and you will dig it.Now admit it. This review took DEADication.(If you think I nailed this - or you think I'm dead wrong - if I URNed it, would you please mark this killer review as helpful? It would sure add some life to this!)

This is one of the good cases that I love. Sometimes it's hard to tell online what you're getting, especially if you aren't familiar with all the terms of cell phone cases. This has the rubbery top and bottom, which really protects your phone when you drop it. The gold is a pretty brushed gold and stands out with the black. The openings line up perfectly with all the buttons and charger port, and the buttons have the same rubbery feel that the top and bottom have. Doesn't add an enormous amount of bulk to your phone like some cases do. Sexy case - a great choice for men!

I bought these for my daughter - who absolutely loves them. They fit her well and are comfortable. They've held up after daily wear and lots of washing over the last few months. The colors are just as pictured. They still fit the same as they did on day one. This style is so cute, these almost look more like shorts than undies. A great purchase!

Black soap? Yes - and it's awesome! The shape is fantastic for holding in wet hands - it doesn't slip and slide out of your grip. It is very easy to lather up due to the shape, also. Just rubbing the bar between wet hands produces a great lather - the bar has these large gritty things embedded in it, which really help to make your skin feel clean. I love to gently rub the gritty bar directly onto my face, but I have to be really gentle and careful. It's too powerful for me to rub anywhere but on my cheeks, forehead and the bridge of my nose - but even just lathering the bar between my hands and then rubbing the lather onto my face produces skin so clean it literally squeaks, and so soft it's tough to keep your hands off of it.I use this bar at night and the pump in my morning shower. (http://www.amazon.com/Biore-Deep-Charcoal-Cleanser-Ounce/dp/B00NO2466K/ref=pd_sim_194_1?ie=UTF8&refRID=12GSJG3YPDA6SPVY59VM&dpID=41jkfx%2B14EL&dpSrc=sims&preST=_AC_UL160_SR160%2C160_) Both have a slight minty scent, which surprised me - but I love. (The pump has little beads, which pop as you rub them in.) The scent isn't overpowering, it's just right. The bar leaves your skin fresh, brisk, and rejuvenated. You know the scrubbing bubbles that clean your bathroom? Every time I wash my face with this delicious bar, I visualize little scrubbing bubbles cleaning each individual pore...setting up the scaffolding, jumping into the pores and scrubbing like crazy, then using a tiny squeegee to make sure everything is nice, clean, and shiny...before packing up and moving onto the next pore.I'm so glad I found this - it has replaced the daily face wash I had used for years. If you are looking for a good deep cleanser for your face, this is probably what you want.

Quite possibly the biggest piece of junk blanket I've ever purchased - whether it's for me or the dogs. I ordered several dog blankets this week as we just adopted (yet another) dog from the local shelter. Considered a small dog (Chihuahua/Italian Greyhound mix) anyway, she is very malnourished. The vet told me to make sure she's dressed as it gets colder (Denver winters can get downright cold!) and provide her with several blankets she can lay on. This was, by far, the worst of the blankets I purchased. It is the worst blanket I've ever bought - for anyone - at any price point.The fabric is thin. Big "flakes" of lint are coming off EVERYWHERE. The blanket is shedding worse than all three of my dogs put together. The edges are turned over and stitched pretty straight, but it's tough to use a blanket that leaves pieces of itself all over the place. It isn't very soft and definitely not real warm. The fleece is low quality. No one lays on this blanket, even though all 4 of the blankets were put in similar high traffic areas. For an additional $5, the dogs and I are infinitely happier with the DII Bone Dry Warm, Soft, Plush, Microfiber Pet Blanket for Couch, Car, Trunk, Cage, Kennel, Dog House, 36"x48". (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KXX545A?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s01) The other blanket may be smaller and cost more, but it's sooo much softer, warmer, and better than this one. They both shipped and arrived quickly.I would never put this in my car - I can't imagine trying to get the "fleece flakes" out of the carpet. It's a low quality piece of fabric that collects static electricity - and lint! - like crazy. If the choice is nothing but a cold floor and this, I would have to think about it. There isn't much heat generated from this and the blanket lacks fluff - it's just flat. I can't recommend this blanket.Photos: First and third photos show the "fleece flakes" left behind on my sheets after the blanket was had just been set on the bed for a minute. The second photo is the tag. Third photo shows how nicely the blanket is sown around the edges...the only positive quality I found in this blanket.

My 6', 150 lbs daughter wears these and not only looks fabulous, but she loves the tops, too! Anyone who shops for a teenage girl knows the impossibility of finding something the mother and daughter can agree on. Although I'm pretty liberal (my daughter has had every color of the rainbow in her hair - six times each! ha), we still argue over what is appropriate. She's into dance and gymnastics, so I'm used to her wanting to wear yoga pants and tank tops...to the gym. When she began wanting to wear them as a sophomore in high school, I get a little, er, bent out of shape.I finally got over myself and we agreed that she can wear yoga pants/leggings in public (rather than just to the gym) as long as her hind end is covered. That's a tall order (ha) since she's beginning to pass the 6' mark. (My son is 6'9", so who knows where she'll end up!) These shirts actually work - they are amazingly just long enough to cover her rear. The burnout pattern is cute without revealing too much. The colors are pretty and the pack of three is a nice selection. She's worn these shirts a lot - and they are a fair price. The sizing seems to run just a little large, but not enough to change ordering your normal size. I would definitely order these again - they're great for going to dance/gymnastics, the gym, and for wearing when you're out running errands.At most you are paying just under $10/shirt. These are a nice quality for that price and she wants me to order more...which I will do as soon as I finish writing this review. There are fun color combinations available - and it's very hard to beat the price.

For someone into mixed media art, these are exceptional! I could not be happier with these. I had a set of watercolor brush pens before, but they leaked all over and were just, frankly, a total pain in the butt. That hasn't been the case with these. I purchased these a few weeks ago and made sure I played with them quite a bit before posting a review. These lay down gorgeous color, which just gets darker and more intense the longer you keep the brush pen in one spot. Normally, when I use watercolors on top of modeling paste or spackle, the colors are very muted and soft. I have a hard time building up the color intensity over these other mediums - and it gets frustrating. The only way I can seem to get a good, solid color is to apply some clear gesso over the texture paste...but that hasn't been my experience with these.I am not a painter - and especially don't consider myself a watercolor expert. I just like to play...mixing paints and other mediums into strange soups and concoctions. I don't really pay attention to what I'm doing - I feel like adding something, or playing with some supply, and I go for it. If I don't like it I can always scrape it off, sop it up, or paint over it. This no-fear method has been working exceptionally well for me - and these are among the supplies I reach for the most. This will sound really odd (not if you knew me lol), but last night I used these to make gray male hair for a Styrofoam mannequin male head I'm making. (It's part of an all-out Halloween display I'm making for my back deck.) I unrolled a bunch of cotton balls (all I had on hand), put them in a little cup like the ones you get when you order take out and get a sauce. I painted the top of this cotton pile with the gray watercolor brush pen...then dumped water into the little cup. I began using my pan watercolors and a brush to add more gray and black to the cotton-filled water...but I wasn't getting the dark color I really wanted. Back to coloring the wet cotton with these brush pens.I left the cotton sitting in the blackish water for awhile, then carefully wrung out the excess water, spread out the cotton again, then left it sitting on parchment paper overnight so it could dry. It turned out wonderfully, thanks to these Akashiya Sai Watercolor Brush Pens. I just started adding the hair to the head, but it really looks like my neighbor, which is who I'm modeling this guy after. Yes, my use is conventional - but I LOVE these, no matter the purpose!!(I used the watercolor pens to add color to the textured flowers - done on a birch panel - in the first photo. The second and third photos depict a small portion of the cotton "hair".)

This and the Layered Wildflower Stencil are my FAVORITES! I love how they look when used alone - and I love them when they are both used in one project. Suh-WEET! I will cop to owning WAY too many stencils...ok, art supplies in general. (I don't have a husband who tells me to stop buying these things...haha) This is the same quality Time Holtz, Stampers Anonymous, and Ranger are known for. The mylar stencil material is the perfect thickness - the stencil is firm, the design is fully cut out, and it's thick enough to make applying modeling paste (or other texture) very easy. It is sturdy, well as sturdy as a stencil can be that has more negative space than positive. I always have problems with the stencils made from cheap mylar - the little parts of the design (pieces that hang or stick out) always bend or allow whatever media you're working with to travel under the stencil. That doesn't happen with the Tim Holtz stencils I've used - and hasn't been an issue at all with this stencil in particular. You'll want to be much more patient and careful than I am when you clean your stencils...lest yours wind up with little bent pieces like tend to. (Which is totally my fault - using a toothbrush, especially an electric one - on this IS a little overkill. Little bit.)Easy and quick to clean. Holds up well - the image is as clean the 92nd time as it is the first time - the plastic mylar doesn't degrade. I haven't found an art supply yet that doesn't work well with these - besides using this to add texture, I like using watercolors on the texture paste I've used (I really love Faber-Castell's Whipped Spackle - a new-to-me supply that just ROCKS!), then wicking the color away from the edges with a paper towel, so the design kind of looks like it's melting into the board. I can't imagine the stencil trend will slow down any time soon, making these a terrific investment with truly countless uses. Creating art is fun when using high quality supplies - and this fits in that category perfectly!

Hi - my name is Katherine and I own WAY too many stencils. (Well, my "sponsor" would have me cop to owning way too many art supplies in general, but for the purposes of this review, we'll just stick to the stencil category.) ;) This is the same quality Time Holtz, Stampers Anonymous, and Ranger are known for. The mylar stencil material is the perfect thickness - the stencil is firm, the design is fully cut out, and it's thick enough to make applying modeling paste (or other texture) very easy. It is sturdy, well as sturdy as a stencil can be that has more negative space than positive. I always have problems with the stencils made from cheap mylar - the little parts of the design (pieces that hang or stick out) always bend or allow whatever media you're working with to travel under the stencil. That doesn't happen with the Tim Holtz stencils I've used - and hasn't been an issue at all with this stencil in particular. You'll want to be much more patient and careful than I am when you clean your stencils...lest yours wind up with little bent pieces like mine do. I like this image - it can be used with light colors to form a background image, or it can be much bolder and really hold its own as the main image.Easy and quick to clean. Holds up well - the image is as clean the 92nd time as it is the first time - the plastic mylar doesn't degrade. I haven't found an art supply yet that doesn't work well with these - besides using this to add texture, I like coloring the empty space with markers or watercolor pencils, then remove the stencil and spray lightly with water. The original design is still vibrant, but (if you've chosen to use either warm OR cool colors - not both) you will get beautiful run-off colors that add dimension to your project in a way totally different than using a 3D texture). I can't imagine the stencil trend will slow down any time soon, making these a terrific investment with truly countless uses. Creating art is fun when using high quality supplies - and this fits in that category perfectly!

So this arrived without the spongy doe foot applicator. It was just the plastic stick - making it impossible to try. The primer won't adhere to the stick, so it's tough to even get enough out to try. Which is a big bummer since I was really stoked to try this after reading all the positive reviews. When I first saw the price I thought "no way!"...but it kept calling to me, like the cookie jar your mom told you not to touch when you were 5. So I would come back and look at it, re-reading the reviews. Sooner-than-I-knew-what-was-happening-I-put-it-in-my-cart-and-checked-out-before-I-could-change-my-mind. It arrived quickly and I set it aside, dying to use it, but not willing to waste my new "potion" until I actually put on a full face of make up. (I don't wear make up everyday.)I had just the right occasion picked out...and as I began to apply my make up, the anticipation toward using this was building. Like a tidal wave. I reached for it...I had held the tube in my hands several times before, so it was a combination of the familiar and something new and exciting...I twisted open the very cool top...and...what the heck is this? This is weird - hadn't I read there was a spongy doe foot applicator? This was just a plastic stick with a minuscule blob of product on the end. I was torn for a minute...maybe I was mistaken and there wasn't a spongy doe foot applicator...maybe this is how women are applying it? So I raise the stick to my eye...and proceed to gash myself in my sensitive eyelid. OUCH! That was much sharper than I anticipated..."why do women put up with this crap??" I wondered - aloud. I put it aside and applied the rest of my make up, kind of deflated that my new best friend let me down. (Wasn't this supposed to be life-changing??)I looked at the reviews and description again later that day - and sure enough, I had received a defective product. So...so...sooo (lip quivering) HEARTBREAKING! I contacted Amazon, who contacted the seller...who got in touch with me and requested photos. I took some and sent them back to the seller (the same ones I'm placing here) and the seller was very nice to refund my money. I'm incredibly sad they are out of this alluring UD Anti-Aging Eyeshadow Primer Potion...EDIT (11.17.15) - A commenter was kind enough to let me know I didn't really review this product. After telling you about my experience, I kind of left it at that. In my brain, I figured I had left a review for the item I received and used...but I should have discussed the product here, too. I apologize for not doing that and instead, being a little lame in the brain. Below is the review portion of the response I sent to the commenter. It is still available in the comments - but I pasted this part up in the review so it's all together. I hope this is helpful! -KBThis seller did right by me, by refunding my money after I discovered the applicator was broken. I wanted to just exchange the broken one for a new one from this seller, but unfortunately they were sold out. I went to another seller and was able to buy the primer from them. I didn't post this review until I tried the primer. After reviewing my review (that sounds funny), I realize I didn't say much about the product. I found the product to be good, even though I don't know a whole lot about primers. It did keep my eye makeup on all day - and my eye shadow didn't crease. (It usually does.) I like how it makes my skin feel almost "velvety" when I put it on. I don't wear makeup often, but after using this I have reevaluated that habit and am wearing it more often. I think I quit wearing makeup because I was sick of spending time applying it in the morning, but by lunch I either needed to reapply - or spend the rest of the day looking like I'd never really put makeup on in the first place. Ok, I take that back - it looked like I put eye makeup on in my eyelid creases, and a some black stuff smudged under my eyes. This primer has totally fixed that - I can put on my makeup at 6 in the morning, and it stays until I take it off at 10:30 or 11 that night. I would say that's pretty good!Ironically, the second seller I purchased from shows an applicator in their product photo - but they sent me the wrong size. The smaller size they sent me does not come with an applicator, nor does it have the cool little prismatic top this one has. So I still haven't seen or tried the applicator! ;)

This is the first time I've ordered Faber-Castell's Whipped Spackle - I've always used modeling paste and been quite happy with it. I decided to try this because I'm always on the hunt for new products, and with Faber-Castell's home-run-hit with Gelatos has prompted me to try some of their new stuff. I've always liked Faber-Castell, but never really thought of them as being at the forefront of new art/craft trends. They've blown that incorrect ideation to smithereens with Gelatos. I can't get enough of those colorful, sumptuous sticks of goodness.I'm glad I gave this a try. I love how lightweight it is - the container weighs next to nothing! Getting the Whipped Spackle on my palette knife was easy and took no time at all. It was a light, creamy consistency. I know that with molding paste I sometimes have to stir is all up, then do a balancing dance from the modeling paste container to my project. One tiny little misstep and BLAM! I've made a mess where I've dropped the blob of modeling paste. That wasn't my experience with this stuff - it was very easy to scoop an appropriate amount onto the palette knife (even the really skinny, plastic palette knife!) and the product is so lightweight that it didn't cause the palette knife to tilt off-balance.I wanted to try it with a new stencil I had just received from Tim Holtz, Layered Wildflowers. The whipped consistency made it so easy to spread the spackle - and it fit into all the little stencil crevices in the most amazing way! I kept looking at all the thin little stems on the stencil, checking to see what areas I would have to go over again. Umm...NONE! This dreamy paste fully filled even the tiniest of spaces. That is something I can rarely say about modeling paste, since it is usually my experience that modeling paste can be difficult to get into small crevices - without it traveling under the stencil and making an awful mess. This was so much easier to control - to me it was like frosting a cake with peanut butter (modeling paste) for years, then frosting a cake with thinned frosting or softened butter. The consistency is that easy - and there is that much difference between the two.Don't let the ease of application fool you - this stuff is SUPER strong once it has cured. It dries pretty quickly, doesn't lift or peel, and dries hard enough to sand it. I haven't tried to carve it when it's dry as I find it is easier to quickly draw designs in it while it is still wet. I wouldn't think twice about using my Dremel on this. It is also really easy to color - on the photos I've included I didn't add color until it was dry, but then I quickly (sloppily) painted the raised areas with watercolors. Gelatos, acrylic paints, tints, Perfect Pearls, etc - I can't think of anything that wouldn't color this stuff. If you are looking for a fun new supply to play with, while wanting something that has strength and durability, you've stumbled across an awesome item that I would absolutely recommend. I like this so much that I don't believe I will return to regular modeling paste once this container of Whipped Spackle is finished. This would be great for experienced artists as well as those new to the arts and crafts arena.

My dogs LOVE these. I have say that upon opening the bag, the smell does seem enticing - the aroma of fresh beef jerky wafts from the bag. If I wasn't paying attention, I would probably eat one of these by mistake, just based on their smell. Yep - it's that good! (Even the back of the package says "These treats smell so good you might want to eat one, but they are not for human consumption". Haha!)The sticks are about 8" and are packaged in a resealable foil pouch. Even keeping these resealed in the pouch does not keep them from getting a little hard over time, though. (My dogs gobble them up so fast that I'm not even sure they notice!) About every 3/4" of an inch there are lines in the meaty stick, making it very easy for the person to tear them up into bite-sized treats - and there are approximately 10 bite-sized chunks to a stick. This also makes these so easy to carry in my pocket to use a potty training and barking-cessation incentives.The pouch proudly proclaims "Made in the USA" and it lists an address of Provo, Utah, USA. I think they are right on to be proud of that fact as I know the country of manufacturing is one thing I look for when purchasing items for my dogs. (I have three small dogs - a teacup Chihuahua, a Chorgi (Chihuahua + Corgi), and a Chihuahua/Italian Greyhound mix that we acquired only about a week ago.)IngredientsBeef, Rice Protein, Spices, Salt, Sugar, Garlic Powder, Sorbic Acid. The package also states "No wheat, soy, corn, or gluten". All of that sounds great to me!I am unable to find the serving information anywhere on the package, but I give my pups a few of the .75" chunks I tear up when we go on our walks and they do something great...and I give them any leftovers when we return home. The real bonus is that you can get these $10 cheaper here, on Amazon, than you can get them on the company's website. What's not to love about these??

My daughter and I have the same size feet, so even though I bought these for her, we both wear them. I think they are so comfortable! There is not much support, but since I've worn Keds for years, that doesn't really bother me. Converse are the only brand that don't rub the top of my big toe (around the nail) wrong - I can wear these for hours and not have my big toe hurt from the pressure of the top of the shoe. These are really cute - they are easily grunged down or can be dressed up with jeans and a cute shirt.Bottom Line: There are few things that a 15 year old girl and her mom agree on - but we both like these shoes. We now have 3 pairs - light pink, black, and these "optical white" ones - and there are days when we argue over who gets to wear these. The only complaint I have is that every pair we own makes a cardboard popping sound when you walk. It's toward the ball of the foot - and when the shoe creases, there is an audible sound coming from the shoe. It's weird! I don't have any other shoes that do this, but all three pairs on the Converse do. It isn't bad enough that I'll stop wearing these - I love them! - but it's just something weird I've noticed and thought I would pass on, in case someone else has the same issue. I usually prefer going barefoot or just wearing socks - but I don't mind wearing these cool shoes. I can honestly say they are like wearing nothing - and my daughter says she agrees. I will be buying more colors.

I am not a hiker. I am not a biker.I do not watch birds. Or deer. Or leopards.I have never sat in a tree, pondering small things I could not see.I have lived my entire life, without ever wanting to play a fife.I have traveled both near and far - and never missed owning binocular(s).As you can see from my well-written prose, I've been fine with glasses held up by my nose.I don't recall aching for close up views - I've never felt slighted or gotten the blues.I thought I was looking at things just fine, but with these you'll see a balding man's hairline.The binoculars, strap, and cleaning cloth are all brand new - thank you for reading this lame ol' review!I deducted half a star because I have a difficult time seeing out of them - they don't seem to fit my face very well. I am so not a binoculars expert, but I like how well these magnify distant objects. The price was perfect for someone who doesn't need or want "top of the line", but wants to utilize the benefits of binoculars on an occasional basis. I like the bigger front lens and 12x magnification is awesome for my viewing needs. I haven't tried the waterproof feature, however I can see surprisingly well with these at night. I would recommend these - especially for first-time buyers and those who will use them for fun. I'm guessing a sniper might need something a little better...but I'm not sniping anything, so I think these are great. I deducted the other half star because the directions seem thorough - but they are only in Chinese, which isn't very helpful to me. The packing is excellent and the item seems durable.

This is the bigger size jars, providing you with enough delicious Radiant Gels Dimensional Paint to complete many projects. The glossy depths of this paint is a true feast for the eyes. These are so excellent for paper, fabric, etc. You can apply them with a spatula/palette knife, which gives lots of texture and an amazingly iridescent layers of brilliant color. You can apply these with a wet paintbrush, not dripping wet, but with enough water to cause the paint to apply smoothly, without the texture marks. The color is still rich and brilliant, it just acts more like a paint. Apply the paint with a wetter paintbrush and you get a more liquid consistency (these are pretty thick in their natural state), but the color saturation doesn't change. It's great to have so many consistency levels to choose from, but not have the intensity of the color vary. No matter how you choose to use them, they scream GLOSSY COLOR.Mixing them with gel medium will provide a more translucent, lighter shade of the same color. Running your fingers over this paint after it has cured is luxurious. Smooth, slick paint with the textural bumps and dimension...YUM!These paints really do look like a glaze. They take longer to cure than regular paints - they'll dry to the touch pretty quickly (or you can use a heat gun), but it can take a full 7 days for these to fully cure. Radiant Gels work terrifically with stencils - you can decide to build up just a little texture, or go all out and frost that thang! Whether you choose to apply a smooth coat, or a textural masterpiece, these are so much fun to play with. Whether you get all 20 vibrant colors or just a couple, these will add interest and extreme glam to any surface lucky enough to be drenched in them. LOVE THEM!ColourArte did a wonderful job getting the paint colors pretty exact in their photos. The color I see on my test paper looks identical to the hue in the photo.

Hangs securely from the wall, freeing up the drawer I normally throw the hair dryer in. I also don't have to deal with leaving that drawer partially open anymore - without having cords poking out from the drawer my knees are saved from smacking them on the side of the drawer. (We all know how comfortable that is!) This saves a ton of space and doesn't look goofy on the wall. My hair dryer fits perfectly in it - and I would think many sizes of dryers would comfortably fit. That's the genius of this design - the dryer can sit further in (or further back) the holder depending on the width of the nozzle. I also like that using this means I save valuable real estate on the bathroom counter. I'm really glad I bought this and recommend it.

This fine little contraption has remedied the problems related to my inability to remember to turn off our back porch light during the day. I use the GE 90w halogen bulb (I get them in two packs at Wally World) and they work perfectly with this adapter. The shipping is extremely quick and the item is ready to go right out of the box. There is a way to fine tune the sensor if you need to tweak it, but it worked just as it arrived. I didn't have to even mess with it. I like how this is saving the bulb so it only runs at night - and I don't have to remember to turn it on and off. It causes the light to come on when it is nearly totally dark outside - about the same time my car would activate the headlights. Since it faces east, it flips off in the morning before I even notice it's on.This is one of the best purchases I've made in a long while!

Love, love, LOVE. Go buy some! It would be very easy to stop my review right there, but that doesn't really tell you why this stuff is so great.All of the stupendous properties of gesso, in a clear medium. No chalky, thick white stuff anymore - you can't see this when it dries. Much like gel medium, it goes on with a whitish tint - but dries crystal clear. How do they get all the goodness of gesso in this stuff - and keep it clear? My favorite bonus of this stuff is the ability to draw or paint - then mix this with clear varnish (also by Liquitex) in equal parts and apply it to my piece before going onto the next layer. The varnish seals in the previous layer and the clear gesso provides a perfect surface for the next layer. It leaves the perfect amount of tooth on your surface to really grab onto whatever you add next. And you can see the layer under it! No longer are you torn between adding more gesso while obliterating the work you've already done, or living with a less than ideal surface so you can see what's under the gesso. This opens up a whole new world of beautiful surfaces you can paint on. It's awesome - and the price on Amazon is...WOW! Less than half what HL charges - on the rare occasion I can locate it there.Liquitex Professional Clear Fesso Surface Prep Medium makes me swoon.

I love the look of these lights - they come nicely wound on a piece of cardboard, making them very easy to put on a project. (No tangled mess right out of the box...but, if you're like me, the tangled mess is just waiting for YOU to get your hands on them!) They also put off a very pleasing amount of light. I really like how they make my old train lantern look - with glass on both sides, the lanterns almost seem to glow. Beautiful! However...the problem I have isn't with the beauty of the lights - it has more to do with the honkin' size of the solar panels.I thought I would be able to hide the panels inside the lanterns - if they were placed in the back of the lantern there should be enough sunlight traveling through the glass to allow the lights to recharge. Maybe that's true...but the panels are so huge that there is NO WAY they are fitting in the lantern. The solar panels do come with stakes so you can firmly plant them in the ground, which would be awesome if I were placing these lights on a bush or something. Trying to wrap the wire from the panels to the actual light string was somewhat comical - I didn't want to wind them too tightly or the light wouldn't swing on the shepherd's hook like it's supposed to. Wrapping them more loosely meant I didn't have enough unlit wire to reach from the lantern to the ground. (The lantern is hanging about 4' above the ground.) Winding the wire down the shaft of the shepherd's hook is the only way I can try to hide the massive panels.These are just not right for my project. The panels are easily moved to face any direction thanks to the brilliant hinged design, so it is easy to make sure they get enough sun to charge the lights all night. My lights kick on about 7pm and start to fizzle around 3am - I'm very happy with that length of time. I would order these again if I had a place to hide the panels - just be aware they are really big. (They are 3.5"x5", and that's just the panel part - not including the hinged back or the stake.)

This is the bigger size jars, providing you with enough delicious Radiant Gels Dimensional Paint to complete many projects. The glossy depths of this paint is a true feast for the eyes. These are so excellent for paper, fabric, etc. You can apply them with a spatula/palette knife, which gives lots of texture and an amazingly iridescent layers of brilliant color. You can apply these with a wet paintbrush, not dripping wet, but with enough water to cause the paint to apply smoothly, without the texture marks. The color is still rich and brilliant, it just acts more like a paint. Apply the paint with a wetter paintbrush and you get a more liquid consistency (these are pretty thick in their natural state), but the color saturation doesn't change. It's great to have so many consistency levels to choose from, but not have the intensity of the color vary. No matter how you choose to use them, they scream GLOSSY COLOR.Mixing them with gel medium will provide a more translucent, lighter shade of the same color. Running your fingers over this paint after it has cured is luxurious. Smooth, slick paint with the textural bumps and dimension...YUM!These paints really do look like a glaze. They take longer to cure than regular paints - they'll dry to the touch pretty quickly (or you can use a heat gun), but it can take a full 7 days for these to fully cure. Radiant Gels work terrifically with stencils - you can decide to build up just a little texture, or go all out and frost that thang! Whether you choose to apply a smooth coat, or a textural masterpiece, these are so much fun to play with. Whether you get all 20 vibrant colors or just a couple, these will add interest and extreme glam to any surface lucky enough to be drenched in them. LOVE THEM!ColourArte did a wonderful job getting the paint colors pretty exact in their photos. The color I see on my test paper looks identical to the hue in the photo.

Fantastic for erasing in tight spaces. I use these so much in my art - I don't know what I would do without them. The awesome pen-like cover keeps the erasers nice and clean, advancing just as much as you need based on how many "clicks" you push the eraser out. It's just as easy to retract the eraser back into the housing. The refills are easy to find and the price is awesome. These last forever! I also like to use these erasers to carve long, skinny stamps into. I love how well they work - for many situations!

As a pen and marker freak, I'm not sure what all the hubbub is about with these. It is a nice storage box of 15 brush-like markers. I was in love with the Stamper's Big White Pen and began using it as soon as it was released. It's a great pen, but it's more about the color for me. I have a lot of trouble with white pens and markers, so when I find a good one, I stick with it. My love for that marker pen is what led me to this kit.I am just not real impressed. Being a pen and marker mutant means that I have a lot of markers and pens. A LOT. With all the positive reviews I've seen on these, I guess I thought they were something "new" and "better"...but that hasn't been my experience. They are good markers - don't get me wrong. However, at Amazon's price of $58.50, that's $3.90 each. (I've seen these sets listed at scrapbooking and stamping stores for upwards of $80!) There is a wide range of pens and markers available in the $4 price range. I believe that $4 is a pretty good amount of money to spend on one pen or marker - especially if the writing instrument doesn't offer anything unique or special. I've thought this about the Copics and the Spectrum Noir markers I have. (I realize I'm comparing alcohol markers to India ink.) I like that these are waterproof, but they can smear - it happened on a wood panel I was working on.This is a good set to acquire if you are a stamping maniac - a bit pricey, but good quality. For more experienced artists who ave accumulated tons of pens and markers, I would give some thought as to whether you really need these in your collection. They are redundant for me - I have lots of other markers with various inks, including some with India ink. I also have India inks (in pure ink form) that I can use or put in an empty marker barrel if I need the ink in marker form.Gelatos are a totally different type supply...but I would much rather spend my money on Gelatos than on these. I like them so much more and think they are really versatile and interesting to work with.The colors are strong and pretty. I like using these and I enjoy how smoothly they draw. The color lay down is nice, which I believe is due to the nibs. The nibs are like a nice paintbrush - they spring back after using them and are pretty decent at laying down a fine line. (Not real fine - remember, these are fat markers...but the line can be as thin as the nib. The nib doesn't splay out as soon as it touches paper.) I'm not a big stamper so I'm not sure how these do with stamps...but I can tell you that they are ok for mixed media. Certainly nothing you must have in your collection, but a good start if you are just getting into the creative game. I'm probably going to get nailed for this review, but I can't honestly give them five stars - I don't think they are outstanding enough to deserve that rating.

My mom used Bounce when I was growing up and because of that, it has always been included in my laundry adventures. The smell is delicious, but not overpowering. As the price has slowly climbed over the years, I have tried generic brands. Every store brand I've tried has not come anywhere close to the predictable results of Bounce. When I got rid of my ancient washer and dryer a few years ago in favor of new HE machines (big mistake!), I changed over to a well-known, liquid, blue fabric softener based on the recommendation of the salesman. WHOOPS! I wound up throwing over half that bottle away - and returned to Bounce.Bounce makes my clothes soft and they smell good. I will admit to not fully knowing about static cling until I changed brands of fabric softener, but upon crawling back to Bounce, every single time I was quickly reminded how static cling doesn't have to play even the slightest role in your laundry, or life. The price I've found here on Amazon absolutely blows away the prices demanded by local stores - we're talking about paying a THIRD of local prices. If I can buy three of these on Amazon for the cost of one locally - including shipping - I'm sold! I truly don't know why anyone would waste their money on another fabric softener...Bounce is that good. I have a lifetime of experience being surrounded by fabrics dried with it...and that won't change anytime soon. When you find

Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for a fair and honest review.So, I am actually using this as my primary wallet at this point. It has the 6 slots, which I basically use for 3 bank cards, a local store card, my ID, and my insurance card. I also have kept some cash in one of those as well (I'll leave the 3rd bank card at home when I actually have cash to carry).That is basically a full load for this, so if you plan to carry a lot more, you should either invest in something larger, or include this in your daily stuff.It actually looks a little bit like a cigarette case, lol, although smaller. Basically, it's the size of your cards, with about a quarter inch thickness.I've also tested it on some card scanners, and it does block the scanners, so from that standpoint, it does effectively handle its advertised duty.It looks nice and so far has been quite durable. I'll be interested to see how long the clasp holds up (it's a little push clasp that seals it). If it does wear out, I will note it in this review.

Helldivers is hella fun!Seriously, right now, I cant think of a better co-op experience. The action is tense, the maps look cool, and the enemies are tough without being overwhelming, and even when they roll over you, the game never feels cheap. You can revive yourself as long as you are still able to crawl, a teammate can expedite the process, and if you do die, your teammates can set a beacon that revives you. There are a ton of upgrades to your weapons, special abilities (which take the form of calling in ammo, special equipment, ally revives, etc...), and so on. There are two different vehicles your team can pile into that are also armed. The missions make sense.Anyway, this twin stick squad shooter basically gets everything right. You will want to play this.

Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for a fair and honest reviewSo, this is a handy little item if you enjoy a bottle of wine from time to time. It is really as simple as putting the cutter in the proper place over the foil, squeezing, and twisting.The foil then comes off in one convenient and non messy piece. It literally requires no effort, and the grip design makes it easy to manipulate. The case was a nice touch btw. You wont ever lose this, and it looks nice as an added bonus. Very well thought out and well crafted device.

Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for a fair and honest reviewSo, overall I think this stand does its job well. The fans do keep the PS4 noticeably cooler. It's also nice that while it takes one of your two USB ports from your PS4, it adds three. Also, being able to use it as a charging hub for your controllers is nice as well. Time will tell how good this really is, but so far I would say it is above average with two noteworthy negatives.One is that it is loud. Much louder than the PS4 itself. That definitely needs to be worked on.Two is that it isnt really secure. You can easily knock your PS4 off the stand, as, at least with the one I received, there is no way to secure it.

This is another great album from the Viking gods, lol.Seriously, it's just as rocking and in your face as the previous album, but with a bit more melody and some seriously tasty riffs. Still unrelenting and still demanding your attention, they also show a bit more musicianship on this album, and features some of my current favorite songs. This is an easy recommendation for classic rock, hard rock, stoner rock,and metal fans alike.

Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for a fair and honest reviewSo, this little charger has actually been a revelation. For one thing, it actually fits the port in the car perfectly, which is actually pretty rare with these car chargers, meaning that you dont have to keep pushing it in to keep it working. It's in and it's staying in. Additionally, it does charge pretty fast. I can charge my Win 8 phone completely in the time it takes me to get to work (so about 20-25 minutes), which is nice.The little cup that comes with it is nice. The vent bracket that comes with it doesnt fit in my cars vents (Nissan standard), so that is something to consider for future production, but the cup itself is nice and does in fact keep my phone secure and safe from jostling and such. It is also convenient for pens, keys, and such.This product I would definitely buy had I not received a review copy.One note with all of these chargers is that they typically lose some effectiveness after three months or so....so I will monitor that and adjust my review if necessary after three months have elapsed (we're at about three weeks right now since review copies were sent out).

Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for a fair and honest reviewSo, I had the opportunity to test this out over the better part of the last two weeks or so, and my findings are as follows:The bag itself is very nice looking. The product page pic is accurate, so you can get a good sense for its appearance. That yellow box-ish thing on the side of the pic actually goes into the main pouch and essentially serves as the frame for the bag and the compartment for carrying your camera. It has a little zippered mesh pouch on the inside of that top flap, and the flap itself velcro seals. Additionally, the actual main compartment can be zippered shut. The outside pouches arent very large, but big enough to carry small accessories, a cell phone, keys, and so on. There are two in the front and one on each end of the bag. There is also another zippered pouch on the inside. All in all, this bag is definitely ideal for a photographer.It does have one real flaw however which keeps me from giving it five stars, and that is the fact that the bags flap doesnt really stay closed, making using the inside zipper a necessity. It has two button on the flaps straps which close, but they are strong enough to stay closed with even the lightest contact. That definitely needs to be fixed with later production runs of this bag. Also, while you can use the straps on the top flap as a handle if you dont want to use the shoulder strap, there isnt really a top handle like with most messenger/photographer bags I have owned. Now, the fact that the flap doesnt stay closed would render this useless anyway, but assuming they fix the design flaw with the flap, I figure they would also want to add a carrying handle to the top as well.Anyway, in my opinion this is a good bag, solidly built, and with plenty of convenient features. As things stand now, I can still recommend it, but I'd like to see the issues I mentioned worked on as well.

Disclaimer: I received these in exchange for a fair and honest reviewSo, these insoles conceptually are a great design. Because they are 3/4 sized, they dont fill up your shoe, which I have found to be an issue with insoles as there typically isnt enough room for your toes and you insole in most shoes that I wear.They are also truly comfortable when worn. I dont know about massaging per se, but they are soft and feel nice.However, they have a real design flaw in that they slide around, and so what starts as a very comfortable experience soon turns to aggravation. In fact, if you arent in a position to adjust them for whatever reason, they will definitely start to hurt your feet once they start to slide.So, sadly i cant recommend these. If they fix the design to keep them from sliding around, they would easily earn a 5 star rating, but right now, they are only good for an hour or two before they slide, and so arent worthy of your purchase unless you arent on your feet for long periods of time (in which case I would definitely recommend them). Hopefully that aspect is fixed with future production of these insoles.

Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for a fair and honest review.I've had this for about a week and a half or so now (the same as all the other reviewers on here actually). I've had the opportunity to test the charge a reasonable amount now. I cant speak to storage degradation yet, as that typically only reveals itself over a few months based on my experience, but what I can speak to is the fact that this charger/flashlight does hold enough power to charge my Win8 phone twice with a little power left (enough to leave the flashlight on for another half hour or so before it drains completely). It's definitely the perfect size to carry around in your pocket, and the charge cord that came with mine is also short enough to be carried around comfortably as well. It also features a wrist strap, which is an uncommon but very welcome addition. Beyond that, the flashlight itself is pretty bright. Definitely good enough for walking down a dark hallway, looking through packages, checking some stuff out under the hood of your car, and so on. The one I received was the blue colored one, and it looks pretty cool as well. Also really easy to find with the bright color.All told, this is a pretty simple, yet completely functional charger/light that does exactly what it sets out to do. For $15 or less, you wot find many that are better,

This is an epic and awesome album! The music is so tight and well thought out, and quite frankly resonates through my being while listening to it. Randy did the amazing and sorted through his last couple years of adversity and change via the lyrics as well. Really, this is their best album yet IMO, isnt afraid to stray from the LoG norm a bit while still retaining its identity, and is just flat out one of the best albums I have heard in a long time, from beginning to end. Overlord and Delusion Pandemic are my two favorite songs on the album, but they are all amazing. Definitely pick this one up.

Disclaimer: I received this product in exchange for a fair and honest reviewThis is actually the perfect wallet for me. The one I received has the window sleeve on one side for my ID and three sleeves on the other which I use for debit cards. There is also a center slot in which I carry cash and a credit card sized phone charger.Accommodates my needs perfectly, and so far has held up quite well to daily use.There isnt really anything else to report yet except that the sleeves are snug enough for your cards to not accidentally fall out, but not so much that you actually have a difficult time managing your cards.Stellar product.

Disclaimer: I received these for a dollar via a reviewer program with this company (MIRA)So, this set of three stainless steel snack container with sealable lids are really quite well made and useful. They are the perfect size to send along with my daughter when she goes to the babysitters while we are at work. The lids seal perfectly, dont leak, and dont just pop off randomly. They are tight and secure. Additionally, they are supremely easy to clean (and they keep our backpacks clean as well). We've also used these on little hiking trips and long drives, and they have functioned perfectly for those as well.All in all, not a lot to report except that they are exactly as they claim to be and are perfect for a number of practical uses.

Disclaimer: I received this in exchange for a fair and honest reviewSo, this was a cool and unexpected review request that caters to a couple of my interests (music, oriental instruments, Zelda), so I was definitely going to try this out.First off, it's not very large. The Ocarina fits in the palm of my hand. The product page picture is pretty exact as far as its appearance goes, and it comes with a nice travel pouch, a lanyard, and a little booklet that teaches you the basics of playing this instrument. The actual craftsmanship is really top tier as well. Nice finish, gloss, and firing.Obviously, to become truly proficient, you will need to practice this quite a bit, but it was simple enough to pick up the basics as demonstrated in the booklet. The tone is pretty spot on from what I can tell by comparing it to some random ocarina tunes I looked up after receiving this. It sounds quite pleasant. It shares a lot of commonality with a variety of old school flutes produced in the various ancient cultures of the world.All in all, I would say this is a wonderful little instrument that will be fun for kids and adults alike, and may have more uses than imagines (such as taking it with to a Comiccon and such).It's easy to recommend this instrument.

I really enjoyed this game a lot. It was a stellar mix of action with an amazing movie tied in. The voice acting was top notch as were the graphics, and the pacing was excellent. Additionally, the level design worked well with this game, and some of the levels were just flat out awesome. Additionally, I loved the new IP created for this with the Knight of the Round Table in a steampunk late 1800's setting. I really have nothing bad to say about this game. To me, much like Ryse, this game was panned unfairly in my opinion. I dont think I would have been stoked to pay $60 for this game, but I purchased it for $20 and felt like I got well more than my money's worth out of it. I hope they continue with the series, as this was designed to be the first in what will probably be a trilogy if they continue with the IP.

This was a fascinating tale of exploration and the retracing of exploration with very real care and attention paid to detail. Mr Grann really does this entire topic justice and honors both the dead and the living as he explores the mysteries surrounding Sir Percy Fawcett's final expedition, and also does a great job of detailing the mans life leading up to that final fateful journey from which he never returned. Plus, Mr Grann happens to basically complete the journey for the long deceased Fawcett through diligent research and perseverance in the face of adversity. I found this to be a compelling and fascinating book that I simply could not put down once I had begun reading it.

This was a very interesting read, if taken as the gathering of ideas and facts found by others and compiled into one book. A lot of good information makes its way into this publication, and it is actually a fairly engaging read. However, there are some glaring issues with some of the dates and such in the book. A lot of things presented as fact are actually wrong (and you can find a decent summation of these things in some of the other reviews, so I wont rehash them here). Also, there is a huge leap from the history of the Templars during the Sinclair and Columbus ages to the assumption that pirates were almost all Templars or influenced by them. Outside of the aforementioned actual errors with timelines and the people involved, the leap of faith in this regard is fairly unacceptable. I actually believe that a lot of the Templar fleet and their crews did in fact become pirates, but there needs to be more research into it rather than simply wanting it to be so, and then making the claim in a book as has happened here. To me, this reads more as a fanciful idea of what was rather than a factual one. The author wanted it to be so, and so represented things from his viewpoint rather than do his due diligence in investigating how the Templar fleet really could have become the Pirates of the Caribbean and such as is claimed within.Now, I did enjoy reading this book, but the intellectual laziness and questionable ethics involved in actually writing it force me to give this only two stars, and if it wasn't such a fun read, I would have given it one star.Also, there are a ton of editing issues as well. Somebody probably should have proofread this book before publishing it.

This is probably the best controller I have ever owned. It is super comfortable and just the right size, and the addition of the touch pad was nothing short of brilliant. This really is the top tier controller design at this point....except for the battery life. For as much effort as they put into this controllers design, you would think they would have thought through things better when it came to the POS battery they included, and since it's not really removable, you are kind of stuck with what you get, which, given some of the other features of the gamepad such as the cool light, fairly well guarantees that you will get at best between 4 to 6 hours per charge. When you consider that a pair of AA batteries gets me around 30 hours of life for my 360 gamepads AND the fact that I can use rechargeable batteries for them, this was an unacceptable design choice on Sony's part, and as such, I knock a star off the rating to reflect this fact. It really is an amazing controller, but seriously Sony....get your stuff together and remedy the battery situation.
Nice detail, actually pretty solid, and a pleasing addition to our home. It looks exactly like the picture actually.

This is an essential device if you enjoy PC gaming but want to use a wireless controller. It's plug and play and picks up your controller signal from quite a ways away actually (I've tested out to 75 feet and across two stories). People have a tendency to leave this on top of their towers. I would advise against that. The only reason these typically stop working is do to heat exposure (or water damage) from what I've seen. Anyway, if you use a wireless controller, this is a must own, and the best one out there that I've come across.

This was a fun movie. Obviously, you dont go into a movie like this thinking there is going to be an amazing story in it, so if you do, it's sort of your bad. Visually, it is pretty stunning at times, the action sequences such as they are, look really cool, and all the actors seemed to be having a great time. The kid really steals the show. He was actually a really good actor and the role was sort of compelling. Anyway, if you like big explosions and a bit of a tamer Samuel Jackson, this is a movie you should watch for sure.

I didnt buy this since it was offered as a Plus freebie, but I have played it almost exclusively for like two weeks now and have all but the 500km and plat trophy as of this posting. Anyway, this game is simply good addictive fun that ends up taking over your life, lol. Soccer played in rocket powered cars/vans. Laughably simple idea executed to perfection. It features offline seasons and exhibitions so you can play by yourself against bots (not sure if there is local co-op or not) as well as a full tutorial broken down into sections to teach the basic mechanics of the game. However, online matches are definitely the way to go. 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 4v4 (ranked matches dont include the 4v4 chaos though). You have basic mathces and ranked matches. Ranked matches are a little more tricky because when somebody quits (and somebody always ends up quitting at some point), the match doesnt autopopulate with anybody queued to play or with bots, so your teams can end up unbalanced. Of course, the flip side of this is that when you win a 1 or 2 on 3 match, it is especially sweet! Speaking of autopopulating, that's what happens in non ranked matches as people quit. It just fills the void, either with another player or, if another player isnt available for whatever reason, it fills the blanks with bots.So, thems the basics. There is turbo boost, acquired by running over little turbo buffs located at specific spots in the arena (they are always at the same spots, and reset after like 15 seconds), which fills your counter part way (except for 6 100% boost buffs located on the axis points). You can use the boost to literally fly, drive on the walls, and for a little while, even on the ceiling, giving this game a 360 degree 3D aspect to it. Anything can potentially happen at anytime, and the matches are often chaotic as can be. That said, when a team gels, it is something to behold. Which leads me to another aspect.....team building. Via invites, you can make sure that you and up to 3 of your friends can play on the same teams for every match, giving you the ability to develop in game strategies, made even easier if everybody uses headsets.Anyway, that is a quick summation of this game. Once you play, you will likely want to keep on playing for a while. It is just some of the best fun to be had out there.

Disclaimer: I received this and one other bottle from the distributor in exchange for a fair and honest review. The results were the same with both (outside of their cosmetic differences), so I will be posting both reviews identically.Anyway, as I sit here typing this review, I am literally sipping from this bottle. So, there is that.The pink top and base are fairly basic, but my wife likes it (and this one is hers, so that works out quite well).The double walled glass (glass inside plastic) does definitely make it more durable as my butter fingers can attest to, having already dropped it a couple times, lol.The cap screws on and feature a nice, wider spout to drink from, which I found to be an unexpected and pleasant surprise. It also features an actual locking system to keep it from just popping open inadvertently (it's a hinge top lid). It's a simple safety switch (basically looks like a slliding light switch). This makes it super reliable and convenient under any number of circumstances. Finally, it has a nice handle on top as well, which is adustable up and down and can be used to carry or hang the bottle as you see fit.It does hold exactly 16 ounces with no overflow.I've also noticed that the double layers insulate my drinks a little better, meaning they stay cold longer.Cleaning it is super easy since it isnt that difficult to take the inside bottle out.The only actual complaint I have is that the info sheet is packaged between the layers making your first time removing the glass a little difficult (and you will need to in order to remove the sleeve). This doesnt impact the quality of the design at all, but I would simply put the sheet inside the glass bottle in future shipments so it is easily removed.Great product that, as mentioned before, is being used right at this moment.
