There are recipes for fruit butters, chutneys, conserves, marmalades, jams, and jellies...some of the more unusual, chocolate raspberry, banana, kiwi, prickly pear, quince, plumcot, and more.  Then there's a chapter on "micro-mini" jams which are very small batches of jam, cooked in the microwave.  Then another chapter on Special Jams, spreads, and mincemeats--no-cook, light no-cook, no-sugar, low-sugar, etc.. It ends with recipes to use your creations.  This book is a treasure trove of information and recipes, even a specific piece of info regarding liquid pectin brands that I wasn't aware of and how it determines your process of making the preserve in the first place. I hope to make something in the next few days when time allows. I will update more as I go along.UPDATE:  Made the Strawberry Cantaloupe Jam, (used raspberries bc I had them frozen from my summer bounty)...set well, easy, tasty. I made Kiwi Jam, worked great. Made Orange Mango Jam and Tropical Tango Spread, tasty.  The Tropical Tango Spread was looser, and I believe that is why it is called "spread."  I tried the Tequila Sunrise Jelly, but that didn't gel at all.  It was a syrup. So I will use it as that, adding it to seltzers. But I won't make it again. Made Mojito Jelly using up the mint running wild in the garden, along with lime juice and rum. Bits of mint float suspended in jelly, tastes just like the summer drink, one of my faves!  It also gives on the same page, ways to change it up making it Mexican Mojito (w/tequila) and Mint Julep Mojito (w/bourbon).  Made the Rosemary Apple Cider Jelly, set well, and it uses a little sprig of rosemary inserted in jars for visual effect. Made Garlic Jelly, yes, garlic jelly, so easy.  Uses your choice of liquid--apple juice, white wine, or water. I used white wine. THen you use either cider or white wine vinegar, I used the latter.  Add some sugar and pectin, done.  The chopped garlic pieces suspend nicely, even right after processing, which is often worrisome bc particles tend to float to the top until it gels.  Anyway, it's used for deglazing pans for gravy and other meat condiments.  You can add a little sprig of rosemary to jar too, which I love to do.  I am on a roll lately, a jelly roll I guess you could say!  Off to the store today to stock up on more jars!

Zero stars....I had this only 2 weeks; one day I opened the freezer and it showed -40 degrees, and of course, I knew that made no sense. Upon closer inspection, I saw that the entire inside strip of the thermometer split in two, rendering it useless.  So in short, it shattered inside the freezer, duh...this is where it was supposed to be at home, in a freezer. I have heard of the expression 'couldn't take the heat', but this piece of junk couldn't take the take the freezing COLD.  I threw away the receipt when I got it figuring no problem would arise, and certainly not so soon. I have purchased other refrigerator/freezer thermometers and never had issues before, so I assumed the same was true again...WRONG! I am appreciative that Amazon refunded me w/o a hassle. Now I can buy another brand freezer thermometer and recommend you do too!

I started out using Domino Light and now in stores it's practically impossible to find, so I use this brand now. It's just as good.  D. LIght had 32 ozs, this one has 24 ozs, otherwise a similarly good replacement.  I have found this on sale in supermarkets for about $6, give or take; so this price, $12 and change for two, is fair.  I don't use it for baking but I would if I baked!  I use it mainly in my multiple morning cups of coffee.  It has NO aftertaste to me, probably bc it has some sugar in it.  I feel better taking this bc it contains Stevia.  Since so much bad press is out there about Splenda, I don't use Splenda anymore.  This is the one for me now.

I bought this a yr ago and put it aside bc it seemed inferior to the other pans I had; the others were heavier and had perforated holes and brand names.  But I decided to use this pan the other day bc i needed a larger 16" pizza, and now I love it.  I love the flat shape, I HATE pans with the rolled up edges, HATE it with a passion, bc when you oil the pan and stretch the dough on a pan like that, the dough keeps sliding down so you lose at least an inch of diameter. If you use a 16" pan of a ROLLED edge pan, you're lucky if it is 14 to 15 inches when you're done. This one is totally FLAT, so you can push and stretch the dough to the very end of the pan utilizing the entire surface area and it stays put.  You still have to oil the pan well, but now it won't slide back on you.  I am into this pan and plan to buy one for my son and his wife! I make my own homemade pizza doughs, at least 2x a month, I cook them in oven in cooler months and outdoors directly on the BBQ grill with the pans, they stand up to the heat w/o warping.  The 16" size is the maximum size I can fit into the oven, or else I'd buy even a bigger pan!

THE LONGEST RIDE was just that....a very LONG story that dragged on a bit too slowly. It just didn't work that well for me.  I knew nothing of the special ending many have said existed before in another novel, but I kind of predicted it, which is ok, but the getting there was a bit of a drag.  THe good thing is, altho' i don't have high blood pressure,  my blood pressure must have been lowered by 10 points each time I sat down to read it though....almost like taking a drug to relax you.

Taste is a personal matter I suppose. I liked the Keurig Kona when it was offered, so I tried one box of this Kona to see if it's one I would take to. I don't like it as much as the Kona I remember, that's all I can say.  It has a bitter or burnt afternote to me, one that I do not care for. I am one for Tully's Italian and Starbucks Verona and the Sumatra coffee beans, they all taste smooth to me and not bitter at all.  Yes, this doesn't seem like a medium roast, more toward a dark roast to me, but I like dark roast bc I put dairy in my coffee...so it's not that that I am concerned about, it's the taste in general.
excellent, dark roast coffee.  Nuff said.

Surprised how good it is. Bought it in a chain store pharmacy and glad I did.  I got the "color me money" bc it had a neutral green, and being a brunette, I always liked that color on brunettes with brown eyes. It is great, goes on smoothly w/a fingertip on my lids. Looking forward to trying more colors.

Excellent coffee, not bitter, just plain good.  I found it in The Christmas Tree Shoppes, sold in boxes of 12 for $6.99.  If you get a good price for it, try it.  I use dairy in my coffee, so I like a 'dark roast' and this is dark roast. If you like something milder, try their Costa Rican variety, it's a medium roast.
Best for a Fall color.  Seems one coat is sufficient, that's the good news.  Just thought it was a lighter hue and that I could wear it now in summer.

Bought this for a friend and loved it so much I bought myself one. I have another book on tagine cooking, but this one looked too good to pass up--especially for the price. If you are new to this type of cuisine, I would try this one... not a million ingredients needed and very approachable recipes...meat, seafood, and vegetarian. A previous review complained of the use of cooked fruit...this is a very common ingredient in Morocco, dried apricots, raisins, etc., are prevalent. I don't like that much fruit in my savory meals either, so I simply use it sparingly. Another review stated they wished there were more vegetarian recipes, I found there to be quite a lot!  And those with meat can be made w/o the meat. In fact, some of the recipes in front of book using lamb, I will substitute chicken or beef bc I am not a fan of lamb. You still get the different spice mixes and blends to make each of those recipes different than another. Recipes can always be tweaked. These are no exception. Cooking is not an exact science like baking is, so make it your own. It shouldn't hold one back from seeing the good that this book offers.  There's a color pic of each recipe too, which I love!  It has fewer recipes than other books, but it's also half the price of other books.  So I think to be fair, you have to look at all the pros and cons, and for the money, this is a good book to have.

With two coats, a perfectly purplish taupe neutral, smooth and streakless...this color is especially good for someone like me with shorter nails hoping to grow longer one day. Quality polish, good value.

I can't say much about the quality or safety of this brand. As with all dog food I have no idea what is actually in this or where the ingredients come from or where it's really made. I haven't heard of any problems but when you do it's usually too late. Having said that like human food we have to have some trust.The real test is what do the puppies think. Well, like every dog food we've tried it's dog food. When they are hungry they will eat it but just because it's dinner time doesn't mean they will.Bottom line is it is dog food, tastes like dog food and appears to be made like most dog food.

I got a pair of over the ear headphones of the same brand which are fantastic and built well. I saw these and was curious what the little caps would do and how well these would fit. I've never really cared for in ear buds as I've always had trouble keeping them in, especially if I'm moving about or working out.This company seems to strive for solid, well built equipment. These have the same quality as the set of headphones I have.They come with several sizes of tips. I found the smallest set worked the best for me and the best to keep them in my ear. These are metal and as expected they are heavier than most plastic earbuds. And since they are long they tend to hang out more and didn't always stay in for me. If I sit still they aren't bad for relaxing and listening to music.Sound is fantastic! Very clear, no hissing or other noticeable disturbances. They sound solid. There are three end caps that affect the sound and are labeled as black for Pop, titanium for Jazz and silver for Classic. For my ears the titanium/Jazz had more bass with the silver being the highest sounding with lighter base.  I think once you put on the ones that sound best to you they will stay. It's a bit much to count on them to switch sounds when desired.They work well with my iPod. There is a switch on the cord for Play and Pause.Overall, they are a great sounding set of earbuds and fit just as well if not better than a lot of other earbuds.

If you are interested in Pilates this is a good book to become familiar with Pilates, how it started and why and an idea of what the exercises are. However, it is really difficult to do the exercises based on the instructions and illustrations. Doing them step by step doesn't really give you a good idea how they should be done. You are better off finding a video.

I've used a few of these for my NAS devices including a WD NAS and they work well, run cool and have decent speed. The problem is the NAS, you can't just swap from one NAS to another like you could if it was formatted for Windows or Mac. Once the NAS dies, and they do, you have to start over and hope you have another copy of what was on the NAS.

It works, holds water, has a long hose and a mouth piece. I have to admit, though, I don't care for these and prefer just a plain old water bottle.One reason is all this water that you really can't share (I suppose it depends on who you are with). It's a pain to take it out of the backpack, fill it up, then work it back into the backpack and route the hose. Cleaning is a real chore. I don't need a drink every 5 minutes so a water bottle within a decent reach is easy for me.

Once you start a video it works great, I've never had a glitch yet. But it always starts in horizontal mode even if you stream it off to another device. I can usually find my favorite programs but finding a movie to watch that Saturday night is time consuming and most of the time a waste of time.But overall for those regular programs it works well.
These turn your GU10 LED bulbs into standard lamp bulbs. They work great but just they can be slightly loose so handle with care.

We've been using Brita Filter Pitchers for years mainly clean up the taste. They do not make water drinkable and should not be used in place of boiling water. These filters remove or reduce some chemical, metals, minerals, etc. But I do like the filtered taste especially after it's been chilled in the refrigerator.
Not great, smells, and you have to wonder what is really in it that you aren't rinsing out?So is it clean or worse?I did receive this product for my honest review.
It's been a long time, I missed them!

I've been roasting for over 15 years. I started with his coffee book, most of us did back then. But this one is all over the place and not even on par with what I learned over 15 years ago. No idea where he was at with this one. The terms and explanations are nothing close to what my coffee broker uses who is a member of the Specialty Coffee Association of America. The coffee Davids seems to discuss is the mass market, large volume plantations which don't even compare to the smaller best grown lots.
Our grandson loves Daniel Tiger. These books are well made with thick sturdy pages and good colorful illustrations. He loves books!

We've found lots of uses for laminating at home. Here in the NW we can usually count on rain so we laminated our yard sale signs. This also makes them stand more against the wind and easier to hang. I've laminated hiking maps, camera filter conversions, and more.
Bright low voltage set of LED lamps. Much brighter than a normal bulb.I did receive these for my HONEST review.

Our grandson loves the book but especially pushing the button. He's gone to the regular potty a few times but sometimes he's hesitant so we thought this might help us convince him since he loves Daniel Tiger. We'll see. But it's a good book with thick sturdy pages.

My wife got a sample of this and we thought it was great - soft and subtle to the nose. But the bottle we got was harsh and strong. I couldn't get away from it all day even after she left the house. Could be the sample was weak but this is a strong perfume, the kind you go what was she wearing.
A fun set. May be frustrating as the ball is not going to roll as expected. Not sure how long these will last but hopefully not before they out grow it.
Excellent way to disperse drip lines. Each individual segment can be adjusted. Does not fit directly on hose will need half inch step down.
Sturdy stakes great for holding down small diameter drip lines.
Every Daniel Tiger fan must have this book. Colorful illustrations one hard thick pages.
Every American should see this movie.

For the price and what little I currently need one for this is a great little welder.You have variable control over the wire feed but only two voltage settings. I've mainly tried 1/8 inch steel. A setting of 5 for the wire feed and Max voltage worked pretty well. I do need to fine tune from there but it's a good start.It comes with a welding mask but you have to hold it so you lose one hand. I got the  Antra AH6-260-0000 Solar Power Auto Darkening Welding Helmet with AntFi260 Wide Shade Range 4/5-9/9-13 with Grinding Feature Extra lens covers Good for Arc Tig Mig Plasma CSA/ANSI Certified By Colts Lab which works great.For gloves I got Lincoln Electric KH641 Leather Welding Gloves, One Size, GreyThis is easy to carry it's not heavy and has a great handle.The one problem is where to hang the cord and cables. I'll have to make something...Overall this is a great welder for the price.

We've had a carbon monoxide before but was ruined by leaking Costco batteries. So we needed to replace it and got this one. Our last one had a digital readout but it never read anything except maybe couple of times in several years but was so low it didn't matter. So why pay extra for what you don't use? But you never know when that silent killer will enter your house so to be safe it's best to have one of these working in your house.

I prefer on-ear/over the ear headphones. For me they say on and I don't have to worry about them falling out and having to reset them in my ears.I have a few sets ranging from these at $17 retail to a set of Bose at $300. For the price these are a great set of headphones.They fit well if you like them hugging your ears. I notice they are there but they aren't uncomfortable or painful like some can be.They adjust to length and swivel at the ear pieces to get a good fit.The cord length works great. I can plug them into my MacBook at my desk but also my iPad on my and without too much excess.They look great all white. I have to wonder how long they will hold up before they start showing any markings or get that soiled look.But the important thing is that they sound great! I'm listening to some Blues as I type this. The deep bass, guitars, drums and vocals are all clear.Overall, this is a great set of on ear headphones especially at this price!

It's a belt. If you wear leather belts with your jeans than this should look ok but it's not dressy.All of my leather belts say so, usually burnt into the backside. There are no markings on this. It looks like leather but doesn't have that sweet smell that I love of leather. And it kinks with straight lines  like cardboard instead of those cool leather wrinkles.The buckle looks like it was dragged across a gravel road. Not brushed but scratched up.It's a decent belt to hold your jeans up. Not too expensive, the price reflects the type of leather belt this is.I did receive a promotional discount for this belt for my very honest review.

This is one bad boy! You definitely do not want to look into it, it is bright even with just the one middle light on.I've used headlamps for years over a flashlight. They leave your hands free to do the task at hand. I've used them for backpacking, hiking, biking, working around the house (like up in the attic in those close corners or under the sink fixing the plumbing), working on my car (under the hood and under the car), behind the TV hooking up wires, when the power goes out, so many things you can use these for.This one has one main light and two side lights.Four modes: main light, two side lights, all three, all three blinking.One switch on top of the main light.Comes with rechargeable batteries (type 18650).Comes with a charger, USB cable to charge and even comes with a car charger.Fits well and comfortable although for long use you may want something soft behind the front part, you'll be rubbing on a little plastic but a lot of times I'm wearing a cap or helmet.Tilts up and down.Does not zoom. Be careful trying to turn it, the front lens will come off.Good construction, well made, should hold up to tough conditions but I always take a spare even when using a more expensive lamp.I did receive a promotional discount for my honest review but this really is a fantastic light and will be my go to light!
Our grandson got this set for his birthday. Anyone who loves Daniel Tiger has to have this set! The arms move and heads swivel.

Out on the freeway I'd get a lot of wind noise around the doors of my 93 Pathfinder. I didn't remove the old I just laid this around the door jam so that the original would rest against this basically have two weather strips form together. Worked great!
Awesome Blues, great voice, great guitar, great songs!

I have a decent run with a Rain Bird system but it turned out one half didn't need to run as long as the other. This was exactly what I needed. Just spliced it in at the start of the section and I had additional control over my simple watering system.

I really like this type of bag with the actual slider that zips it shut. I have a heck of a time getting regular bags closed. This quart size won't hold much more than a sandwich though. Even though they are quart size I doubt you could fill them with a quart worth.

Ive been using different types of security/network cameras for several years including those like this one where all of the cameras connect to a DVR. I also have several stand alone wireless cameras that upload photos and video to a Windows server. I prefer wireless cameras for their ease of installation, better software and control. The benefit of these DVR systems is that multiple cameras feed into one central box where they are all setup and controlled from. The hardest part of a wired DVR system is installing cables all around your house or business.It is a good idea to test the unit with a cable and camera connected to it before you go to the trouble of installing everythingFirst, you have to figure out where all of the cameras will be placed and where the DVR will be centrally located so that all of the camera cables can reach it. Eight 60 foot cables are included with this system. Keep in mind 60 feet can go quick when you have turns and walls to go down, etc.Next is stringing the cable. I laid mine up in the attic and out to the eaves for the outdoor cameras. Even though they are outdoor cameras drops of rain can give you a spotty image so I keep them dry. And even though they come with hoods the wind can blow the rain past them. Crawling out to the narrow edges of the roof is not a lot of fun, installation is a lot of work.The hard part is behind you (sort of) and now you connect all of the cameras at one end of each cable and the other ends of the cables connect to the DVR. I connected the DVR to a monitor and followed the simple steps to get the initial IP address. Then I tried connection from my MacBook and this is when the trouble starts.I have no idea why they dont certify their software. Even Avast Anti Virus software warns you about installing it. The problem is for both Windows and Mac the default settings of your computer security will not allow the plugin to be installed. You have to unsecure your computer to get it to install and run.I have a Windows 7 computer that does not have critical information on it which I was able to get the plugin to work. What I usually do with these systems is change the admin name and password (cant change the name on this one however), IP address and port number, date and all the camera settings, etc.The software is not great. I changed the admin password and it told me there was an error. When I changed pages it said I needed to save changes even though I had clicked OK. When I went to re-login apparently the new password did save. Navigation has improved over the years but still not on par with todays software.Their support website isnt any better. Images and links are broken and theres not a lot of information. They just dont put a lot into these systems. There are several brands out there but youll find the hardware all looks the same. Its the software that is different but none do a great job.These cameras are twice the size of my older Q-See system. They are better, wide angle, covering a good area and night vision works. While these are supposedly HD face recognition is still only about 20 feet.The beauty behind these systems is that they record on a hard drive and after time when it gets full it automatically writes over old video. You dont need to do anything unless you need to check to see if something was recorded. And you can check them remotely from anywhere in the world. I do recommend checking periodically to make sure there are recordings as anything can fail. To check my systems remotely I use IP Cam Viewer on my iOS devices  excellent, lots of features and easy to add cameras.Overall this is slightly improved over the QSee DVR Ive had for several years. But they still do not get their software certified. Its not great software, buggy and can be a pain to install. For what you get these are just too expensive.

This is a nice bag but there are a few things that could use improvement to make it my favorite bag.The size is great. In fact, just about perfect. My Nikon D810 with the 18-300 zoom lens including hood fit into the padded insert with room to spare.The cloth is thin and doesn't have a lot of support, it's a bit floppy. I haven't tried running water over it but the openings aren't sealed for waterproof anyway.I wish the flap and end pocket were secured with velcro instead of buckles and buttons. Buttons and buckles just aren't as efficient as Velcro.The front pocket, again with the light cloth, only has one zipper clasp. The problem is it zips down the sides too. So you have to unzip it completely to get into it but because it unzips down the sides it flops over so you really can't fill it, stuff will fall out. But I do like the pocket and would love it if it had a dual zipper or just opened at the top.It would have been nice to have a little pocket on the flap for easy access to wallet or keys, etc. As it is its just a flap.The end pockets aren't that big and the flap is not tight. Extra batteries or other accessories could fall out even closed. But it's really not big enough for a water bottle either.I like the little pocket inside even though it sits behind the padding for the camera.Overall, I like this style of bag for casual walking around photography. But there is room for improvement.I received a promotional discount for this item.

This is a great cable manager designed for 19" racks. The holes are 18" on center which was a little bit of a problem for me. I actually have a room where I keep my servers, routers and other equipment in so there are a lot of cables coming in which I tied to eye bolts screwed into a board.  Since this isn't stud spacing I screwed this to the board attached to the studs. It works great! Run the cables through or drop them down where needed and no need to tie them. It has a door in the front that can either open up or down. But the pieces that double as hinges and connections are a bit loose and can be a pain to close this up as they can easily come off. But once it's setup the cables stay organize and will be easy to move if necessary. Very sturdy even though it extends from the wall. Great way to organize all of those cable! I received a promotional discount for this item.

Great disposable gloves. While not as thick as a single pair of expensive waterproof cleaning gloves these do come close.  I got X-Large which was just about right only a little snug. But they are so smooth inside they aren't that difficult to get off. Great length that comes up over the wrist. These will be great for chores around the house especially those cleaning tasks where we may use a chemical now and then.

Great storage jar. It is designed for taking your salad along. It comes with a separate storage for salad dressing that attaches under the lid. A few things to note:It is NOT for canning.Dishwasher safe on the top rack. Recommended to give it a good cleaning before first use.Thick plastic that looks like glass but it won't break if dropped. Be careful using metal utensils that could scratch it.Good size, holds 34 oz.Good air tight seal.This has a lot of uses. I'll also be using it to store coffee beans when I travel. It will store plenty of beans air tight and won't break if I drop it.

This little scooter is great. Easy to put together, you only need to supply a philips screwdriver. The tires are plastic but the are nice and thick for smooth rolling. The important parts are metal. The platform is plastic which is lighter but should hold up to the weight of our little guy since it is supported by the metal bar running underneath. Of course red is the ultimate scooter color.When we were kids we never wore a helmet. While obviously I am still here, a few year ago changed my life - ALWAY WEAR A HELMET! A cracked helmet gives you something to talk about...Love this little scooter and so does our grandson!

I've used a few of these bays. This one works but not without issues.When I first hooked it up and turned it on nothing happened. Jiggled the wires and got it to work...It has a switch to set either PC connected mode or Clone. But it also has a power and a clone button. The little switch is tiny and awkward to get to. Not sure why you need all three.I use this with both Windows and a MacBook. While it works with both sometimes you have to turn it on and off before it's recognized.Instructions say to put in two drives even in PC mode but it does work with just one.Instructions are in broken English.Short USB cable.Does work with my Elgato dock but did have to turn it on and off a couple of times.Overall, this works but there are plenty out there that work just as well. I prefer the horizontal Plugable. In these vertical bays the heads sound like they are about to tear off.

I've been using Breath Rights for years. They're overpriced and don't always work that well and I think I've found the replacement! Twice as many for the same price. I prefer the original style and that's what these are. These actually feel like they adhere better. These didn't come in a box in fact look like they were pulled off a reel and stuffed into a plastic bag. But each one is individually wrapped so they're clean.Overall a great deal and alternative

L3 replaces the required L2 for our 70s Ariens tiller. It takes on bottle to fill an empty/drained gear box but you'll probably need to top it off periodically. Buying two was a better deal. Not Prime shipping but it did get here in Prime time.

We've used Brita filters/pitchers for years, decades. They only remove some chemicals and metals not bacteria or living microorganisms. But we do love the taste over what directly comes out of the faucet, which isn't all that bad in our area.One thing we've never liked is they weren't dishwasher safe and still aren't after all these years.This new design has a tube in the lid that sits over the filter. No idea why. It still fills the top but slower than our previous model.The timer died quickly on our previous model. Not even sure if this one is working. Held the required 5 seconds, it blinked but nothing else says OK like a solid green light or something. So I mark the calendar to change it when the time is up.The pieces fit snug which actually makes them difficult to take apart. Not sure why they need to be that snug, it's not air tight to begin with.One good thing is the flip up lid is held on better. The little holding pins were so thin on our old model they broke off right away.Overall this is not an improvement over our older model except the flip up lid. Maybe they'll get it right next time.

Update: I had uninstalled the display drivers required to use external monitors and reinstalled them to try again. I don't know if they updated the drivers but both monitors now work at 1920 x 1080.The Apple icon is still missing, however.----------------------------------------------------------------The description said you could hook up two monitors to a Windows or Mac laptop. I was excited because I have an Elgato dock that you can't hook up two monitors to but it is connected via the Thunberbolt port. This one connects via USB.  Two monitors work but you may have to restart several times.I have two identical ViewSonic monitors. Unfortunately through this dock I can only go up to 1600 through the DVI connection. Directly connected to my MacBook it will go up to 1920. HDMI works fine.The Apple icon is missing off of the menu bar on the external monitors.You have to install their drivers.No Thunderbolt. I have two devices that connect via Thunderbolt. With this dock I have to have 3 connections to my MacBook (including the dock on USB). With the Elgato dock I only have need two connections: one of the monitors (can't run two through the Elgato dock) and the Thunderbolt to connect the Elgato.This has more USB connections: 4 USB 2, 2 USB 3. The Elgato has 3 USB 3 ports.This stands up, the Elgato sits flat. This one is easier to get to and takes less space.The Trendnet has a wider usage over USB. It can be used with Windows or Mac. But it also has two problems so I can't even use it. I will update if those get resolved.

For the money these are great. I bought a box of black ones from another brand and along with the ones that came with the board they all break eventually. These work just as well as the others but look cooler! If you like to play darts and have a set up at home these are a must have.

We have an automatic dispenser in one bathroom and love it. So does our two year old grandson because all you need to do is stick your hand under and you have soap. So when I was offered a promotional discount for another one I snapped it up and glad I did. It works great, takes just two AA batteries and standard liquid soap. This one does not have flow control like our other one so you can't adjust how much comes out which is slightly more than you really need but that can very with the thickness of the soap. If the soap is too thick I just mix in a tiny bit of water. But now we have another no hands soap dispenser in another of our bathrooms. I did receive this for my HONEST review.

We just happened to have several brooms, mops, etc that we needed to hang and I got offered a promotional discount for this one. Light aluminum base with three hard rubber hangers for items with a handle and three hooks for a few things with a loop. Easily installs with two screws. Great way to hand up to 6 items and get them out of the way!

My wife has a rechargeable model from another brand. I was offered and promotion discount to try this one out. I have to say for the price and that it only needs two AA batteries and it comes with 7 different heads I have to say it is a pretty good deal. I'm not a vain person and don't care that much about these tools but I tried it and have to say my face felt refreshed :-). As an old guy I may just use this on a regular basis. Great deal!I did receive this for my HONEST review.

I received a promotional discount for one of these. It's all metal and works great. With the drought we had this summer and possibly next we've been using soaker hoses which don't require a lot of pressure so you can run more than one at a time and this works great to hook two hoses to the same spigot.

I have a 93 Pathfinder, it's our second car but it's been my favorite. I don't put a lot of money into it but I like to keep it running. Of course the sound system wasn't designed for today's technology but I love my music. And I like hi tech like my iPhone 6. This seemed like a great way to introduce the two.When I first set this up I got nothing, no sound, no lights. Looked for a fuse in the car charger, there is none. Tried our newer car, too. I happened to have a USB car charger and it worked. I could hear the BlueTooth pairing beep through my car speakers when I paired it with my iPhone 6.The push button worked to start/pause the song, turning either way advanced to the next or previous song, turning and holding changed the volume on my phone. You do have to deal with a set of wires but I will run those in the dash and hide them.So now I have my collection of music everywhere I drive even though it was built before digital music players.The seller was also gracious enough to offer a replacement. I received a discount for promotion.

Probably should call this the Charlie Brown shower curtain... If you have these colors the design is fun and will liven up a bathroom. It is washable. It's polyester and should hold up well with shower water. We'll see over time how it washes and it does with mold/mildew.

First I opened the package and and tried to pull the vacuum out with the canister handle and the canister ripped off. Didn't break but it makes you wonder how well it will work as just a canister. Then I got it all out and started to put it together. I noticed a lot of issues:- carpet cleaner is about three quarters size of our old Kenmore- lots of attachments but they can drop off especially with the cord flopping around- most of the weight is on the handle which a lot of people won't like, could be tiring- a lot of plastic which could give it a short life- more cleaning: empty the dirt instead of throwing away a bag, occasional washing requiredBut does it clean! You can literally watch the dirt being sucked up. We had just vacuumed with our Kenmore and thought the carpet was clean - ouch!I also like how it "steers", just tilt the vac and it's easy to change directions.The canister does come off but it doesn't have wheels and might be a bit too heavy for most people to hold and carry around.Lots of attachments that work well. Ours came with extension wand, 3 in 1 pivoting brush with 3 different heads, crevice tool, turbo tool and pet hair tool. All are stored on the vac. Overall: Accessory storage might be frustrating keeping everything attached. It is top heavy. You don't have to buy bags but you do have to empty the dirt. But it cleans very well!

My white cat needs to go on a diet, and I thought I would try something that is intended for that purpose. While I can't determine if he has lost any weight (ever try getting a cat on a bathroom scale?), I do know that both of my cats absolutely love this food.I put this next to our regular food, and they preferred this.It is a big plus that these ingredients are natural and healthy, and not sourced from China.My main issue, which is what I have with a lot of these healthy cat food formulas, is the price. I love my cats, but I can't afford food this expensive on a regular basis. I have a feeling most cat owners will agree.Overall, if you have the money, and a fat cat, this food is perfect.

My four year old daughter loves this doll. Ever since it arrived, she has been carrying it around and won't let it go.It is extremely cute and tiny, and my daughter loves holding her tight. The fabric body is very soft and cuddly, and the arms, legs, and head are hard plastic.My only complaint so far is that the baby powder scent can become a little much. But, my daughter doesn't seem to mind, so that is really all that matters. So far, the stitching has been fine, but I will update this review is it breaks down in a short amount of time.Overall, based on its owner (my daughter), this is a five star product!

I struggle to review cologne because I have trouble putting into words what I like about it. I do really like this scent, and so do those around me.This is a nice, clean, and masculine scent, that is woodsy with hints of fruit and vanilla. At first it struck me as a little too fruity, and it smelled a little feminine. However, after wearing it for a few minutes I came to appreciate it as more masculine.The main thing I like about this cologne is how strong it is, and how long it lasts. I currently use Inner Realm as my main cologne. I love its smell, but it doesn't seem to last very long. I have to reapply by the afternoon on an average workday if I want the scent to linger. Eternity Now definitely lasts and lingers! In fact, I am smelling it on my clothes right now, the morning after I wore it, as if no time had passed since yesterday.My main issue is the price. I know it is Calvin Klein, and it's going to be more expensive. However, I don't like the cologne enough to pay the higher price. That is why I gave it four stars. For guys who don't mind paying a higher price, by all means, this is a five star product for you.Overall, I like it, and will wear it regularly.

I have been taking Vitamin D for many years, since I read about its many benefits. While the RDA is 400 IU, many experts suggest we need more like 2000-5000 IU per day, especially if we don't get much summer sunshine exposure.This is a high dose softgel of Vitamin D. At 5000 IU, it is pretty much the strongest dose you'll find readily available over the counter.It contains the preferable form of Vitamin D, D3, and since it is already in softgel form, you don't have to worry about eating some fat with the pill (Vitamin D needs fat to be absorbed).One thing to keep in mind is that there are possible side effects of too much Vitamin D. I have read studies that suggest possible calcium deposits forming in the brain from too much Vitamin D. I believe in supplementing with Vitamin D, but you can still get too much of a good thing. Since I get a lot of sun in the summer, I tend to only take Vitamin D in the winter months when in my area it can't be made from sunshine exposure (October-the end of March). So just be aware that this is a pretty high dose.In terms of price, this product also contains a lot of pills for a great price.Overall, if you are looking for good Vitamin D for a fair price, this is a great option.

My cats like this fountain. They immediately took to using it, and even seem fascinated by it to the point of standing around and watching it, even when they aren't thirsty.It was fairly quick and easy to assemble. It required running the filter through some cold water, and basically filling up the basin and tank with water (and plugging it in).The unit holds quite a bit of water for our two cats and doesn't seem to need to be refilled often. It filters the water with a charcoal filter. Honestly, I won't be replacing that filter in the future, but instead will continue using filtered water from my pitcher. It is cheaper that way.I turn off the fountain at night and when I am gone, to save electricity and because I worry about any sort of fire hazard. They drink out of it either way (since really they don't have a choice of other water options!).The main drawback for me is the price. This is fancy, but a plain old water dish has kept my cats alive and healthy for the last five years so this type of water dish isn't necessary, but they do seem to like it. If you want to spoil your cats, this is for you.

This is an interesting product that combines cranberry extract with some other nutrients and herbs that may help prevent and treat urinary tract infections, as well as enhance the antioxidant benefits of cranberry. These include Lingonberry (a relative of cranberry) and Bromelain (a protein digesting enzyme).The one thing I don't like about this product is that it doesn't really specify the strength of the cranberry extract, or even the amount of extract. There is a lot of variety of extracts out there, some strong, others weak. I would like to know what I am getting, especially for this price, which is a little higher than other places. The fact that the ingredients are listed as a "urinary support blend" without actual amounts of products within that "blend" means you aren't sure what you are getting of each ingredient.It also contains dl-alpha tocopherol, the cheapest, least effective form of vitamin E available (d-alpha is the most effective). I don't see why with such a low amount (6 IU), they couldn't have used the good stuff.Overall, this is a decent cranberry formula, for a fair price, keeping in mind the drawbacks I mentioned.

These are a perfect food for my low carb diet. Minus the high sodium, these bites are low in calories, fairly low in carbs (5 grams per serving), and high in protein. My family all thinks they taste really great. In fact they are very addictive.The taste is somewhat sweet, but not too much so. The bites have a nice slightly chewy texture that I expect from beef jerky.And their addictive nature is why I am only giving this four stars, because they are extremely expensive. I can't believe that 11.4 ounces of a beef product is being sold (as of now) for over thirty dollars. That makes it beyond my affordability, especially since I could easily down two bags as a meal.

I have taken enzymes for almost twenty years, with each meal, and I am always looking for a decent formula.This is a vegetarian enzyme blend, containing a wide spectrum of digestive enzymes, which will (theoretically) digest fat, protein, and carbohydrates. Because of this, it can possibly improve digestion and help with digestive problems.Enzymes are typically measured in activity as opposed to weight, so the strange units on the label provide the strength of their digesting capability. According to author Tom Bohagar who wrote Everything You Need To Know About Enzymes (who owns an enzyme company), under controlled conditions, 1000 HUT of protease will digest 11.25 grams of dairy protein. 1000 DU of amylase will digest about 3.33 grams of potato starch, and 1000 FIP of lipase will digest 5 grams of vegetable oil.This formula contains ample amounts of protein digesting enzymes, which will digest protein in a variety of settings with variable pH values (since the stomach is acidic, and the intestines are alkaline). Like most formulas of its kind, it seems low in lipase (a fat digesting enzyme), based on the figures I just mentioned.It also contains some lactase, which should help break down lactose. However, this wont have a huge effect since the amount isnt very high compared to supplements sold specifically to digest milk. So if you are lactose intolerant, you will need more than just this formula.This is a good vegetarian formula. My only complaint is that for non-vegetarians, it does lack enzymes that I consider beneficial, such as pancreatin (which is derived from animal pancreases).A minor complaint is that it lacks bromelain and papain, both vegetarian. I am not sure why it isnt included, but as a part of an overall enzyme formula, those two are important.The price is all right. Enzymes are usually a little pricey, and this formula is no exception.Overall, this is a standard vegetarian enzyme formula, with a fairly decent price.

I regularly used mid-priced photo editing programs to edit photos for multiple websites and for use in my books. While I dont do a lot of advanced layer editing and photo manipulation (such as cropping out a person and placing them into a new background), I do need a program that can easily and quickly correct color and lighting issues and make a photo look more exciting through different filters and effects.I own quite a few photo editing programs, including Serif's PhotoPlus X7  and Corel PaintShop Pro X6. Honestly, those two are very similar in their layout. This program is laid out differently, and took a little getting used to. That said, I think it is actually a better layout overall, and is much easier to navigate.This is a pretty powerful program that is also user-friendly. Like most similarly priced programs, it offers a wide array of essential features and adjustments, like Levels, Curves, White Balance, RAW support, hue/saturation, layer editing, red eye correction, noise removal/addition, cropping, text, lens corrections, and so forth.  It runs quickly and smoothly on my computer, with Windows 10.Some of what I like specifically about this program:- The HDR features are cool. You can not only create true HDR photos (by merging multiple images), but the program also allows you to fake a single image by adjusting the glow and edge of the photo, under the HDR Effects tab.- The blur features are very powerful and intuitive to use. No other program I have used makes it this easy to create cool blur effects.- The face and body adjustments are very powerful and intuitive, allowing the user to smooth wrinkles, brighten eyes, increase eye size, whiten teeth, and make the body and face thinner. I put my photo in it, and it detected my jawline, smile line, and eyes automatically. It is easy to adjust the points if needed, but the program was very accurate in guessing.- You can get a digital copy of the program if you want by visiting the website on the box and entering the product key. This makes it convenient if you dont have a CD Rom drive or just want a back up.The main issue I have with the program is that while I like the layout overall, I dont like that certain things can only be done in different tabs (for example, if you want to crop to selection, you have to go to the layers tab, as opposed to the edit or adjustment tab).Another issue is that I dont like that you have to import photos into the library before you edit them. On other programs, you can edit an image and it opens directly to the editing part of the program.Also, this program has fewer special effects than other programs. For example, there doesnt seem to be any painting type filters (such as turning a photo into an oil painting) or lighting effects (like adding lens flares).Finally, and this is minor, I wish the program allowed alternative colorspaces, such as LAB, which offers more editing flexibility, but most programs at this level dont offer that (but PhotoPlus X7 does).Overall, I like this program because it takes a lot of the common tasks I use and makes them quick and easy to carry out. While it may lack certain filters, what it does, it does extremely well, especially for the price.

I should start by noting that this product does *not* contain turmeric extract, which is usually what is labeled curcumin. This product contains simple turmeric powder, which likely does contain the ingredient curcumin, but since the amount isnt standardized, we cant know for sure how much.Simple turmeric powder is considered less effective and less potent than the standardized extract. I personally take the powder, but I wanted everyone who reads this to be aware that they arent getting the extract contained in many other curcumin supplements.That being said, this formula does contain a lot of turmeric per capsule, and it includes black pepper extract, which seems to help absorption of the active compounds in turmeric. If you take any kind of turmeric, I suggest taking it with black pepper (and I would personally add bromelain and lecithin as well, both which can likely increase absorption of key components).I have taken turmeric for years, primarily because of research related to prevention of Alzheimer's. It seems to prevent the buildup of amyloid deposits in the brain. That alone is worth the price. I cant vouch for its ability to prevent and treat arthritis and other problems, although I am 37 and have run 10-20 miles a week for the last fifteen years without problems, so it is possible my regular supplemental turmeric has helped keep me feeling good.Since this is simple turmeric powder, and not the pricier extract, the price is kind of high compared to other brands, even if it is organic. That being said, I do like and trust Ubervita products based on my experience with other products. Overall, this is a good formula, just be aware of what you are getting.

This is a really useful and cool vacuum. In fact, it is amazing. I don't like sweeping, and I often get annoyed at vacuums that don't do their jobs.It is simple to set up and operate. You put one of the mop pads on the bottom of the unit, fill it up with some water, and it is ready to go.What amazed me was how it mopped and swept at the same time AND did a great job at both. The vacuum is remarkably strong. I hand swept some cat litter pellets from the kitchen floor to the side of the room, thinking this vacuum couldn't handle them. Then I figured I might as well see if it could, and sure enough it swept up virtually everything on the floor, including the large pellets. It was as good, if not better, than the other vacuum's in my house. It did all of this while steam cleaning the floor at the same time!It comes with 2 washable, and 4 disposable mop pads. I prefer the washable because they can be reused without cost. The price is pretty good, considering the time it will save for homes with hard floors.Overall, I am very happy with this vacuum/mop. It really does save me time, and it works!

I have taken phosphatidylserine for many years to maintain my cognitive function as a I get older. I can't vouch for whether it is working or not, but everyone I meet is surprised my mind is so sharp. That's hardly scientific evidence, but it makes me feel good to hear it.A few, small, recent studies have shown that the combination of phosphatidylserine and phosphatidic acid may have a positive effect on cognitive function and mood, as well as normalizing the stress response in hyper-stressed men, possibly by decreasing cortisol levels. So, this formula could be of great benefit to stressed out and/or people experiencing some cognitive decline.In the study mentioned above, it was "hyper-stressed" men who saw the benefit, so this could explain why I didn't feel anything from taking this supplement. However, that doesn't mean it isn't having a positive effect inside of me. I believe in phosphatidylserine and recommend it.The main drawback about supplementing with any phosphatidylserine product is that the price is high, and this is no exception. Also, I was surprised this wasn't a softgel product. Be sure to take this supplement with a little fat (such as with a meal or a fish oil or lecithin pill), because phosphatidylserine is fat soluble and needs some fat to be absorbed properly.If you are experiencing any of the issues that phosphatidylserine and phosphatidic Acid may treat, it is worth giving this product a try.

My mattress is very firm. At times that is a good thing, but I was waking up with backaches from the extreme firmness. I thought this product might be a good remedy to that problem...And I was right! This provides an amazingly comfortable night sleep. I can't believe how comfortable and cool this pad makes my bed. I have literally never felt so comfortable in a bed in my life.Also, the price is reasonable given how much other memory foam products cost.The only thing to be aware of is how bulky it can be. You may need some help getting it onto your bed and placed properly.Overall, this has been amazing! I have been sleeping so much better.

I'll admit that when I received this speaker, I was disappointed in how small it was, especially for the price. However, once I actually used it, I changed my tune.This speaker is very powerful for the size. I was amazed at the deep, rich, sound that came from it. I connected via Bluetooth with no problems. It pairs up immediately.It can be used to connect to different streaming services like Pandora directly from the unit (you will need your WiFi password). There are controls directly on the speaker.It comes with a remote that basically has the same buttons that are on the speaker.The only drawback is the price. It is pretty high for a single and (obviously) mono speaker, especially if you aren't going to take advantage of the streaming options.Overall this is a powerful  speaker that can very easily be used to connect to streaming services. Personally, I don't see a huge reason why you would need to use the speaker to access the services as opposed to your phone or computer and then connect to the speaker via Bluetooth, but that option is pretty cool.

I got this backpack just before attending a very demanding leadership conference that involved walking around a city doing various projects. It really impressed me with its durability and comfort.My Toshiba Satellite 15.6 Inch Laptop doesn't fit perfectly. It does fit, but the corners of the laptop are barely zipped shut, and kind of protrude inside the pack. The backpack's specifications are for a 15 inch laptop, but I was hoping it would fit. Either way, I got a lot out of the backpack.It isn't huge, so it isn't bulky like bigger backpacks. It has a nice small pocket in the front bottom, and a cool hard case at the top for sunglasses and other items you want protected better. It really does do a good job of shielding your fragile items.Other reviewers have said it is uncomfortable. I didn't adjust the straps at all and thought it was very comfortable.Overall, this backpack definitely met my needs. It is a durable item, even if my laptop doesn't fit.

This is a smaller, bluetooth, novelty speaker. That is basically what you are getting with this product.I like this speaker. It is pretty small (only 7.3 inches tall). However, for being so small, the sound is actually pretty rich, full, and loud. I was honestly expecting something much different given the size. I have other similar sized speakers, and this one sounds a lot better.It paired easily to my computer and android phone. It tells you vocally what it is doing (like pairing, powering up, etc). The unit comes with a micro usb charging cord, but not an actual charger unit.The light show is a novelty. It is pretty cool for parties, but after awhile for simple home use, it loses its appeal. I am a teacher and am bringing it to school. If I play music, I'll use it. I think it will get a lot of interest there.Overall, for what it is (a small novelty speaker), it is very nice. The price may be a tad high for the novelty, but it does what it says it will do - very well.

I must confess, I'm used to buying store brand toilet paper. So, my standards aren't exactly high in that department.I must say, this toilet paper feels amazing. It is strong and durable. The rolls are large. It seems to last forever, which is nice. This is truly the toilet paper of the one percent. Ok, that may be a joke, but this is really nice toilet paper.There isn't much to complain about, except that the price of what I normally buy is much lower (of course so is the quality). Overall, you won't be disappointed with this.

This product does seem to work to "brighten eyes." Thanks to lots of moisturizing agents, it does work to make the area around the eyes brighter and reduce lines. Is this because of the licorice extract or antioxidants that are advertised on the label?  Possibly, but generally, it is just that this product moisturizes well.My wife and I both used this, and her reaction was "it burns." I did notice that effect as well, but nothing major. She has dark circles under her eyes, and this product didn't seem to have much of an effect on them. So I can only recommend you use it for brightening and (temporarily) reducing lines.Overall, this is an expensive product (at least from my perspective) that does generally work to make your eyes brighter and reduce fine lines. I guarantee cheaper products are out there that do the exact same thing, since it is basically a concentrated moisturizing agent. Personally, I would look for cheaper options. I give this four stars because it does actually work, but it is too expensive.

I have never understood the appeal of super-expensive headphones, so these looked good because the price is right.These are great headphones, for the price. The sound is actually pretty good, and for the price, great.They are comfortable,, and the shape helps them stay in the ear, even while bouncing up and down a lot while I run. The package comes with small, medium, and large earpads. I don't use the microphone, and could do without that, but it does work as advertised.I have used them, as have my daughter and wife, and we all agree these are nice headphones.

I'll keep this review simple.I use the Canon MB2020 Maxify printer. I am very skeptical of generic ink cartridges. Nonetheless, I ordered this, and I was amazed how well it works. It has given me no problems so far and the price is far better than buying from Canon. It installed flawlessly. I recommend this product.

I take quite a few supplements, and have taken Melatonin on and off for about 14 years. Melatonin sometimes works for me, and sometimes it doesn't. Lately, I have been taking anywhere from 3-6 mg of Melatonin, some of that as time release. It seems like it doesn't work that well, at least not consistently.I expected this product to work about the same way, and boy was I wrong.This product is very potent, and works amazingly well for me (it is definitely UBER-sleep). Every time I use it, I fall asleep quickly and sleep through the night. It produces a nice and relaxed state before I hit the pillow, but nothing too uncomfortable or weird. When I hit the pillow, I fall asleep very quickly. I also dream a lot every time I use it, which I haven't done regularly for a while.The various herbs in the formula (Valerian, Hops, Passion Flower, and Chamomile) are known to promote relaxation, as is Magnesium. Most sleep formulas include these ingredients, but actually have such low amounts, it is nearly pointless. Ubersleep contains a lot more than other formulas, in one capsule. In fact, by containing 125 mg of Magnesium (a mix of the Gluconate and Oxide forms)  it has more Magnesium than the actual Magnesium supplement I take daily.So, while it is quite a bit more expensive than a normal Melatonin supplement, it contains a lot more as well. I plan on using it somewhat regularly, when I really need a great night's sleep. I don't like to rely on Melatonin all the time, and I don't want to have to rely on this formula all the time either.Overall, it is a little expensive, but for what you get, it is a good value. I am actually so impressed I ordered more already.

A friend introduced me to NVC about five years ago. From the beginning, I was aware of how effective it is at both getting my needs met, and making others feel that you are connecting with them. It really is a revolutionary way of communicating. That being said, I have read various books by Rosenberg on the subject.This 9 CD set is, in my opinion, the easiest and best way to learn about Nonviolent communication and put it into practice. I enjoyed Rosenberg's books, but hearing him present the material helped me absorb it much better than reading it alone.The CDs contain about an hour of material on each disc. The workbook is very helpful, and contains exercises and information along with the audio. The set also comes with six business card sized reminder cards, to help you practice NVC. Below are the general contents of each disc:1. Origins of Nonviolent Communication2. Applying NVC within ourselves3. A radically different kind of honesty4. Empathically connecting with others5. Meeting our needs in intimate relationships6. Experiencing and exercising authority7. Healing, mediation, and reconciliation8. How NVC supports social change9. Living compassionately with celebration and gratitudeThe price is a little high compared to the books, obviously, but what you get is much more in depth and easier to learn. I highly recommend this course.

My morning routine is to shower and put on lotion immediately after the shower, which locks in moisture. This has saved me from having dry skin problems in the winter and actually keeps my face looking younger. Generally, I have to dry my face some to put on the cream I use (usually some vitamin C cream).I found this product fascinating because it is supposed to go on before toweling off, which theoretically locks in more moisture, so I ordered it. Honestly, it does work well. I applied it with my face soaking wet, and then lightly patted my face dry, per instructions.My experience is that when you apply it, initially it won't seem like it absorbed. My skin looked and felt like nothing happened. However, sure enough, a few minutes later, it felt soft and looked moisturized. The first time I used it, I looked a little oily because I used too much, since it didn't seem like anything was happening.The label says "get ready in half the time, which is kind of ridiculous, since applying cream before toweling off doesn't eliminate the need to towel off after applying the cream. I doubt this lotion will save people a lot of time.It contains "calming green tea oil" according to the label. I find that amusing since green tea extract is a source of caffeine, so it is hardly calming, unless it means using this lotion can satisfy my caffeine addiction, which would make me calm. Whether topical green tea helps the skin is up for debate, since one 2005 study found no noticeable visual difference from using a 10% green tea product topically, although skin biopsies showed a positive effect. The green tea is a purely cosmetic (pun intended) ingredient anyway, since it is nowhere near 10% of the product, since it is literally the third-to-last ingredient, which means there isn't much of it at all.Overall, the cream definitely makes my skin feel soft, but I am not sure if it is a hugely noticeable improvement over my other method (toweling my face followed by cream). Maybe in the long run, locking in extra moisture will make a difference. Either way, it does work to soften and moisturize skin.I give this four stars, because while it does work like it says it does, it is pretty pricey, and doesn't seem to work *that* much better than more inexpensive products.

I will start my review saying I am not a professional boxer, and not even an amateur. I have a punching bag in my basement that I use for exercise purposes, to get stronger, faster, and more agile. I have a pair of bag gloves that came with the bag. They have very little padding, and if I hit even relatively hard, my hand stings.I like these gloves. They pad my punches from impact quite a bit, although my brother's Venum Challenger 2.0 Boxing Gloves are much thicker and pretty much fully shield my hands from impact. However, those gloves are much more expensive.These gloves look cool, and seem durable. The stitching seems sturdy, and they feel like they are made to last. The Large/X-Large size fits my hands well, and I am 5'7", about 155 pounds.The best thing about this product is the price. They are very affordable for the size and durability. They are better padded and more heavy-duty gloves out there. However, balancing price with durability, these are great gloves. I recommend them for anybody in my situation who wants an affordable heavy-duty glove. Like I said earlier, I can't speak to their value for those who box professionally or as an amateur, but for an intense bag workout, I like them.

The first thing I look for when I buy an olive oil product is whether it is genuine olive oil, since so many bottles have been shown to contain other oils, like soybean oil. One simple way to tell if a product is olive oil is to refrigerate it over the course of about a week. If it turns into a "green milkshake" consistency (see my photo) then it is genuine. This is because Olive Oil is high in monounsaturated fats and this is how those fats respond to refrigeration.So, as you can see from the photos, these bottles contain genuine olive oil. Even expensive brands have failed this test, so it is important to always test.In terms of taste, these oils are great. I am used to cheaper oils that I buy at discount outlets, which although genuine based on my tests, don't taste like this. I am not an olive oil connoisseur by any means, but I noticed the quality taste of these right away.The Cornicabra oil is peppery. It has a spicier taste, which I like. My wife isn't a huge fan of black pepper, but she still liked this one. I liked this one the best. I am not used to oil having much flavor like this.The Arbequina is definitely more fruity. My wife's response was, "Wow, so this is how good olive oil is supposed to taste." I noticed the subtle hints of fruit, although to me it tasted more just like the plainer olive oil I have been used to.Overall, these are two nice olive oils that I will be using in a variety of dishes. They taste different, but both are excellent oils.

I basically handed these to my wife and said, "Tell me what you think." So, these are her thoughts.She likes them a lot. They are big enough to hold two queen comforters, which means they have a lot of storage space. The material is thick and breathable, and more heavy-duty than she expected.It has two zippers,which is convenient. The handles are a nice idea, and seem sturdy. The stitching also seems sturdy, which is a must since an item like this should be designed to hold up to wear and tear. It also looks nice and elegant, but may look "dated" in a few years, but that is true of most things.The only drawback is it smells pretty bad, at least to my wife. I didn't think so, but then again, I like the smell of gasoline and fresh asphalt.Overall, this is a nice product that does the job.

I have owned a variety of body groomers over the last eight years, including the Remington BHT300 All Access Men's Bodygroomer and the Axe Philips Norelco Body Groomer. I use the Axe one currently, roughly once a week to keep my chest and back hair free, and I have been very satisfied with it.However, I will start using this groomer regularly, and it has become my favorite body groomer for a variety of reasons:- It is powerful. The Remington was just weak, behaving like it was constantly running on a dead battery. This is just as powerful, if not more powerful, than the Axe groomer, which is pretty powerful. It is the most powerful of the three.- It has the closest shave of any groomer I have used. It is so close, it looks a lot like I have used a wet razor. It missed a few small areas, which is typical of these groomers, but it didn't miss very many and was easily fixed on the second run.- It is the longest of the groomers I have owned. This may seem like a minor point, but it is about 1/4 inch longer than the Axe groomer, and even longer than the Remington one. This makes it a little easier to reach back areas by myself. I usually succeed in shaving my chest, back, and arms completely by myself, using a mirror and some contortions. The added length of this groomer made this easier.- The attachments work well. The Axe groomer only had one attachment, which wasn't enough to give me shaving options. The Remington one allowed hair to get stuck in the attachment, rendering it useless after one swipe down my arm. I used the shortest attachment with this unit on both forearms and it worked perfectly without me having to clean out hair.- This product comes with a two year warranty.- It looks pretty cool (this is ultimately irrelevant to my liking it, but it does look cool).- The price is lower than other groomers, including the Axe one.The only major drawback for me was the charging system. It is needlessly complicated, using a special stand with a piece that extends out to balance it. The plug didn't fit into the prongs underneath the stand very easily, and the worst part is that the base of the groomer doesn't fit too securely into the charging unit, which means I had to sit the thing just right to get a charge. I honestly don't know why it was designed that way. However, it did charge quickly; it just took a little effort to situate it properly.Another slight drawback is that it snagged my hair a little and made it hurt. However, this is likely because I waited longer than I normally do to shave, and happens with the other groomers.Overall, with all the factors added in, including price, I like this groomer slightly better than the Axe groomer, and would recommend it to other guys.

My Samsung Galaxy S4 loses battery power fairly quickly, and I thought having something like this in my briefcase for when I am unable to get to a charging area would be helpful, since lately it seems like I have been getting to critically low battery levels a little too often.I am very impressed with this product. It comes with a roughly 2.5 feet USB cable (USB male to micro) that allows you to charge the unit, if you have a wall or car charging unit (it doesn't come with that, just the cable). It also means I can use it to charge my Samsung from the battery cell as well. Note that to charge this battery, you have to have this (or another) micro USB cable, because that is the input for charging it. Also, if you wish to charge an external device that doesn't use micro USB, you will have to provide your own USB cable, but most people have a lot of those already.To provide its charge, it has 1.0 and 2.4 amp USB slots, so it functions just like a normal USB charger. The 2.4 amp slot theoretically can charge your device very quickly because of the power it delivers. However, based on the app I use to determine charging speed on my phone, I am only getting 1.2 amps from the battery cell to my Samsung device. However, I should note that I never get higher than that on any charger, so it is my device's limitation, not the issue of this charger.The battery cell has a cool LED charge indicator, that automatically displays a percentage of charge while you are charging the cell, and can be displayed at any time by pushing a button. This is very helpful to see how much charge is left. It is fairly large and heavy, and is about as wide and long as my actual S4, but double the thickness. However, this also means it will deliver the necessary juice when needed. It also looks really sleek.Overall, this is a great product for the price. It delivers a lot of amps (more than my car charger) and can come in handy when you need more juice on the go. This is a very practical item for me.

This is great sugar-free mint gum. I am a teacher and I regularly bring gum to school and my students have been bumming some from me all year, and then buying me packs to replace mine. I decided to order this set since it seemed right up my alley.The sweetmint is my favorite. It is mild and candy-like. The spearmint and peppermint are typical of these types of flavors, and are, to quote my four year old daughter, more "spicy" than sweetmint. The most intense is the wintermint. I like the intensity of it.One downside about this variety pack is that it gives preference to spearmint (4 packs) and wintergreen (4 packs), likely because those are the more familiar flavors. However, I actually prefer the sweetmint and wintermint, even though there are only two packs of each of those. My daughter had pretty much chewed all the sweetmint before I could get to it, and my students seemed to like the wintermint so much that I didn't even get much of that. So these two seem to be the favorite, but least represented.Another downside is that these gums contain sugar alcohols, which can cause gastrointestinal upset (like gas and bloating) if consumed in high enough quantities. If I chew too much, I often experience it.Overall, this is great sugar-free gum. I highly recommend it. My students, daughter, and I all love it.

This is a very attractive shower curtain. It looks really nice. It is also very reasonably priced. It lets in a lot of light as well, which is a plus (unless you want some privacy). Overall, my wife and I like it.However, it is pretty flimsy and it isn't the most functional and heavy-duty shower curtain. Because it is lace with no backing, it does have tiny holes in it. However, the water doesn't seem to leak out, and my floor was no more or less wet than with my original curtain. Because it is lace, and kind of flimsy, it seems like it will snag.Generally, this looks nice and works decently well, but don't expect it to resist too much water leakage.

I purchased two of these for my 1990 Chevy K2500 pickup and they wont get much use mostly for washing the windshield. The heat & sun will likely kill them more than anything else. I only paid 4-bucks each so Im not expecting too much but they are listed as 18-inch but the rubber is that length. The Bosch 40718A they replaced had rubber that was only 17-1/8 inches wide and I think nearly an inch of windshield not being covered by each blade is not good. Time will tell but they feel substantial, the fit was easy and the first use in heavy wet snow was very acceptable.

I purchased two of these for my 1990 Chevy K2500 pickup and if they were used very little mostly for washing the windshield. The heat & sun killed them more than anything else. I only paid 4-bucks each so I wasnt expecting too much but I dropped 2-stars because of how they are measured they may be listed as 18-inch but the rubber is only 17-1/8 inches wide and I think nearly an inch of windshield not being covered by each blade is not good. I just replaced them with ACDelco 8-4418 Advantage All Season wipers and the rubber on those is exactly 18-inches so theyll get a more favorable review and the price was the same.

Its much thinner at least half as much as the 100-foot drains in the home centers. I suspect this is much thinner so its fold up easy into a handy little retail package rather than a huge roll about 4-feet in diameter. Depending on use the thickness may not be an issue but thinner is much more flexible. We have an irrigation canal for the summer and getting water to many things involved a pump and sprinklers so we dug a series of narrow canals through the property to let the ground absorb it. The idea was fine and everything stays watered without any power but the little canals about 6 deep and 4 wide will get overgrown easily and then become a trip hazard and it makes mowing much more difficult. The answer was this pipe because its perforated and lets water out easily. The canals arent very straight so this conformed nicety and after putting some weed block over it we were able to cover it with dirt to get a level surface. We didnt cover the entire water system but just places for walkways and the riding mower. Excellent pipe and having the thicker pipe on hand was the reason for going with this one because the other stuff is just too rigid.

There seems to be some unfavorable reviews based on the length of the cable. I cant comment on what someone else received but mine was exactly 48-inches long. The junction box is about 6.5-inches long so Im guessing some think that the exposed cable of 41.5-inches makes it shorter than described. Ive had a lot of trailers and was an electrician in my earlier years and Ive never had a cable that was measured by the method I just mentioned. After the shielded cable enters the box the sheathing is removed to expose the individual wires and when you measure correctly from the face of the connector to the end of the exposed wires where they connect on the terminal bar it is 48-inches long. If you purchase the cable separately the length will also be measured from the face of the plug to the end of the exposed wires. I needed to cleanup some wiring on a utility trailer and add some electric brakes so I had to eliminate the existing 4-prong connector and go with this which also allows me to plug into my trucks outlet without needing an adapter. Most plugs are close to the receiver mounting the box close to the hitch still left me with plenty of cable. If your vehicle connector is near the center of the vehicle you dont need much cable slack for turning so the 3-feet I had is plenty. If you want the box closer to the trailer then a longer assembly may be required. This completed assembly was less then buying the cable and junction box separately and there was no adding wire connectors and connecting the two together. This is a rugged build and should last for many years and my only criticism is the lack of a seal under the cover but its not enough to knock off a star.

I have a vintage all-metal faucet that I picked up years ago that had never been installed. It has two 3/8 copper lines without any fittings on the end. This was a perfect fit and made connecting to the existing 1/2 flexible water line easy. The only alternative was to sweat a two copper fittings on but those cost about the same as this and this was much easier to install. I dont think you can go wrong with Lasco products in my opinion.

I have a vintage all-metal faucet that I picked up years ago that had never been installed. It has a single handle and a sprayer that goes on the side but the button had broken off. This was a perfect fit and pretty muck looks identical to what it replaced. The connector on the hose end comes off so you can slip the hose through the hole and then reattach at to connect to the diverter in the faucet you have another size option if you leave that fitting off. I just paid a few pennies over 3-bucks for it from Amazon and a few days later the price jumped to nearly 10-bucks. Its a good hose but not at the new price.
