I have used many pre-workout powders over the last few years.  The majority of them almost always give me the jitters.  Cellucor's C4 Fitness Pre-Workout lists itself as explosive, but in my case,  it is a steady build-up that keeps me going during my workout.  The directions say to take it twenty to thirty minutes before your workout, and it definitely works that way in my case.  I take it about twenty minutes before getting started, and it slowly lifts me until my forty to sixty minute workout is complete.Each serving is only five calories, so you don't have to worry about burning any extra calories off.  The taste is somewhat medicinal, but it isn't bad.  This is one of the best blending workout powders that I've ever used.  I've only used a shaker bottle to mix this in my water, and it almost completely dissolves.This powder also contains a bit of creatine (1 gram per serving), which helps build and recover muscles during and after a workout.I really like this powder and highly recommend it.

I've used Dove Men + products in the past, and I am very impressed with them for the most part.  This Dove Men + Care Body Wash is no exception.  The moisturizing elements of this wash do exactly what Dove claims that they can do.  After just a couple of showers, I noticed my skin feeling much softer than normal.  My skin is normally very dry in certain areas and I have to use lotion (and, my goodness, how I hate lotion), so this Extra Fresh Body Wash definitely makes it easier for me to put on less lotion.The scent, as with all of the Dove products I've used in recent years, lasts all day long but isn't overbearing.  It smells quite nice, is light, and keeps you from smelling too bad after a long day at work.The cooling agent in this wash is a nice added touch, but it quickly dies off after getting out of the shower.  It's definitely a pick-me-up when getting ready for work in the morning, but don't expect to stay "cool" all day.The only reason that I'm taking off one star on this product is the fact that I have to use more of this body wash during a shower.  Other Dove products and most other body washes only require me to place a small amount on my scrubber and I'm good for the whole shower.  With this body wash, however, the lather vanishes after I clean the upper half of my body and I have to add more soap to my scrubber.  That could prove to be costly in the long run if you have to use more body wash than you normally do.Despite this shortfall, I still recommend Dove Men + Care Extra Fresh Body Wash.

I wear different shoes for different types of excercise.  For high impact training (Insanity, T25, etc.), Under Armour is my go-to brand.  For walking and general use throughout the day, FILA is the brand that I trust.  When I hit the trails, Adidas is on my feet.  For track running, though, I've never found that one company that I trust more than any other....until now.For years I alternated between Puma, Nike, and FILA for running.  Nike was the leader of the pack for a few years, but something changed (either in my feet or in Nike's shoe construction) that made them uncomfortable to me.  Puma is excellent, but after getting a few miles on them, they start to slip on my feet.  FILA is great at first, but the shoes don't hold up that well for very long.These Mizuno Wave Enigma 5 shoes have been excellent so far, and I don't see myself tossing them in the backup bin any time soon.  The first thing that I noticed about these shoes was how cool they look.  Bright blue with a little yellow on the soles makes these shoes look great.  When I put them on, though, it was the overall comfort that blew me away.  The arch support is exceptional, and the heel cushioning is wonderful.  The laces hold fast and the shoe stays snug on my feet as I'm running in them.  The toe cap is minimal and doesn't get in the way.These shoes made me feel "faster" (but the clock brought me back down to earth) and I really enjoy wearing them.  They are excellent and I highly recommend them!

If you have a child entering or currently in high school this year, the Five Star Locker Organizer is perfect for them to keep a few notes handy, doodle between classes, or hang up a few pictures in their locker.  The organizer features a top half that has a magnetic surface (four magnets are included as well) where you can attach pictures, notes, or very light items on the board.  It's also a dry erase surface (with an included magnetic dry erase marker), so you can write notes or draw on the surface and erase it as you please.The bottom half of the organizer features a cushion surface where you can stick notes with the four included pins.The organizer also features a large magnet on the back of its surface, so you can attach it just about anywhere in a standard metal locker.This is a neat little organizer that I am sure will come in handy for any high schooler (or even some middle schoolers).  Grab one before school starts up in the fall!

Mead's Five Star line beefs up the traditional notebook with their Advanced Spiral Notebook.  It's heavy duty for heavy school work!  This notebook features perforated college-ruled paper, features five colored and movable dividers with pockets, a nifty pencil holder on the front cover, and a tough cover over the traditional wire spiral that keeps everything in place.They didn't have such a thing when I was growing up.  I frequently fought with tangled spirals (and got stabbed by said spirals many times), couldn't increase or decrease the size of any of the subjects in my five subject notebook, and the only pencil holder that I had was my ear!  These kids these days have it easy!  Mead's turning me into a grandpa!I highly recommend this notebook.  Mead's Five Star Spiral Notebook deserves five stars!

I've eaten my share of protein bars in the last few years.  Some were good, but most of them were strictly functional and not flavorful.  Well, Pure Protein's Tropical Fruit Macadamia Fruit and Nut Bar definitely has flavor, but almost too much of a good thing.  When I bite into most protein bars, I've come to expect mild sweetness at best, but in the case of the Tropical Fruit Macadamia bar, the sweetness is almost too much, and that is without any artificial sweeteners.  That gave me reason enough to knock off one star in my review.I took off another star due to the fact that despite having eighteen grams of protein, this bar left me hungry and didn't help me recover quickly.  Clif Bars (which have less protein) and protein shakes always help me recover after a workout, but these bars just didn't do the trick.So, if you like your protein bars tasting like candy, this is the bar for you.  It's not terrible, just too much.  The protein is there as well, but I just don't feel it.

**Full Disclosure:  Item received in return for honest review**I've been doing Insanity and other high impact aerobic workouts for a long time.  I also enjoy hiking when time allows.  When I decide to take a break from any of these workouts or programs, starting back up can be a pain on my legs.  I've had my share of shin splints over the years, but I've never used any type of compression sleeves until now.These Zensah Camo Compression Leg Sleeves help to keep everything in place while working out, especially during my Insanity routines.  I have no leg pain whatsover since using these and I look forward to sliding them on every day because they are extremely comfortable.  They are breathable and retain their shape and compression as well.These particular sleeves are purple camo, and my wife chuckled at me a bit when I first put them on.  However, after trying them out for herself, she wants her own pair.Highly recommended to anybody that runs, does high impact training, or participates in long distance events.

Based on the Batman Unlimited cartoons, this Batman and CybeRex toy combines Batman, robots, dinosaurs, and disc-launching weaponry to form an excellent toy that any kid can enjoy.  My son (and let's be honest, myself as well) really likes all of the aforementioned things, so this toy is perfect for him (and me).The toy is of a good size and the only assembly necessary is attaching the tail to the dino body.  Batman can be seated inside the CybeRex' spine and with a squeeze of the trigger under the tail, the disc launcher and Batman cockpit lift out of the dino spine.  Four discs can be fired from the launcher and you can adjust the angle of the launch by simply moving the CybeRex' tail.  The launcher can then be closed by simply pushing it back in place or by squeezing the trigger again to put the launcher back in position.The dino's rib cage can be opened to contain villains as well.This toy is meant for children, so adult collectors looking for some wonderfully detailed creation will be disappointed (unless said adult collector actually likes playing with toys, because this thing is fun).  Batman isn't very well articulated, but none of the figures in this line are, so this is no surprise to me.  This toy is compatible with most of the other figures in this line, and although there is a Joker figure included in all of the promotional material and on the box, the figure is not included with the CybeRex and Batman.  However, this is clearly stated on the packaging and in the promotional material, so I don't see where his not being included is a problem.My son has a couple of other toys from this line and he likes them for the most part.  The CybeRex, however, has proven to be the most popular toy yet.In all honesty, this Batman fan of nearly forty years enjoys this toy almost as much as his son!  Highly recommended.

If you are a regular reader of my reviews, you already know that my son and I have collected a number of the Titan Hero series figures from Hasbro.  They all have at least five points of articulation, but in the case of Thor, he features seven total POA (head, shoulders, hips, and wrists).  They usually feature just one (if any) accessories and in the case of Thor, Mjolnir is right at his side.  The hammer is a cool accessory, but much like the recent Titan Hero Series figures of Star Lord and Rocket Raccoon, Thor has a hard time holding Mjolnir properly in his hand.  Since this figure will primarily be a display figure (he's mine, I claimed him from my son, haha), that isn't too much of a problem.Thor comes with a cloth cape which is nice.  I'm not a very big fan of vinyl capes on larger figures, and I'm really glad that Thor got the cloth treatment with this figure. While it may not flow in the wind, it definitely looks good on the God of Thunder's back.What sets the Titan Hero Tech series apart from the regular Titan figures is the added component of the figures talking and (at least in the case of the Age of Ultron figures) interacting with the Hulk Buster figure.  Thor says multiple phrases in a voice that attempts (but fails) to sound like Chris Hemsworth.  The phrases are cool and my son and I both enjoy them.Overall, this is a pretty cool figure.  I do plan on getting a few more of these figures in the future.  I knocked off a star for the limited articulation on the head of the figure (hampered by Thor's golden locks) and the poor-fitting Mjolnir in Thor's hand.  Other than those two setbacks, this figure is cool.

Whether you are getting ready for a Halloween bash or just decorating for a horror film marathon, the DII Halloween table runner is an excellent choice for adding a bit of "spooky" to your event.  This runner is 18" wide and 72" long and spiders and stars are all about its webby design.  I've actually thought about using this for comic and horror conventions as a table accent as well as for Halloween parties in the very near future.The runner is 100% polyester and is also machine washable.  It looks great on a table and is an excellent bit of decoration.  I highly recommend it!

This body wash has a very pleasant and very light floral scent.  My wife has been using it for a few days now and I used it myself a couple of times as well.  The primary claim of this body wash is that it holds its scent on your skin for up to twelve hours and that it also has "fragrance release" technology that releases the scent of the wash when you touch your skin.Well, the "up to" part of the "up to twelve hours" takes precedence over the "twelve hours" portion.  In fact, the scent wears off in less than two hours after every single shower that my wife takes.  The "fragrance release" technology is flawed as well, because no matter how hard I press on my wife's skin, she smells no better than she did after getting out of the shower.In short, Caress' Love Forever Body Wash would be better advertised as "Love For A Couple Of Hours."  It does have a good scent and it does feel excellent on the skin, but it falls short on its primary claims.

I was offered the Stainmaster Chainlink Area Rug through the Amazon Vine Program.  When I ordered it, I wasn't expecting very much.  I figured it would just be a standard area rug that had nothing special about it.  I was wrong.For starters, the chainlink pattern is much, much more appealing in person.  The photo on the web does not do it justice.  It looks very good on the living room floor.  Also, the fabric used is very soft and quite warm if you lay on it for a bit.Being a Stainmaster carpet, it's also very easy to keep clean, which is essential in a home with two kids and a cat!My favorite aspect of this rug is the fact that it is very slip resistant.  We've had plenty of area rugs over the years, but this one holds its place quite well compared to the others.Overall this is an excellent area rug.  I highly recommend it.

Nivea makes me think of the the summer time with this product.  I want palm trees and lovely tanned ladies surrounding me!  I've always been impressed by Nivea products.  They almost always deliver on any claims that they make, and they come through again with their Coconut Body Wash.The claim is that this body wash refreshes and moisturizes the skin.  My skin is notoriously dry, especially during the winter, so I always have lotions and moisturizing body washes handy this time of year.  Does Nivea's body wash keep my skin moisturized?  Absolutely.  I've noticed a marked improvement in my skin, especially in my face and hands, which seem to suffer the most this time of year.As far as the refreshing bit is concerned, I do feel clean and a tad bit more alive after using this body wash, but I believe that that is primarily due to the fact that the coconut scent is so wonderful.  Smelling coconut while I'm in the shower quickly brings me to the much warmer (okay, really hot) summers of Louisiana.  The scent is clean and, yes, refreshing.The scent isn't too powerful after you get out of the shower and get on with your day, but I still smell clean.Basically this is another great product from Nivea.  I'm sure they've got more wonderful products waiting in the wings.Recommended.

Perfumes, eau de toilettes, powders, etc. are essentially a matter of opinion when it comes to their scent.  For that reason, I feel like the Laura Biagiotti Roma Eau de Toilette is a bit of a downer as far as I'm concerned.  Why?  For lack of a better description, I'd say that it has an "old lady smell" to it.  To bring a bit of clarity to this description, I suggest trying to remember back to the old lady or grandmother that smelled nice, but wore a perfume that smelled like an old lady would wear it.This eau de toilette does not stink at all.  It has a pleasant vanilla and musk scent to it, it just doesn't smell like something anybody under the age of sixty might want to wear on their body.  It's a nice fragrance and it lasts a long time, it just smells a bit....dated.So, if you enjoy dated or "old lady" fragrances, this eau de toilette gets five stars for you.  If you are under the age of sixty, though, you might want to skip this fragrance.

My eyes are a bit odd.  I wear presciptions glasses due to the fact that one eye is near-sighted and the other is far-sighted, but I primarily wear them at night (when glare also affects me) and whenever I'm doing very intensive work at a very close proximity to my face (I work with punchdown blocks, ethernet crimpers, small boards, etc.).  Doing this type of work can wreak havoc on my eyes, but my glasses help me a lot.When reading, I can usually make do without wearing glasses, but every once in awhile I have to break out my "cheaters" to assist me.  It was with this in mind that I decided to give Foster Grant's James Multifocus Glasses a whirl.For starters, I had an immediate headache when I put these on my noggin.  It took me quite a long time to adjust to these babies.  The three different levels are nice to have, but caused dizziness until I finally adjusted to them.  The lower level is for reading.  The middle level is for seeing things at a range a bit farther from your face (laptops, computer monitors, etc.).  The top level is for viewing things at a distance (across the room or just a bit closer).Of the three levels, I use the lower one the most.  I rarely use the other ones, but they are there if needed.I will say that these glasses are very well made.  They look pretty sharp and are very sturdy.So why three stars?  They aren't for everybody.  I would definitely try a pair on before purchasing them.  The three levels can take some getting used to (or not getting used to at all), so take that into consideration as well.Overall, these are decent glasses, but I really don't need all three levels.

Chef-mate's Que Bueno White Queso sauce is an excellent choice as a stand-alone cheese dip, as a topping for spicy Mexican dishes, or as an added component to any beef or chicken based dish.The chiles and jalepeno add just enough heat to tell you that they mean business but without burning your tongue.  The texture of the sauce is thick and creamy but not so thick that you have to cut a chunk out of the dip with your chip.The container is big, so be sure to invite a lot of friends over or separate it into smaller containers for later use.  My family and I had a "cheese" party to help knock a considerable hole in the can, but we still have a good amount of sauce left over.Overall, this is a very good sauce that works well on its own and as part of a sauce featuring beef or chicken.  Recommended.

There are tons of travel guides on the market these days. Setting one apart from another can be quite difficult, but National Geographic manages to set itself apart with its Traveler series.  This particular volume, Ireland, gives us an in depth look at the Emerald Isle and prepares just about anyone for their journey to this wonderful country.The volume starts off with "Charting Your Trip."  It's a brief informational section that lightly covers essentials like what to pack, when and where to go (depending on time of year and length of stay), and other useful topics.  Again, this is basically a "gloss over" for the rest of the book.  Once you've read this section, you get to move on to a quick overview of Ireland's history and a glimpse at the country's current vibe.  From there you get a deeper breakdown of the country as broken into seven different regions.Each region features an introduction, a map (with area maps that break down the region even more throughout each section), highlighted walks or drives from the viewpoint of the author, Christopher Somerville, featured locations, and an excellent description of each region's highlight and "must see" locales and events.The final section, "Travelwise" gives the reader a nice breakdown of hotels, restaurants, entertainment, etc.As always, National Geographic has loaded this volume with plenty of wonderful pictures, in depth articles, and historical diagrams.  It is essentially a large edition of the wonderful magazine that focuses entirely on Ireland.  If you read the magazine and enjoy all of the maps, articles, and pictures, you'll definitely love this book.  If you're just a curious traveler, this book will give you a wonderful look into the world of Ireland.Highly recommended.

While I definitely enjoy using as many of the latest gadgets that I can get my hands on, I'm not necessarily the most tech savvy guy out there.  I still listen to and enjoy collecting CDs, so keep that in mind while reading this review.First of all, I selected this speaker so that I could listen to my downloaded music (yep, kids, this grandpa knows how to download tunes off of the interwebz), listen to Spotify, and to take a few handsfree calls.  With just a tad bit of difficulty, I got all of these things to work.When connecting my Android Razr M, it took four attempts before the Braven 805 finally paired up with my phone.  On the first attempt, the message I got was that my phone did not recognize my device.  On the next two attempts, the message stated that the Braven 805 rejected my set.  On the final attempt, they finally paired up with one another.The first thing I did was play a Spider-Man game that was on my phone.  The sound was excellent and there was no delay between the action in the game and the sound that came out of the speaker.After playing game, I switched over to Spotify and again, the sound was excellent.  I listened to a couple of downloaded albums as well and had no problem with them.Finally I tested the speaker phone function and, for the most part, it was good.  It could have been a bit crisper, but that might be due to the connection itself between the devices.What I liked most about this speaker is how bottom heavy it is.  The sound is very good, with the treble being only slightly muffled.  I do hope that I can get another one of these speakers, as you can pair up to of them for a true stereo sound experience.Set up was fairly easy, excepting the aforementioned problems with connecting via Bluetooth, and the battery life seems to hold up pretty well (the specs say up to eighteen hours).  Also, you can charge your phone or connect an audio device directly to the speaker to play music.Overall, a very solid purchase.  I recommend it.

Coffee-mate's 2Go Triple Strength Coffee Creamer, French Vanilla, is excellent for tossing into your backpack for a road trip or in your duffel or suitcase for a longer trek from home.  It tastes pretty good (although I need more than the suggested 'dosage' to make my coffee taste just right) and at only twenty-calories, it doesn't budge your waistline too much.I use it daily at work and carry some with me when I hit the road so that I know I'll have a good creamer alternative to whatever the hotel or local gas station is offering.Convenient and tasty, I definitely recommend Coffee-mate's 2Go Triple Strength French Vanilla Creamer!

I picked up the Bionic Body Door Anchor Excercise Strap for two simple reasons:  1) It looked simple enough to use and 2) I needed something to hold my power bands instead of just my feet and back.I do not own any other Bionic Body products, but this strap can be used with other power bands (at least I use it that way).  I simply pass my power bands through the included clip after sliding the strap through the hinge side of any door in my home.  Then I pull far enough away from the door until I have tension in the bands that I am comfortable with.  Then I get in a little workout.This device is simple.  It stays put and does exactly what it promises.  Recommended.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:Selfie Stick,Premium Quality Bluetooth Self-portrait Monopod from Xtreme Accessories,pocket size with FREE Waterproof Storage Pouch (Gold)I received this a week ago and had time today to evaluate it for review.  I have taken a series of photos of it in case anyone is interested.This Xtreme Accessories selfie stick is part of the Locust Series.  Whats great about it is that it has 20 hours of battery life and only takes half an hour to charge based on the specs.  Thats pretty reasonable when youre traveling afar on a trip using the selfie stick and all of a sudden it powers out.  Half an hour is pretty much the time it would take to have a lunch break somewhere to charge this using a power bank or external battery source if a wall outlet is not available.  I would like to see this selfie stick being self-powered by the audio jack of the smartphones so that it doesnt have to rely on Bluetooth as an alternative model.The package comes with a short micro USB cable and a waterproof storage bag.  The bag itself is the first in the 5+ selfie sticks that Ive ever tried or gotten a chance to purchase.  Other brands just offer the selfie stick and micro USB cable and one would think, how would you travel around with this if it gets raining and the wall seeps into the micro USB charging port, which is fully exposed and does not have a cover flap to keep the water from entering in?  Youd have a possibly damaged selfie stick in those cases.  So Xtreme Accessories provides a very useful solution with this bag.  The bag itself is tall enough to not only hold the selfie stick and micro USB cable based on my tests, but also has a few inches of height left to store any other essentials into it.  It has the top corner knots to pull outwards and seal up the top of the hole of the pouch.  Very useful and handy.  I like Xtreme Accessories over this simple addition.When not storing away, theres a loop strap at the bottom base of the selfie stick so that you can hook it to your wrist.  From there, theres a fastener to adjust to the size of your width to have it cling on in case you have butter fingers or sweaty hands and it slips away from your grip.The pole extends out from the shortest being 7 and 1/4th inches and fully extended is 29 inches.The phone clip can freely rotate up to 270 degrees and does so in a way where you can have it bent 90 degrees in reference to the base handle for a front facing selfie shot using the front camera of the smartphone, or you can flip it the other way, in which there may be better resolution with the rear facing camera, time, and measure taking a photo with the rear camera facing you.  Ive tried that before.  Sometimes the pole gets in the way you have to make adjustments to retake the shot.  But, while youre not able to see yourself to easily measure to take the shot, if you practice, you end up getting higher resolution shots.The phone clip is adjustable to different sized phones to fit the landscape position into the clip with the expandable spring.  Theres a rubber coating on not only the base handle but also the phone clip so that everything rests comfortably without causing abrasions or scratches to the phone or to the hand grip.The camera button is flush on this model from Xtreme Accessories with the base handle.  This is a first for me because other brands of selfie sticks have the camera button which bulges out and not only does it bulge out, but it makes a mechanical click sound when you press down on it to hear the responsiveness.  With the Xtreme Accessories model, you can be more stealth mode with this by pressing down on it and you dont hear a thing.  I pressed it many times and you dont hear anything, so that can be useful for secret or hidden shots at the point of focus.The power on and Bluetooth pairing process was easy because even though the User Manual is emphasized in Chinese, I was able to figure it out by holding down the camera button long enough for it to power on Blue and flash blue when in pairing mode.  The pairing is simple on the iPhone because of the Bluetooth settings.  The blue light on the camera button is useful to know when the selfie stick is on or off.  If its OFF, the camera button will never light up.  But if its ON, then the camera button light is always on.Overall, I enjoyed taking selfies of myself while using this selfie stick and now I have a safe storage to put the selfie stick when not in use to prevent it from getting dirty or wet.  I can hang this on a door knob or hook if desired.  A much improved design to Bluetooth powered selfie sticks.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:Kingyou KF01 Classic Premium Stereo Headphones with Mic and 1 Button Control(Red)I received this product a few days ago and had time today to evaluate it for a review.  I have also included a set of photos in case anyone is interested.This headphone came in a nice and easy to open cardboard box with a lime color label of the product, website, and e-mail information.After opening the box, I was quite surprised.  On the Amazon product page, it said a Gift package but I didnt know what that meant.  Inside was a lime color tough shell zipper case that contained the headphones and a zip bag of two pairs of earbuds.  Outside of that was a zip bag with a Micro USB cable branded with Kingyou on it.  There was also a nice small microfiber cloth and a Velcro strap.  Although the headphones inside were kept tucked with a twist tie, you could use the reusable Velcro strap to hold the wiring together in a loop when you put the headphones away in the zipper case.Overall, I was impressed by the package.  I have received headphones before by other brands in this price range, but they never provided all of what Kingyou provided with its headphones.  This is nearly a complete kit of what youd need to travel with your Kingyou headphones.  Very attractive in this regards.After untwisting the tie to loosen the cables, I put the headphones with the preinstalled medium sized earbuds on and was able to fit it using the L and R notations on the bottom of the earpieces to know which one to put in which ear, which is important because theyre designed to be angled in a certain way to fit the ear.  I just twisted in until there was a seal.Previously, I tried an MEE Audio RX18 headphones and although that one had good noise cancellation technology, this headphone from Kingyou when plugged into the smartphone or tablet and listening to a radio station, you could hear everything around pretty well.  It does lower the environmental noise slightly, but not really good at that.  I think since these headphones werent specified to be noise reducing the environment, so nothing against them in that regards.  As a suggestion for improving models, I suggest that they add the noise cancellation technology into their headphones to make them even better.I tested listening to some Alternative Rock music using my AOL Radio app for about half an hour and felt the good sound quality through these headphones.  Even though I could hear and notice whats around me, I was able to enjoy listening to the music through these headphones without having to crank up the volume very loudly.  I think these are the types of headphones that Id switch to using if I wanted to be aware of my surroundings without ruining the enjoyment of listening to music.All of the instrumentations and vocals in the songs I heard could be heard well without muffling or hissing.I tested making a phone call to myself using a landline and talked into the microphone of the headphones which is near the right side of the earpiece where it rests near your cheek, and I was able to hear myself loud and clear through the speakerphone and echo back into the headphones.  It sounded quite loud and clear.  I was impressed.One of the benefits of this headphone over other headphones in this price range of $10 to $20 is that the headphones are small and portable.  They are not too distracting to look at.  Although it takes more effort to dig into your ear to twist them off, they are more hidden from view than other brands of in-ear headphones.  The built in mic is a benefit and it picks up on the voice very well.  At first, I didnt like the design when I saw it out of the zipper bag thinking it would get in the way, but it ends up being in a good location towards the mouth.Overall, I think these are good headphones from a company that I never heard of before from anyone else until this past week.  Kingyou makes good headphones.  If theres anything Id like to add, Id like for them to make better looking colors for their headphones.  Hopefully theyll expand their lines of headphones and create some more light versus darker shaded color designs.The package and the headphones are both impressive.  Ill be keeping my eyes out on them more now.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:MEE Audio RX18 Comfort-Fit In-Ear Headphones with Enhanced Bass (White)I received this product last week and had time to evaluate it today for a review.This product came in a standard retail packaging.  I actually dont prefer this type of packaging because while its neat and has a clear display of the contents, its tough to break open and remove the contents.  I had to find a gardening tool to snip long the edges to open up one half in order to access everything inside and pull it out.  Not a user friendly packaging.  I suggest MEE Audio just bundle this into a zipper pouch and put it in a sealed cardboard box with the graphical design on the box.  These hard plastic enclosures can cause injury.  So this is a suggestion.Upon removing the contents, I found the cardboard insert was a small pamphlet of information about how to use the headphones, change the ear tips, proper cleaning and maintenance to avoid injury and damage to yourself and the headphones.The white headphones I had were a nice coating.  Smooth polished look to the ear pieces.  Theres an L and an R on each ear piece so that you know which side to put it into your ear because they are designed at an angle to fit each ear.  These letters may not be too clear or obvious, but under some lighting you can see it.  They molded it in the same color as the headphones, so its transparent without the molding sticking out.This headphone comes preinstalled with a medium sized ear tips.  There are two pairs of ear tips that can be used for different sized ear canals to help you get a proper sealed fit.The cable itself is long enough to stretch down from your ears to beyond your typical pants or shorts pockets.  It may maximize the length up to your knees which shouldnt be stressed that far, but you get that extra slack of cable so that when you put the phone into your pocket with this headphone plugged into the jack, you can move around your head and turn with having extra slack to accommodate for those movements without yanking the ear tips out of your ears.Whats nice about these headphones is that not only are they easy to put in your ears and comfortable, but they drown out some environmental noise.  While I was walking around with music playing at a low volume on my iPhone, I found that it blocked out the television sports programming and commercials pretty well up close when the volume of the TV was reasonable to hear.  I was able though to hear my family talk to me when close by, so it doesnt totally block out everything, and you probably dont want it to block out everything where it can be a safety issue.  I could hear my voice drown and go deer with these on.  You can hear the cables move though while you turn your head, but I notice that with all headphones that are wired and so that really cant be avoided.The music quality is pretty good for a $8 pair of headphones.  If I go to the retail store like Best Buy, Frys, Target, or others and buy this price range of headphones, not only will I not get the noise canceling technology, but the audio quality for the bass and other features may not be on par with these headphones from MEE Audio.For these priced at $7.99 currently on Amazon, they are more than a bargain for the value that you get.I would ask for features like, having a built in microphone to use this for calling, and perhaps sweat proof or sweat resistant technology, but then the price wouldnt make sense and theyd be at a loss to incorporate those features into a $7.99 product.  For $19.99, possibly.Overall, I have been listening to Alternative Rock music in my AOL Radio app while writing this review with these headphones on and I have not broken a sweat, felt uncomfortable from the ear tips, or had issues with the connectivity of the music going from the audio jack to my ears.  And this is at a low volume setting because I just want to relax and test it out.  The instrumental quality is heard clearly with these headphones.  Since they do not require battery usage, its given me a different perspective on wired versus wireless headphones and the technology comparisons that you can provide in both for the same price.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:Meal Prep Republic Stackable Plastic Food Containers - Stackable, Microwave & Freezer Safe, Reusable, 28 Oz (Set of Seven)I received this product last week and had time today to evaluate it for a review.  I have also taken a series of photos in case anyone is interested.The set of 7 containers arrived wrapped on plastic to seal it from debris and keep it untouched from the factory.Inside the package was a card insert that read that these Meal Prep Republic Containers are:- Stackable- BPA Free- Microwave/Freezer Safe- Dishwasher Safe- And each container is 28 oz capacity- Made in CanadaThe back of the insert mentioned Do not microwave the lids.  I contacted meal prep about this and they told me while these components are microwave safe, they do not recommend microwaving the lids under high levels of heat because it can cause minor deformation of the lids.  Its not a safety issue though because these products are BPA free.  They recommend using food grade plastic wrap or Saran Wrap to cover the containers when being microwaved.I like how these appear to be a simple construction design.  They remind me of disposable lunch meal trays in cafeterias, only these are reusable.  The lids themselves have an interesting design in the interior.The lids snap on the tray fairly easily with a small click around the edges.  They looked very thin at first and didnt have a strong locking snap, so I did a water test with it.  I poured water from the sink into the tray, closed the lid shut all around, and inverted the tray sideways to tilt it to see if water would come out.  I tried every side and corner and there was no leakage.  That lets me know that the containers are not defective and if I were to cook meals with soup or other liquids inside, I dont have to worry about tipping this over and having it spill out.Overall, I like how these contains are because theyre at a size where its reasonable and reminds me of how much is enough for the time of day so that I dont overeat and I can watch my weight.  It also helps remind me to eat healthier options using rice and vegetable store into this container.  Theres enough for one day of each week to go through for the lunch hour for those who go to work.  For those who use them for 3 meals a day, then these will last you through a couple of days at a time before you need to wash and reuse them.  They are dishwasher safe, but Id hand wash them with liquid soap and let them air dry near a window before putting them away.The company offers a 100% satisfaction guarantee, which is very nice of them.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This review is for the product listed on Amazon as:Stainless Steel Designer Door Wedge with Non-Skid Rubber Threads and Metal Handle - Easily Wedges Door Gaps up to 1.2 InchesI received this product last week and had time today for a review.This product is pretty small.  Its the first time that Ive ordered a door stopper.  Previously, I was using tin cans and laundry detergent boxes to hold weight against doors from the wind slamming them shut.  Although that was embarrassing to look at, it was a cheap and easy solution.But recently, I found out about BlueOrchids and gave their product a try.The product packaging was nice.  It came in a hard shell cardboard box with a lot of useful information such as:- Stainless steel design with TPR plastic treads- Can handle tile, stone, wood, carpet, etc- Fits all door types such as glass, metal, wood, and more- Does not slide or damage floorsI held it in my hand and while the material is touch and good in quality, it is light weight as expected for a door stopper.  I wouldnt expect to pull or carry around something like this that weighed more than 5 pounds.The rubber threads when I received it was sort of deformed unfortunately.  It wasnt like what was pictured in the box.  Likely from a sloppy assembly.  But fortunately, I was able to fix it easily by using my finger nails to adjust them since they freely move around with some effort, so I was able to straight then out.I did notice on my unit a damaged rubber thread in which it looked like someone knifed part of it and caused an obvious cut into one of the threads, so I contacted the seller about it to let them be aware of the issue and am in the process of getting a replacement.  Since these are specific issues related to my unit, then I wont hurt their ratings over it as long as their customer service is good, so those observations wont directly impact this review rating.The ring shaped handle is very secure and does not move around.  It is stuck in place which allows you to be able to fit a few fingers to grip to pull out or hold it to carry around.  It feels pretty good.I tested this door stopper first on my garage entrance door, which is a wooden door with a metal strip at the bottom, onto a wooden laminated floor surface.  I fit the door stopper in and pulled against the door.  With a lot of effort, the door stopper would move slightly but keep the door held at bay from slamming shut.  This was after repeatedly swinging the door into the door stopper.  Now in reality, the wind blowing may not have this kind of close range force onto the door like what Im doing with my hand, but I was just trying the more extreme cases.  Because it is rubber threads, there is friction, but it will move a little a lot of force.  But the good news is that it fit my door and it held it pretty well.I even went into my garage to try it on my garage door that leads to the backyard.  Thats also a wooden door, but on a concrete floor.  It too held well and kept the door from slamming shut.Overall, pretty good experience.  I would say that the rubber threads collect a lot of debris easily, so for handling purposes, youll want to wash it off occasionally in the sink or outside and dab it dry with a paper towel.I like this door stopper overall, with the exception of a few cosmetic issues that Ive contacted the seller about.  The quality of the material is pretty good and for a door stopper, it did its job.  Now, I can prepare well for this season of hard winds to keep the door still while I air out my garage after parking the car instead of having the garage opened for security purposes.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:Apple Lightning Cord,Idaye MFi Certified 3M/10ft Nylon Braided USB Apple Cable Charging Cord for iPhone 5 /5c / 6 / 6 Plus/ 6s, iPod 7, iPad mini1/2/3, iPad Air / Air 2. (silver-3m/10ft)I received this product earlier this week and spent the last couple of days evaluating it for a review.I elected to get the Silver color just because I have too many white and black cables and wanted something different.The cable came in a nice cardboard box with the back describing a long list of Apple compatible products.  But basically, any product from Apple that uses a lightning cable connector will do.Whats nice about the cable from Idaye is that they are MFI Certified, which means theyve passed Apples standards for testing and design to allow them to be sold as an approved third party cable.  I find other sellers on Amazon not stating MFI certified and I dont bother to buy them because they may damage the Apple devices battery from frequent use based on articles that Ive read.  So MFI is the way to go.Inside the box was the lighting cable wrapped in a plastic bag and with a detachable Velcro strap.  The Velcro strap is nice because its much tougher to seal and is reusable than a twist ties that other 3rd parties provide.In looking at the cable, my first impression was, wow, these connector heads are pretty thick and big, and thats a good thing.  I hated my Apple OEM lightning cables that rea small, thin, and slippery to grip on, which makes it difficult to grip and pull out when using multiport chargers that have ports sandwiched close together.With this Idaye cable, I measured it as:- The lightning cable connector head is 5/8th inch long by  inch wide by 1/4th inch thickI took a photo of the comparison between the Apple OEM cable and the one by Idaye.  The little differences in measurement makes a big difference in comfort.In looking at the Nylon Braided design, it feels pretty thick and tough.  It is flexible in terms of how I can bend the shape of it in any direction and it will shape to it.The reason why I chose the 10 foot one was because I got tired of charging my iPhone and iPad leaving it on the ground because the 3 ft. cable provided by Apple wasnt long enough for me to reach my office desk table top.  But with this 10 ft. cable, Im able to move around more fluidly around my desk while it is charging from my charging station on the floor, which gives me more freedom to use it while charging.  I also thought about it in my vehicles perspective and having a longer cable will allow passengers from the back to charge their devices while it is charged towards the front side power outlet using a car charger.Overall, after 2 days of testing and 2 overnight charges from a nearly depleted iPhone, I found no issues using this lightning cable from a defective perspective. Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:Shannon Baby Car Seat Cover Lined with Ultra Soft Minky Fleece (Navy Blue Polka Dot With Soft Navy Blue Minky Fleece)I received this product yesterday and had time today to review.Shannon Baby is a small family owned business as described in the card insert when I opened up the package to take a look at the fleece. Hi,This is my review of the product listed on Amazon as:WODISON Basic Waterproof Sports Gym Sackpack Bag Lightweight Drawstring BackpackI received this product yesterday and had time today to evaluate it for review.  I have taken a set of photos of it and in use in case anyone is interested.This backpack was folded in 3 and packaged in a candy wrap sealed bag when it arrived from Amazon.The bag is made from a high quality nylon material and it feels very nice all around.  Not too rough to rub against.  Like any drawstring, the opening is at the top which can collapse by pulling both sides of the straps outwards to close it.  You can open it by prying out from the hole that was collapsed.  Like any drawstring bag, the hole of the sack does not create a complete seal, so be careful about what liquids may fall in there.  This bag is rated as waterproof, but I think the waterproof is based on the exterior of the bag and does not account for rainfall into the opening hole into the sack.  Considering that your clothes are likely to take the hit and not your personal accessories like your wallet, which is in one of the zipped compartments, it should be fine.There is a large compartment on the outside of the bag that is zipped up and can fit up to 9 inches in height and 8 inches in width of material.  Its pretty open ended what you can put in here.  For example, I could put my eyeglass case in there, my wallet, and some lotion trial sizes.Theres a small compartment within the sack that is enclosed when you compress the top hole opening which can be used to place more secure items, such as a wallet or keys.  That main compartment measures about 7 inches long and 5 inches wide to give it some perspective.These straps are very thick and comfortable.  I havent seen this type of cushioned thickness in the straps for quite some time.  Im used to getting drawstring bags and backpacks at corporate or advertising events and those straps tend to be thin and uncomfortable when it comes to added weight.  But here with Wodison, they are called soft carton shoulder straps and when worn on, provide comfort when handling the weight of gym clothes.I was able to place as an example my sweatpants, t-shirt, and pair of socks inside the sack and tie it up to wear around for a while without any noticeable issue.  Clothes are going to be fairly lightweight and this sackbag is intended for light weight baggage and not for school textbooks.Having a bag like this helps go around and travel lightly without the need of a duffle bag for storing clothes.  This gym bag is a more compact and mobile way to travel and walk from your car to the gym and back with your personal belongings secure, enclosed, and protected against light rainfall.The design creates an open ended solution to how different types of users can pack and store their belongings for a trip to the gym or to an event where lightweight carry-on is the key.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:LAX Apple Certified [1 Year Warranty] iPhone Lightning Cable (4 FT Long) for iPhone 5 5S 6 6s 6S iPad Air iPad mini (Gray)I received this product yesterday and had time yesterday and overnight to evaluate this for review.The package came very nicely like a retail package that Id find at my local electronics store.  It even has the hook on top for the racks.  The box is easily reusable because of this design.  The front has a close up of the Lighting cable ends on it.The sides describe some information such as how this is a braided design, measures about 4 feet long, and is MFI certified.  For the longest time, Ive been trying to look for a third party lightning cable that was MFI Certified.  Buyers beware that on Amazon there are third party sellers selling lightning cables but dont say that its MFI so I wouldnt buy those if I were you because theyre not through the tested certification and approval process by Apples standards.  Bad cables can damage the phone or tablets battery, so always look for MFI Certified which is what this LAX brand mentions on the product page and on the box.Upon taking it out of the box, I found the color that I bought, Gray, looked very nice.  It looks different and is easily distinguishable from my Apple OEM lightning cable.  The cable has a nice glossy finish that shines under lighting.  You can see the nylon braided design.The cable itself feels very tough and durable.  It doesnt compress when you pinch down on it.  It feels tough.Both sides of the lightning cable have the LAX brand name so you cannot confuse this with other gray cable from other third parties.  Both the lightning cable head and the USB Type A head feel pretty smooth to rub onto, but they are not slippery to grip.I tested this cable yesterday by plugging it to my LED Desk Lamp that has a USB port and plugged my iPhone 5s to it.  It charged it right away.  I left it charging overnight for 5 hours and woke up to find my iPhone was fully charged without any issues.I used my iPhone all day today and it did not appear to have any issues from the charge.The benefit of this cable is that it is a little longer than the standard Apple OEM cable.  This one from LAX is mentioned as 4 feet, which is 48 inches, but it is actually shorter by 1 inch, and also, the cable length portion is more like 45 inches, but it is still a good length to work around and move at your desk if your charger is on the table top.  It allows more freedom to move around with this cable.Considering how tough this cable feels and how flexible it is, I find this to be a good replacement to my Apple OEM cable to carry around as my primary cable and leave the Apple OEM cable at home.  I think that LAX has a good quality lightning cable that it offers to the general public.I was initially uncertain how the LAX cable would be being that its an unfamiliar brand to me, but after trying it, I am satisfied of their quality of producing these cables.  I would recommend it and look more into its product line.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:Mpow Easytalk Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless Headset Headphone Universal Business Earpiece with Loud Voice, CSR8615 Technology for iPhone 6S 6S plus Galaxy S6 S5 and iOS android SmartphonesI received this product yesterday and had time yesterday and today to evaluate it in detail to provide a detailed review.  I have also taken a series of photos in case anyone is interested.UNBOXING AND OBSERVATIONS:The Mpow EasyTalk came in a nice small black box that looks very much detailed like a retail store shelf box.  The top of the box has the picture of the Bluetooth headset, the Mpow logo and some symbols that indicate its usage.  The back of the box has a QR Code that can be scanned to provide more product details.After opening the box, I found the EasyTalk was nice placed snug within a sheet of foam that kept it still.  Removing the foam showed that it was held in a plastic cardboard cutout  After removing those layers, underneath that were a couple of plastic zip lock bags that contained 2 pairs of ear hooks, a 26 feet micro USB cable, and a roughly 20-inch-long micro USB Mono Single Stereo Earphone.There was also an Instruction Manual that was provided which I looked into right away and I recommend all users read prior to using the product.Some notables in the Instruction Manual includes:Specifications:- Bluetooth Standard v4.0- Frequency Range 2.4GHz- Operation: Class 2- Bluetooth Mode: A2DP, AVRCP- Operation Range: Up to 30 feet- Talk/Play Time: About 4 hours- Standby Time: Up to 130 hours- Charging time: About 2.5 hoursTo comment on some of these specs.Bluetooth 4.0 is the current standard for mobile accessories.  Some products do come out currently with Bluetooth 4.1, but 4.0 is very common and modern for any mobile accessory to get your hands on.  Its more energy efficient and steady with the signal than previous Bluetooth versions.The Frequency Range of 2.4 GHz is common to where using this headset will require some precaution because since theres many devices that operate on 2.4 GHz, there may be occasional interference depending on where you are and that can lead to reception issues.Talk and Play Time of 4 hours is OK.  On Amazons product page, it says 5 hours, so Im not sure why theres a difference between the Instructions Manual and the Amazon Product Page.  I suggest Mpow updates one or the other for consistency.  But even if it was 5 hours, this makes this Bluetooth headset a low to mid-range quality headset.  Theres some Bluetooth model from 2014 that I purchased for a relative called the Plantronics M55 and that one is currently priced at $32 on Amazon which is a little higher price, but offers 11 hours of play/talk time, and as I see more models roll out, I start seeing more headsets close to that double digit range of battery life for usage.  I think 4 to 5 hours will accommodate most people who dont talk to friends and family all day.  In my case, I could go at work and talk on the phone during traffic hours in the morning for up to 2 hours, then at lunch time for 1 hour, and then the drive home for up to 2 hours, and Id use up most if not all of the battery life of the headset in which Id charge overnight to use the next day.  If there are types of users who casually use their phones to make small chat calls throughout the day, I think that 4-5 hours should be sufficient.  If youre running into the holiday or celebratory dates and increase your talk time to friends, family, and coworkers, youll likely need to take a break in the middle of the day to charge your Bluetooth headset.  Thats when those double digit headsets would be handy, which last about the same amount of time as your fully charged smartphone would.  So its a preference and situation in the year.  I suggest Mpow creates a newer model headset that offers better battery life to keep it competitive and stand out among other headset models.Charge time of 2.5 hours is reasonable and common for Bluetooth headsets.In looking at the Bluetooth headset, it has a simple oval design.  The volume buttons are small, but responsive with a plus or minus symbol at the top side of the headset.  Oddly, I found the minus volume down button to sound more mechanically responsive for each button press than the volume up plus button.The microphone hole is at the bottom of the EasyTalk.Theres a multifunction button thats on the outer side where theres the Mpow brand name on the headset which has a circular metallic design to it.  It responds fairly loudly to button presses compared to the volume buttons.The micro USB port is completely opened and exposed.  It is located at the opposite side of the volume buttons.The ear bud is a silicon shaped piece that comes preinstalled on the EasyTalk.  The small hook is very flexible and moves around easily.  Theres a small cutout hole to control the direction of the sound coming out of the earphone.Theres 2 ear hooks thats provided in the package, which are a smooth flexible plastic that molds into the shape of part of your ear.The EasyTalk feels smoothly polished and nice to hold onto it.  Its small like any other Bluetooth headset to put away when not in use.Next was trying out the headset and features:USAGE:The first thing that I did do was charge the EasyTalk since the Instructions Manual stated to do so.  The side of the EasyTalk will light up red when its charging and turn off when fully charged.Next, I paired the EasyTalk to my iPhone 5s, which was simple because you hold down the multifunction button on the side of the headset for about 5 seconds which causes the LED to flicker red and blue.  On my iPhone 5s, the Bluetooth device is listed as Mpow Easytalk, so pairing was simple.I put the EasyTalk into my ear without the ear hook first to see how it fitted and felt like because I hadnt had my own Bluetooth headset before.  The result was that the small ear hook thats on the earbud provides some stability where it tucks under the antihelix of the ear and provides a fit.  Its definitely better than not having it out at all.  Because of this current design, its very easy to pull out or push in the Bluetooth headset, which can be desirable if youre lazy, but also easily prone to theft by someone walking by and swiping it out of your ear, which Ive found is easy to do with this current setup without the ear hook.The earbud is a one size earbud thats provided by Mpow.  I suggest that they provide other shaped and sized earbuds rather than just one size.  This one in particular held into my ear canal, but it was not a snug and fully enclosed fit.  There was an air pocket opening that made it feel a little loose.In looking at myself with this worn on, I felt pretty good.  It is noticeable, but not too bad.I turned on the EasyTalk by holding down the multifunction button for about 3 seconds which you could hear some alien type of sound effect to indicate that it is on.  The nice feature about this Easytalk is that it has a battery level indicator that I can see on my iPhone to let me preview how much battery is left.  While its not completely accurate and updated precisely, its better than nothing.  Not all Bluetooth devices support this feature on smartphones.One of the issues I had while trying out this headset is that when you press the multifunction button when worn on your ear, it makes a loud noticeable clicking noise and pushes the headset inwards deeper into your ear temporarily.  I wouldve liked to see the headset be subtler and responsive.  I suggest Mpow improve this feature.  I found it a little annoying when I was testing out with music and calls with the features like end call, redial, play, pause, and others and having the headset shift around and make a loud noise into my ears.  The volume button makes less noise when being pressed while worn on.I first tested listening to music because I wanted to test out the audio quality heard through the headset.  From my results, I was using AOL Radio to listen to some streaming music and found that I had to raise the volume of the Bluetooth about one third of the way up to hear well with the headset.  I found a better experience later on when testing plugging in the Mono Single Stereo Earphone to have audio from both sides of my ears.  That accessory piece is useful and provides enough length to have the cable stay in front underneath your chin or hang resting on the back of your neck.  For me, either way felt uncomfortable at first and needed some time to get used to.  I wouldve liked seeing a little adjuster piece to tighten up the slack that was remaining in the cable that dangled around so that it wouldnt irritate my skin as much with the loose wiring.  It needs to be loose to accommodate different users head sizes, but having the adjustment after flipping the cord in front or back would be helpful.  I suggest Mpow consider this piece to be added in future models or to review if its worthwhile to add it.I listened to the music for a while and it ended up being nice to have as an added feature.  A Bluetooth headset will not beat traditional Bluetooth headphones for audio quality, but it will be good as a secondary feature to have if you dont have that accessory around to use this as an interim.  Theres no clearly recognizable bass heard through this headset when running a bass test on my YouTube app, but thats fine.  Its just good to have the music playing option available when in need.The next test that I did was install the ear hook onto the headset.  It was simple by using the horseshoe shaped end of it and pressing onto the area in-between the headset and the earbuds.  It snapped in place pretty easily and from there, you could rotate the ear hook forward or backward.  Ive found to place this newly installed headset onto your ear to be a little tricky.  Its best to turn the ear hook about 90 degrees in reference to the headset, then get it wrapped over the flap of your ear, the upper helix, and from there, then push to fit in the earbud into your ear and make the proper final adjustments for a snug fit.  Then you can rotate the ear hook towards the back of you to get it a snug fit.  The ear hook makes a big difference in stability.  I shook my head around and tilted my head or reached down and it kept it fairly still.  Its a much different experience than the earbuds by themselves with the small hook.  However, putting on the headset with the hook on can be a bit of a pain to get used to when you want to put the headset on really quick because you have to make several adjustments for the fit to work out.  But once its on then youre good.I did a few tests yesterday and today of making calls, one to a friend for about 53 minutes with the fully setup headset on, and a few today calling to an advice nurse and a making voice mails to myself using my Magic Jack home phone.With my first test with my friend, I talked walking around within 5-10 feet from my phone placed on the kitchen table and he didnt complain of hearing me.  We had a good conversation.  I was in a quiet room and talking to him with the volume about 1/3rd up and I was able to hear him, but it was sort of lower in volume output than expected.  I had this Bluetooth volume setting on my headphones and it could hear the music loudly.  So I kept note of that.  But the good news is that while talking to him, his voice didnt really drown out, crackle, or cut off.  I was able to hear him well and have a good conversation.  That was yesterday.Today, I talked to an advice nurse and this time while waiting on the phone, I decided to test the Bluetooth connectivity while walking around the floor of my house.  The waiting music tone was playing so I was able to walk around and test when the music got choppy.  Within 10 feet, everything was good, clear, and a stable connection for the most part.  Music was heard clearly without no choppiness.  But then about 20 feet away when I started to walk across some of the dry walls, then I could tell the music started to get choppy.  When I walked back closer to my phone, then it got smooth again.  So based on this test and my household, I couldnt get the targeted 30 feet of signal clarity and stability from this Bluetooth 4.0 headset that I could get with my Bluetooth 4.0 speakers that Ive tested walking the same route.  It could be because the headset has a smaller Bluetooth antenna.When I talked to the nurse, she had a hard time hearing me well and it could be because my voice comes across as muffled a little, so I didnt factor that into evaluating the headset.What I did instead, was call and leave a 3 to 5 minute voice message on my Magic Jack phone and then play the voice mail file on my laptop so that I could hear my voice playback.  I compared that with recording a voice mail of me not using the Bluetooth headset and talking directly from my iPhone.  In comparing the two results, I found that the iPhone reception and call quality was a little louder, but more distinctive in picking up my speech that allowed better clarity in the playback.  Comparing that with the EasyTalk, I found at the same volume on my laptops speaker, the EasyTalk was a little quieter with the microphone less sensitive in picking up my voice than the iPhones microphone.  Also, my speech did not come out as clear as the iPhones test.  So from these results, talking directly from my iPhone was a better call quality experience than from the EasyTalk.  But the point of the EasyTalk is to be hands free, so this makes it considerably reasonable to have when driving or walking around without having to hold the phone onto you.  The differences in call quality was noticeable, but not a heavy contrast.IN SUMMARY:PROS:1) Comes with a set of accessories for the Bluetooth headset to prepare for different situations2) Volume and multifunction buttons are very responsive3) Smooth and polished lookCONS:1) Inconsistent statements made on the battery life between Amazon product page and Instructions Manual.  Is it 4 hours or 5 hours working time?2) Preinstalled earbud was a little loose in my ears and not adjustable because of no additional accessories for it3) Multifunction button clicks a little loud and pushes the headset into your ear canal for each button press4) Call quality not as close to 1:1 when comparing between recorded calls through EasyTalk compared to my iPhones built in microphone5) Bluetooth connectivity did not reach as far past 20 feet without getting choppy call quality based on testing indoorsSUGGESTIONS:1) Update the Amazon Product Page or Instructions Manual for consistent and accurate test measurements on the total play/talk time under one full charge2) Improve the battery life to near 10 hours to be more competitive with newer released Bluetooth headsets that approach double digits and compare with the current battery life of smartphones3) Provide different sized earbuds for different ear canal sizes and ear shape fits4) Make the multifunction button design to be subtler and respond with a softer button press5) Add a tightened piece to the micro USB Mono Single Stereo Earphone to remove some of the slack that dangles around the front or back of you when worn6) Improve the sensitivity of picking up the users voice from the EasyTalk microphone for better speech clarity and loudness7) Improve the Bluetooth antennae design for better signal connectivity and data transmission stabilityUSER SCENARIOS:This product would be useful for those who:1) Want to talk while driving2) Have their hands occupied while walking aroundOverall, I think this is a good accommodation for users who want to talk but cant hold their phone because of certain legal issues, not having your hands available, or just simply wanting to walk around hands free.  There are some issues with this EasyTalk model that needs improvement in terms of battery life, usability, and call quality that Ive mentioned that Mpow can work on for future models.  But if someone is in need of a solution, then the EasyTalk is second best for talking than holding your own smartphone.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience and how to improve the product.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review for the product listed on Amazon as:iPhone Cable,[Apple MFI Certified] Mpow 8-Pin Lightning to USB Cable Cord 3.3 Feet-2 PackI received this package last week and had time today to write a review.  I have included a set of photos in case anyone is interested.UNBOXING AND OBSERVATION:The pair of lightning cables comes in a small box that indicates that its a 2 pack and shows a preview photo of the connector heads of the lightning cable.  The back of the box talks about how its MFI certified, which is very important.  I would not tough any lightning cable from any third party brand that does not state MFI certified on their cables because cables that are not certified can cause damage or harm to the battery.  Fortunately, MPow passed the Apple standards to sell as MFI.Upon opening the box, I found the two cables tied up inside with a white tie wrap.  What struck me right away when looking at the cables tied up is the following:1) They look like thick connector heads for the lightning connector and USB type A connector, which is a plus because I got frustrated with Apple branded cables that are so small and slick2) The lightning connector head has the Mpow brand imprinted on it to identify this cable from other third party brands3) The whiteness in appearance of the cable looks quite refreshing compared to my Apple cablesWhen loosening up the cables, I measured them to check and got the following measurements:- The full extent of the cable end to end measures about 40 inches, with 38 inches being the cord length.- The lightning connector head measures about 5/8th inch long by 3/8th inch wide by 1/4th inch thick- The USB Type A connector head measures about 11/16th inch long by 5/8th inch wide by 1/4th inch thickPretty good numbers there.  Every 1/8th of an inch more is very helpful with grip to pull and push into the smartphone or tablet charger port or especially when its challenging to pull out the USB end of the cable out of the USB ports on tightly squeezed multiport chargers.I would say that these connector ends made from Mpow are smooth, but theyre not slick or slippery like the Apple cables.  While I wouldve liked seeing a design that has some grooves into it for traction and grip, I tested pulling and pushing the cable ends with Mpow and had no issues with them.The connector ends curve like a U shape rather than a rectangular shape like the Apple cables.The thickness reminds like a chewable tablet.  Its comfortable to pinch with your thumb and finger to get a good grip.The cord itself doesnt compress as easily as the Apple cables when pinched hard, which I did as a test because I wanted to make sure these werent flimsy cables that couldnt withstand the strength of a person because these cables will need to be designed to handle some more extreme cases like the body weight of a person sitting on a wheeled chair and rolling over the cable.The Mpow brand name printed on the lightning connector head has a silver glossy appearance which shines under a light source.  It makes it easy to identify so I keep track of which cables Im using at all times.USAGE:I tested plugging in my iPhone 5s to the Mpow lightning cable and plugged it into my Anker lamp that has a USB port and it started to charge right away.  Both cables charged right away and worked, which shows no signs of defects in these new shipments.IN SUMMARY:PROS:1) Thicker connector heads provide an easier grip than Apple Lightning Cables2) Mpow brand name makes it easy to identify between Apples cable and other 3rd party cables3) Brighter white looking cable than the standard Apple cables4) Easy to push and pull the cable when plugged into a USB portCONS:NoneSUGGESTIONS:1) Add some groove design in the connector ends to provide better traction and grip.  Lose the smooth polishing finish.2) Create longer cables for multi-purpose use.  Newer releases are in 6 feet length and longer up to 10 feet, which allow devices to be charged from the wall to tabletops or to be used from the backseat of a car.USER SCENARIOS:People who would benefit from this product are those who:1) Need spare cables to use at different locations than the single cable their Apple product came with2) Need a replacement for their faulty third party or Apple cable3) Need a cheaper solution than the premium cost of an Apple lighting cableOverall, I am quite pleased with these Mpow cables.  They will be great as spares to leave one in the vehicle glove compartment and at the work office, so that Im covered everywhere I go and never have to remind myself to bring one cable with me.  Ill have them all placed at different locations now with the help of these 2 packs.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer to give a detailed review of the user experience and how to improve the product.  I am also providing this review to help prospective buyers make smart informed decisions.I hope you like my photos.Thanks for reading my review.

Hi,This is my review of the product listed on Amazon as:[2-Pack] Poweradd Nylon Braided Stereo Audio Cable (6.6 Feet + 3.3 Feet) Gold Plated 3.5mm Male to Male AUX Cable for iPhone, iPad, iPod, Android and More  GrayI received this product last week and had time today to write a detailed review.  I have also taken a series of photos in case anyone is interested.UNBOXING AND OBSERVATIONS:The product came in a small mini lunch bag type of packaging that had a seal on the top loop of the brown bag to cut open with a blade or scissors.  The bag is conveniently reusable after that to store or put away those cables or any short length mobile accessory cables.One side of the bag has the name of the product, color display so that you know which one youve received correctly, a checkbox mark to verify before opening the box which cable length(s) you received, and some selling points for using these cables.The other side has the serial number barcode.Upon opening up the package, I found the two cables, 3 feet and 6 feet, winded up and tied down to fit the packaging.My initial impressions when looking at the cables is that these look like very thin wire gauges to fit into this nylon braided coating.  Theyre thinner than the Anker audio cable that I currently own that is thicker and of a different coated material.Being that its nylon braided, there is noticeable friction when rubbing back and forth against the cables, but these are not retractable cables, so they dont cause skin irritation like other nylon material.It bends and flexes around pretty easily and effortlessly, although I should note that because the cable was winded up a certain way and stored like that for a long duration of time, when you leave them alone, they naturally want to curl up the way they were originally packaged.  But, I can freely move around the cable to bend or turn them in any direction without much of any resistance.  Thats one of the benefits of a nylon braided design.The color of the coating is a charcoal gray, which looks kind of nice if youre used to seeing black colored cables all the time.I did a quick test to pinch the cable with my thumb and finger tightly and I didnt feel it compress to where I could damage the internal wiring with my own weighted pressure.At the end of each cable wiring is the connector head which has the PowerAdd brand name on it so that you do not mix up similar looking wires from different brands or generics together.The connector head where you can hold the handle is about 9/16th inches long, so that gives you an idea of how much room there is to grip with your thumb and finger.  This is shorter in comparison to the Anker audio cable that I have, but in testing out the grip, it feels sufficient what PowerAdd designed the length as and shouldnt be much of any problem for someone with typical sized thumb and fingertips.This audio cable has gold connectors with green stripes on them and from my understanding, gold connectors for audio or charging cables are a more premium quality and provide better performance.USAGE:The reason why I selected in the 2 pack was because I like the idea of being able to switch between a short 3 feet cable for certain scenarios while keeping in mind when longer cables may be useful, such as the 6 feet cable.For my test, I tried taking them to work and putting them in my glove compartment.  It takes me over an hour one way to go to work in the recent months, so I had plenty of time to evaluate and spot defects.I first tried out the 3 feet cable.  My vehicle has a AUX input that connects this cable to my iPhone 5s.  I then had the ignition on and set my music to AOL Radio to listen to a station while heading to work.  The music started to play after the connection and selection was made just fine.  I adjusted the volume on my vehicles volume knob and drove into traffic for about 1.5 hours listening to different tracks from my phone while using the data connection and had no issues with the PowerAdd audio cable not transferring the music data from my phone to vehicle.The 3 feet cable was nice because I was able to freely have enough slack from plugging it in the AUX input thats on the center infotainment system display and had room to move my phone between the front drive to passenger side.  If I wanted to, I could use a phone mount to mount the phone to my windshield and plug the audio cable to it and still have the cable length stretch to fit the AUX input.Alternatively, I tested the 6 feet cable on the way home from work for 1.5 hours.
